story:
Thank you for choosing Darma  :D    Please note that your order would be fulfilled within 3 days and your contact number is needed for the fulfillment. Please kindly provide it to

(Click it) hello@darma.co

 

Let's talk about sitting...

Recent studies have linked sedentary behavior (measured by time spent sitting) to higher rates of obesity, Type 2 Diabetes, cardiovascular disease, and premature death. Physical inactivity is the second leading cause of death in the U.S. and the fourth in the world.

What the media is saying...

Also featured in...

Meet Darma

Darma is the world's first "inactivity tracker" - a non-invasive smart cushion to monitor your sitting habits and improve your physical and mental health. Darma uses novel sensor technology and algorithms to offer actionable guidance to improve posture, balance sitting time and reduce stress.

 

How can Darma help you?

Darma gives you more than data. It learns your sitting habits to present you with actionable coaching, from stand-up reminders, to posture advice, to tailored stretching guidance. Darma communicates all of this through our iPhone and Android app or via your desktop computer.

Darma detects your posture and lets you know when you've been slouching for too long. Even better, it provides you live feedback and teaches you to sit properly, by extending the spine and engaging your core muscles.

Darma monitors your sitting time and offers reminders to make sure you take enough breaks throughout the day.

Everyone's sitting habits are unique. Therefore, Darma provides personal guidance by studying your individual habits and posture. It identifies specific areas of neck, back, and hip pain for each user and then suggests personalized stretches to help.

Darma's sensors are accurate enough to even detect and monitor your vitals including heart rate, heartbeat waveform, respiratory rate, and breathing waveform.

Since Darma knows your vital signs, it can establish a baseline and detect when your stress level is too high. It then suggests a brief breathing exercise to help you relax and regain your focus.

Darma is named after Bodhidharma, the father of Zen and meditation. Our goal is to bring wisdom to everyday sitting.

Darma is for you if...

  • You sit for many hours each day
  • You have poor posture
  • You suffer from back pain
  • You care about maintaining your health

What are experts saying?

How is Darma different from other tracking devices?

Technology and Specs

Our newly designed sensor is just 1mm thick. Coupled with patented cutting-edge fiber optic sensor technology developed over five years of research, we measure everything from respiration, to heart rate, to stress levels, to posture more effectively and accurately than products currently on the market. Best of all, we've made it affordable!

Printed Circuit Board (PCB) design evolution

How Darma was born

Our team has experienced back pain firsthand. Being hard-working engineers, we spent long hours sitting in front of our computer or in our lab, developing fiber optic sensor technologies. When back pain started interfering with our productivity, we did some research. Of course we knew that bad posture wasn’t great for us, but never had we realized just how much damage sitting really caused! We decided to develop our technology for a product that would help us and our loved ones sit better, feel better, and lead longer, healthier lives. We created Darma. 

How the rest of us met is a different story. Serendipity has amusing ways to sneak into life! But we’ll keep that story for some other time…

 

Our 'rockstar' advisors

Darma is honored to count Dr. Joan Vernikos, PhD and former Director of Life Sciences at NASA as its scientific advisor. Dr. Vernikos is the author of Sitting Kills, Moving Heals and a renowned figure in the field of sedentary health.

Hundreds of pro athletes and dozens of teams have relied on Dana Santas’ expertise to integrate yoga into their training programs. Darma is fortunate to tap into Dana’s knowledge of functional movement, stretching and breathing.

The game GuitarHero owes its existence to Charles and Kai Huang, founders of Red Octane. Their unique experience building a playful combination of hardware and software to global success is also a key asset of Darma.

story:
Why STERNA? It's The Airplane for everyone

Henry Ford in the beginning of the 20th century developed automotive industry with one main inspiration:

"Design the car which will not be just a commodity for the rich people, make it so cheap that every family can have it"
Today, in the 21st century, our vision is not so different than the Henry Ford's philosophy. We want to create an affordable aircraft so that every family in the world can buy one, use it and fly it!


Our vision and mission is to make everyone able to fly. How are we going to do that?

  • Simplicity and compactness - The STERNA design makes production work flows simple and ready for mass-production.
  • State of the art technology - Reduces production costs making the STERNA VLA affordable.
  • End to end solution - Designed to be safe & simple to maintain and easy to operate.
  • High flight safety - The STERNA design includes installation of an emergency parachute for the entire aircraft (not just individual passengers), fire protection devices and electronic equipment for flight data collecting.
  • Monitor your flying experience - Flight data collection will enable software support allowing you to analyse your flying experience and enhance it thanks to a series of recommendations.
  • Significantly lower price (3-4x times) compared to other planes in same category (MVP, Icon). As soon as we start large scale mass production, we'll be able to reduce the price even more!

Join us and you will experience the power of flight.

Cockpit sketch up

Plywood fuselage mock up

Fuselage structure

Wing parts and whole structure

Flaps structure in assembly tool

Featured In

Supported by

This is just a beginning, why not fly further more?

Features and airplane specification

STERNA Very Light Aircraft Perks!

Development & production timeline

Where will the funds go

Building of factory for cheap, safe and powerful aircraft is not trivial. We have already raised a significant amount towards creating a design. We have also submitted our project to the CAA (Civil Aviation Authorities) and we are expecting certificate pretty soon. But we can not develop a series of STERNA without you.


Your help will also allow us to attract more smart, talented, passionate engineers and pilots to join our journey.

Who are we: Visionaries, Engineers and Experts in different fields

STERNA was founded one year ago as a family company with experts in Aeronautical, Quality, Design and Software field with strong background and experience for more than a decade. We all shared a dream to have an end to end flying experience for everyone. Since foundation of the company, we have also attracted the best test pilots to join our efforts. Our team:

Ivan Dundjerski - M.Sc. Mechanical engineering - used to be CEO of the UTVA Aviation Factory, Airworthiness inspector, lead a lot of different aeronautical projects.

Dragan Stankovic - M.Sc. Mechanical engineering - used to work in the UTVA Aviation Factory as a Quality Assurance Engineer.

Zarko Bubalo - M.Sc. Mechanical engineering - used to work in the UTVA Aviation Factory as an Aeronautical engineer on projects with BOEING.

Jasmina Dundjerski Gluvajic - M.Sc. Mechanical engineering - used to work in multiple cargo aviation companies on maintenance of the Ilyushin Il-76.

Svetislav Sekulic - M.Sc. Mechanical engineering - used to work in the UTVA Aviation Factory and IAI Bedec.

Ivana Jovanovic Dundjerski - M.Sc. Forestry engineering - wrote master thesis on forest protection from Air.

Nikola Anovic - M.Sc. Mechanical engineering - young enthusiastic engineer who joined our efforts after his graduation.

Bosko Todorovic - Test pilot and flight instructor - used to fly Mig21 in Air Force.

Franc Hudomal - Test pilot and flight instructor - used to fly Mig21, Orao, Super Galeb G4, Lasta while he was a test pilot in Air Force.

Boban Davidovic - M.Sc. Software engineering and management - currently working as an architect of large information systems and technical adviser.

Dejan Dundjerski - M.Sc. Software engineering - founder of General Aviation LogBook web service and software adviser.

Take off with us and experience unforgettable feeling of flight!

Frequently Asked Questions:

How we designed the initial model?

Initial efforts started by developing Butterfly and Vila project in beginning of the '90 when Ivan Dundjerski was CEO in the UTVA Aviation Factory. During that time our engineers produced and tested different prototypes. Based on that experience, during previous year, Zarko Bubalo and Ivan Dundjerski with other collaborators created a modern version of very light aircraft using modern software tools like Pro Engineer and CATIA.

How much testing has been done so far?

Up to this moment, we have done first series of static testing on wing, fuselage and all critical parts. As soon as we receive positive conclusion from CAA (Civil Aviation Authority) we will continue testing of prototype both on ground and in flight.

Will it be sold in the United States?

Plan is to offer STERNA VLA world wide.

Are there any safety certifications?

All activities in this project are under supervision of CAA (Civil Aviation Authority). After we complete testing of prototype, CAA will issue a Type Certificate.

Will it need FAA certification?

Since we have submitted this project to our local CAA authority, generally speaking it is up to FAA if they will accept certification from our local CAA or not. We have investigated latest USA FAA laws in this field and so far we are expecting that FAA will accept type certificate from CAA of Serbia. If from some unknown reason that does not happen, we will resubmit certification directly to FAA as well.

What are the materials used to build STERNA VLA?

  • Wing is made from aero aluminium alloys (2024 ASTM, AlMg3)
  • Fuselage frame is made from steel tubes (Chrome vanadium WL 1.7734)
  • Fuselage skin is made from composite materials.

What are it’s safety features?

STERNA VLA design includes parachute for whole aircraft, not just for individual persons.

Fuselage has roll-bar design. In case of crash, construction stays solid. Seat belts for pilot and copilot are fixed in four different points.

When it comes to fire, design includes fire protection devices in engine compartment which will prevent any kind of fire automatically in less than a second (order of milliseconds).

Except direct mechanisms like parachute and auto fire extinguishers we will have indirect mechanisms which will increase safety significantly. STERNA VLA will have data recording devices (something like black box in commercial airplanes) which will track all the data both on the ground and in flight. In that way STERNA servers will be able to track behavior of the engine, plane and your experience with STERNA VLA in real time. This data will be used for automatic filling of logbook (both for pilot and plane), maintenance tracking and in the end it will provide set of recommendations which will be sent to STERNA pilot/owner.

How about storage of the STERNA VLA when not in flight?

Decomposition of wings is very easy and quick operation for pilot and one additional pair of hands. In 15 minutes with minimum set of tools you will be able to disassemble your wings. If you would like to keep your STERNA VLA in garage, 13 ft (4 m) wide garage should be enough.

Is a pilot's license required?

Yes, pilot license for VLA aircraft is required. Our best test pilots and instructors can provide training for you!

Can STERNA be flown by a person who have certain level of physical disability?

We have received couple asks if STERNA can be flown by a person who have certain level of physical disability. Our response was "Not yet" but then we asked our selves why not?

STERNA team is proud to announce that our engineers started designing flying controls in order to allow disabled people to fly!

We really want to make a plane for everyone!

Help us to take off and achieve high altitude on social networks :)

We would be more than happy if you would help us sharing STERNA ideas and visions. Please share this campaign with your friends and family.

Thank you!

If you have any other proposals, you would like to discuss and share your thoughts, you would like to get involved? Please do not hesitate to contact us and we will be more than happy to chat with you.

story:
Short Summary

The Turin Sports Museum is the first and only dedicated to all sports in 
Italy. In spite of the richness of the collection, the sparkling of more 
than 3000 memorabilia and thousands of efforts to address the needs of the 
visitors, the Museum is actually not enough well known and it is risking the 
closure. We need to give it more visibility, to create an opportune 
advertising and marketing campaign in Italy and abroad.
Our main goals are:
  • We truely believe sport can affect positive change in society and we want to be a strong voice in the dialogue regarding ethichs in sport and protect the integrity of sport by showing and promote fair play.
  • We want to continue to promote and spread sport's values among young 
  • people and let olders' be catched by sport epics. 
  • We need to improve our school program to teach kids important life lessons, to give students the opportunity to know and share those values inherent in sport that can help them to become better citizens: fairness, excellence, inclusion, respect, health, team spirit, accountability, solidarity, tolerance and integrity. Values that are fundamental not only to sport but also to everyday life.
  • We need to get more visitors to make legends live again in the hearts of 
  • people, to keep alive the memory of Muhammad Ali and Ayrton Senna, Pelè 
  • and George Best, Fausto Coppi and Marco Pantani, Michael Jordan and Eddy 
  • Mercks, Diana Bianchedi and Bobby Locke, Michael Schumacher and Pietro 
  • Mennea. 
  • We want to keep on improving in order to be ready to give 
  • prominence to new Champions and sports disciplines and to keep on 
  • recording exploits and living an "Olympiad" without space and time.
You can help us with any amount of money and also with objects to be exhibited.
story_txt:
Short Summary 

The Turin Sports Museum is the first and only dedicated to all sports in Italy. In spite of the richness of the collection, the sparkling of more than 3000 memorabilia and thousands of efforts to address the needs of the visitors, the Museum is actually not enough well known and it is risking the closure. We need to give it more visibility, to create an opportune advertising and marketing campaign in Italy and abroad.Our main goals are:
We truely believe sport can affect positive change in society and we want to be a strong voice in the dialogue regarding ethichs in sport and protect the integrity of sport by showing and promote fair play.

We want to continue to promote and spread sport's values among young 

people and let olders' be catched by sport epics. 

We need to improve our school program to teach kids important life lessons, to give students the opportunity to know and share those values inherent in sport that can help them to become better citizens: fairness, excellence, inclusion, respect, health, team spirit, accountability, solidarity, tolerance and integrity. Values that are fundamental not only to sport but also to everyday life.

We need to get more visitors to make legends live again in the hearts of 

people, to keep alive the memory of Muhammad Ali and Ayrton Senna, Pelè 

and George Best, Fausto Coppi and Marco Pantani, Michael Jordan and Eddy 

Mercks, Diana Bianchedi and Bobby Locke, Michael Schumacher and Pietro 

Mennea. 

We want to keep on improving in order to be ready to give 

prominence to new Champions and sports disciplines and to keep on 

recording exploits and living an "Olympiad" without space and time.


You can help us with any amount of money and also with objects to be exhibited.

story:
Support Team For Slo Mo' Grow, Reboot!

We are the North America IT team of a local Delaware company and we ask you to support our Movember team in raising money to change the face of men's health!

Our resident bowler will bowl nine league games in the month of Movember.  

Update - Clarification

Unfortunately I think I confused some of you in tying pledges to bowling scores. 

All pledges should be made now, following how well I bowl is an entertaining feature of the campaign.

The intention of linking the pledging to my bowling was to keep people coming back each week in November to see how the fundraising activity would spur on my bowling scores. 

Please pledge what you can and enjoy the weekly updates on how well I am bowling to drive attention to this campaign.

Week 1 - Score update!

Came out firing in week 1, posting a 684 series on games of  209, 258 and 217.  If you were pledging per pin, ouch!  

If you haven't pledged yet, please pledge what you can below.  Let's all support men's health!

Pledge below!

Please make your pledge below and then tell your friends about this novel fundraising effort!

Together we can reach our fundraising goal and make a difference in men's health.

All funds go directly to the Movember foundation

Running total: 684 (3 games bowled, 6 games to go)

story:
Imagine this with me for just a moment if you can... You go to the fridge and there's some clean, ice cold water. That satisfaction is like no other, especially on a hot day!! Now, imagine this same situation, except there is no refrigerator, there is no clean, ice cold water, and everyday is hot. This is an opportunity to help people that have never known that feeling of enjoying that fresh cup of water on a hot day. It's an opportunity to give back to those who have next to nothing. It's an opportunity to say that we care, and mean it. The things that we take for granted in our everyday lives are treasures to those who do not have them. So, give if you're able, and prayers are welcome if you cannot! 

My wife and I are running with Team World Vision to help provide clean water for communities in Africa. The needs are real, and there is something we can do!

$50 = clean water for 1 person

Will you donate to provide clean water for 1, 2, 3, or even more people in Africa?

Together we can help change lives in Africa across Ghana, Mali, Niger, Rwanda, Kenya, Ethiopia, Uganda, Zambia.

Please feel free to donate here, or directly on the Team World Vision website by clicking here.

Thanks for your support!

Team World Vision Official Website
Our Impact
_
World Vision works with communities in desperate need to help provide things like clean water, nutritious food, education, medical care, and economic opportunity.

story:
Millions of people suffer aches and pains sitting in front of computers for long periods time which can lead to depression and stress-related illness. With a single click, PeakPerformr brings instant relief from discomfort using Award-winning 3D Yoga animation that demonstrates exactly how to stretch, breath and relax any part of the body. An interactive wellness questionnaire then calculates a wellness score that creates a personal info graph which charts progress and motivates the user to continue using the app.

PeakPerformr was built following an award from Creative England in recognition of the motivational value of the 3D Yoga animation produced by at the world renowned Bournemouth University National Computer Centre for Animation using motion capture software.  The layered process of displaying the position of the skeleton, the muscles being engaged and the breath process created by the developer is unique in the world and is a now a trademark IP asset of the company.

Similar self-improvement apps that use interactive graphics and scores are registering up to 50 million global subscribers who are willing to pay $15 a month to train alongside the content.  Key to this is the scientific evidence generated by research that proves effectiveness of the app in improving health, which is then used extensively in their marketing material.

With your help, we want to emulate this proven business model because during demonstrations of the prototype mobile app at both US & UK Health, Stress and Wellness conferences, we gained an immediate response to  participate in clinical trials from University Psychology professors and multi-national Corporate HR executives to produce scientific evidence of significant ROI health benefits through regular use of PeakPerformr.

Our plan is to use this evidence to drive a powerful marketing campaign for both the retail app and occupational health market which supports the underlying premise of the app, which is that undertaking regular “structured breaks” during the day reduces stress and absenteeism, increases emotional resilience and leads to improved productivity. There is already plenty of research evidence to support this premise which the US National Institute of Occupational Safety and Health has integrated into their branded initiative  entitled “Total Worker Health”.

PeakPerformr has been specifically designed to meet this initiative by instantly delivering exercises to perform at any time during the day, using state-of-the-art animation and audio tracks that are effective, with a visually engaging scoring system that encourages self-improvement through self-awareness.

Our goal is to make an inexpensive tool available to employers around the world that is scientifically proven to deliver financial AND health ROI gains to their company.  We want to change the way we work from a seated, static position to a more fluid, active and engaged style which is endorsed by employers.  People need to feel empowered to take charge of their health and the interactive tools contained within the app do just that, encouraging self-awareness with immediate responses to identified problems.

PeakPerformr bundles together the best technology to deliver a powerful solution to an identified need shared by millions of people.  Once it has been proven to work, we believe that it will help to create a happier, healthier and and more engaging  global work culture.

What We Need & What You Get

Earlier test versions of the proprietary 3D animation, developed over 5 years with a £22,000 Angel investment, included a mobile app entitled “Travel Yoga 3D/In the Plane & In the Car”, which received over 5000 downloads; and a demonstration DVD entitled “Office Yoga 3D”, which was tested at the Southampton Oceanographic Institute and generated requests for a desktop app version.

Following the receipt of a Creative England Starter £10K Award to build a prototype version, the company incorporated and produced the desktop app version, which is now available as a free 5-day download through the website: http://peakperformr.com.  The company also received pre-qualification assurance from the UK HMRC to distribute Tax Credits under the Seed Enterprise Investment Scheme.

The company is now seeking to raise £150,000 to develop a full version for multi-platform distribution in order to undertake clinical trials that will produce scientific evidence of significant health and productivity gains. This will enable us to create a diverse, digital marketing campaign that reaches the global self-improvement market and the occupational health intervention tool market.

The perks are allocated according to the chakra's of the body which are responsible for transformation in our journey towards self-realisation:


Muladhara

£5 secures your place in our list of subscribers where you will receive an invitation to a 30-day product launch trial and information about how the clinical trials are affecting users.


Svadhisthana

£15 places you among the family that will help grow the app by responding to our questions about how the app is affecting you during the 3-month license.


Manipura

£30 increases your authority to bring the app into the workplace as it entitles you to a 6-month license where you can make personal testimonies about the changes you are experiencing as you watch your scores grow.

Anahata

£60 is a testimony to your faith in Yoga and Deep breathing to strengthen the heart which entitles you to a 1-year license which will completely free you of the stress and discomfort of working long hours while improving your creativity.

Vishuddha

  • £120 indicates that you are a knowledge seeker who wants to make a strong commitment to seeking inner wisdom, which entitles you to a 2-year license and a share in the company (along with a tax certificate for £60, if you are a UK resident) along with dividends when the company achieves success.

    • Ajna

    £240 confirms your intuition that making real changes in the work culture can be achieved through consistent practice of self-development exercises and self-awareness questionnaires,  which entitles you to the 2-year license

    Sahasrara

    £480 brings you into full Union with our aim of ensuring workers around the world have access to a simple online tool that brings relief from pain quickly and simply, while introducing them to the benefits of Yoga, the Art of Dynamic Breathing™ and Meditation.  This entitles you to a lifetime subscription, an invitation to join the Board of Directors and attend our yearly retreats in Greece where we will share everything we have achieved to date.

    Please remember, that for every dollar/pound you invest in bringing this app to the world, our external funders will match it with their offer.  Therefore, the more you invest, the stronger we get.

    The Impact

    Millions of young people are starting their working lives in front of computers, tablets and mobiles which affect their postural health that studies show is triggering an epidemic of depression which is leading to excessive self-medication through the abuse of alcohol, recreational drugs, over-the-counter and prescription medicines.  

    PeakPerfomr can be an effective and inexpensive intervention tool that quickly provides an immediate remedy to the problems triggered by poor postural health using mobile technology and networks that engage young people.  

    The award-winning videos inspire change, which is registered through a unique scoring method, which taps into the current trend for fitness apps to provide instant results that motivates users to be the best they can be.

    The global distribution of PeakPerformr will enable a complete cultural change in the way people work, producing scientific evidence that integrating regular structured breaks into the working day empowers workers to increase their physical, mental and emotional strength, work engagement and performance. 

    The creators have a successful production track record of enterprising digital content that includes a Dti Innovation in Design Award; Mediabox Film Production Award; TAPS Writers Scheme Award; Creative England Starter 10 Award.  They were part of the London Olympic Games 2012 delivery team, managing the safe movement of 8000 people a day which is combined with  with a substantial background conducting digital marketing campaigns for major brands.

    To date, the Yoga 3D animation has trialed as a mobile app, achieving over 5000 iOS downloads.

    An Office Yoga 3D DVD derivative was tested at the UK National Health and Wellbeing Conference and the US Stress and Wellbeing Conference where Universities in the US, UK, Holland & China have all expressed a desire to participate in clinical trials which prove categorically that significant financial and health ROI can be achieved through the regular use of PeakPerformr.

    Risks & Challenges

    Our Desktop prototype version was produced on a small budget, which has affected the content provision and access.  With your generous support, we can upgrade the content and improve access with our team, which has the right balance of technical skills, project management and proven creativity to match the challenge.

    Achieving downloads in the competitive app market, which is swamped with regular releases, needs careful planning and a precise marketing strategy that is supported by the media, both traditional and online.  We have seen existing apps that have achieved excellent market penetration and with your financial strength to support a similar strategy, we are confident that PeakPerformr can excel. 

    Global clinical trials with the Universities who have come forward will need extensive planning and coordination, making sure the trials are scoped correctly to produce the kind of ROI benefits that are attractive to employers in each country. Our personal development director has extensive experience designing, sourcing and delivering self-improvement programmes to major corporations and is ideally placed to scope the trials in a manner that creates ROI benefits for HR executives on a global scale.

    Maintaining a strong cash-flow position during the early stages of development before sales are achieved requires good budgeting.  Our accountant has worked closely with us to produce a concise Profit & Loss spreadsheet and a Cash Flow projection that will be our bible throughout the 5-year growth plan.  He will continue to be an important asset in maintaining a clear and transparent financial view of the project as it moves through the various stages.

    The websites linked to each member of the team that are shown on our website can provide a more detailed picture of our strengths, but we outline them here now for your convenience: 

    David - has been producing innovative theatre and film for years, winning both awards and audiences through his ability to identify needs and then designing solutions that are entertaining and informative. A native Californian, personal development has always been a powerful motivator, leading David to mastering the art of Tai Chi Ch’uan, Hatha Yoga and Transcendental Meditation, which he has shared as a teacher for over 30 years.

    Elvira - Is a talented dramatic Actress who has performed on the Ancient Stage of the Odeon of Herodes Atticus in Athens and then adapted her talents to teach Yoga, becoming a Yoga Elder and Therapist, participating in clinical studies into the effects of regular Yoga practice on diabetics at the Royal Bournemouth Hospital Diabetes Clinic.

    Sue -  worked for years as a Senior HR specialist with large global corporations such as KPMG while developing her skills as a personal development manager, eventually forming her own company that now delivers personal, bespoke programmes to senior executives.

    Steve - has a unique degree in Human Factoring Engineering that covers both computer technology and psychology, enabling him to project manage complex computer projects like PeakPerformr that use technology to drive behavioural change.  He has been very successful in managing digital marketing campaigns for major brands that capitalise on an appealing asset that is simple to deliver and reaches a broad audience.

    Adrian - is an expert film editor who has used his skill to create appealing social network campaigns for well-known artists such as Jet Lee, using a collage of digital assets that attract large audiences through their links and inherent visual quality. 

    Please let us know if you have any questions, comments or suggestions!

    Email us at info@newjusticefilms.co.uk

    Please note that our team will try as hard as possible to answer any and all questions and comments that are left on the comments page but the easiest way to get immediate assistance is to email our Support Team.

    Don't forget to like and follow us for the latest information on all things PeakPerformr

    Like Us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/peakperformr

    Send us a tweet: @peakperformr

    Email David at david@newjusticefilms.co.uk

    (Quick note: I love hearing from backers, Twitter is preferred to email. If you need to email me, cc Support so that other members of the team receive it as well)

    Clinical Trials, Distribution, Retail, Partnerships: info@newjusticefilms.co.uk

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

    We know that you can't always make a contribution and that's cool, but if you could plaster this link all over your Facebook, Twitter and any other blogs or social media platforms you subscribe to, then we would be uber grateful.

    Thanks for stopping by.

story:
The joy of running is being crushed by technology. It’s terrible to see. People are becoming more concerned with capturing data than enjoying their run. They analyze every movement, measure every action, track every step. Turn everything into points. What's going on?

The ROOband is designed to put the power back in the hands of the runner, to reconnect us with what really matters, to put the fun back into run.


The ROOband keeps track of your activity and provides you with all the data you really need. It is the first wearable fitness tracker that is entirely analog. That's right. It requires no batteries, no downloads, no Bluetooth, no syncing. 

It works with any smart phone or device, or none at all. It fits on your wrist and can be wherever you are. The ROOband’s soft natural materials are timeless, providing an experience that no other digital wearable fitness device can offer.

The ROOband is the most relevant running product in years.


Back in 1979 running used to be a lot of fun (just look at the picture above). We want to return to the spirit of that  time. It was this feeling that inspired runner Bob Gamm to develop an innovative technology, changing the course of running forever: The shoe with the pocket. 

It’s time for an update on Bob’s idea:



The ROOband is in direct contact with your your skin. When running, your body will start to emit ‘effort’, commonly called ‘sweat’. Your effort will be absorbed by the Rooband. Then, after each session, you can squeeze the ROOband to output your effort, allowing you to measure your progress with an easily quantifiable result.




Since the ROOband doesn’t need any electrical power, you can wear it nonstop night and day, all year round. Because effort is exuded throughout the day, you can even measure activities like sitting in a sauna, or sunbathing. The ROOband even tracks what you eat. 




One of the features we are particularly proud of is what we call Open Pocket Technology (O.P.T.) 

Open Pocket Technology is compatible with any object or device, so long as it is relatively small. You can’t put little objects in any other wearable tracking device on the market.





We are a team of likeminded experts. We have come together to realize our ambition of bringing joy back to running.The ROOband is more than a product. It’s an idea. Wearing a ROOband is a statement. It says ‘I love to run. But I don’t want to be told when to run or how to run. I run for joy.’


The ROOband is nearly complete. The funds we receive will be used to make the ROOband as amazing as possible, and to develop further innovations like the hands free version. Please help us achieve our targets and make our dream come true.

We are testing our prototypes every time we do something, striving to refine the ROOband right up to the beginning of manufacturing. Now we want to get it in the hands of users and developers everywhere. For this, we need your support .


The ROOband featured is not a final product. 
There will be further developments to come. Please watch this space!








·  Size: 100 mm x 84 mm flat
·  Diameter: 56 mm stretches up to 168 mm
·  Weight: 25g


·  Lightweight
·  Shock resistant
·  Sweat absorbing
·  100% Cotton Stretch Fabric
·  1 year limited warranty (please follow the usual washing instructions)



·  iPhones 1, 2, 3, 3GS, 4, 4S 5, 5C, 5S
·  iPad 
·  Android phones
·  Windows Phones
·  Blackberry phones
·  staplers
·  donuts
·  anything you’re holding


Shipping for all international orders outside of Germany unless indicated otherwise will be 12€ per pair. The average number of days for shipping may vary based upon origin and destination. Please be aware of any additional costs or taxes for customs your country might charge.

We understand mistakes with sizing could be made and we will do our best to exchange any ROOband in good faith that you send back to us. Because our margins are tight we will have to charge you for the freight cost of any returns.


In 1979, American architect and running enthusiast, Robert ‘Bob' Gamm was getting frustrated with where he should keep his small change and keys during his daily 10k runs. But then he had a crazy idea! He developed a pair of lightweight athletic shoes containing a small zippered pocket to hold those important belongings. KangaROOS, "The Original Shoes With Pockets" was born. And, most important of all, run was fun again for Bob. Now, with the ROOband, it’s time that history repeats itself.

DO NOTE: Although the video and above text may come off as a spoof. We will be making the band if we meet our goal.

story: John's bike was jacked last night--and in the words of our wordsmith Seth Haines: When you steal a man’s bicycle, you deprive him of his primary mode of transportation. When you rob a man of transportation, he becomes home-bound. When a man becomes home-bound, especially a rare and good man, he is without the opportunity to direct the spiritual affairs of another. When the other does not have his spiritual affairs directed, he tends to consider his neighbor less, tends to become self-centered and feckless. A feckless man is of no use to his community, and such a man in his fecklessness might distance himself from development efforts, from local church activities, from sharing the good news of grace with those around him. A man who fails to share the good news of grace might, perhaps, pass an ordinary feller (even a bicycle thief) on the street without a second thought. The ordinary feller, perhaps you, might be searching for the silver-lining to this one unfortunate life. However, without this good news, you go about your way, still in misery, still searching. - See more at: http://sethhaines.com/christianity/on-bicycle-t...
story_txt: John's bike was jacked last night--and in the words of our wordsmith Seth Haines: When you steal a man’s bicycle, you deprive him of his primary mode of transportation. When you rob a man of transportation, he becomes home-bound. When a man becomes home-bound, especially a rare and good man, he is without the opportunity to direct the spiritual affairs of another. When the other does not have his spiritual affairs directed, he tends to consider his neighbor less, tends to become self-centered and feckless. A feckless man is of no use to his community, and such a man in his fecklessness might distance himself from development efforts, from local church activities, from sharing the good news of grace with those around him. A man who fails to share the good news of grace might, perhaps, pass an ordinary feller (even a bicycle thief) on the street without a second thought. The ordinary feller, perhaps you, might be searching for the silver-lining to this one unfortunate life. However, without this good news, you go about your way, still in misery, still searching. - See more at: http://sethhaines.com/christianity/on-bicycle-t...

story:
This campaign is to raise the remaining N500,000 needed for Favour Usadoh's heart surgery. We already have N1,500,000 which was the remaining money raised for late Vivian's surgery before she passed away.

Favour would undergo this corrective operation mid next month if we are able to meet this campaign goal.

We already have N1,500,000 which was the remaining money raised for late Vivian's surgery before she passed away.Favour would undergo this corrective operation mid next month if we are able to meet this campaign goal.

story:
Hi everyone, my name is Rebecca and I hope that you will take a few moments to read Heather’s story and see what you can do help her beat Lyme disease. I urge you all to watch the video above. Heather's friend Chris has kindly donated her time to help you all understand more about Lyme disease and the battle that Heather is fighting.

Heather is a gifted photographer and you can view her work can be viewed here:
www.redbubble.com/people/locustgirl

Heather has also started making gorgeous jewelery that is available for sale in her Etsy shop. Every single cent earned from her photography and jewelery goes towards her ongoing Lyme treatments. 

Visit Heather's etsy shop here:
https://www.etsy.com/ca/shop/theeowlqueen

Heather was diagnosed with Lyme disease in 2012 after years of misdiagnosis. It took roughly 100 doctors, specialists, and hospital visits to finally be given a correct diagnosis for her illness. I have personally witnessed the tragic effects of Lyme in Heather with my own eyes. I have seen her at her very best and her very worst. 

If a patient knows that they have been bitten by a tick and seek immediate treatment protocol in Canada will allow the doctor to treat the patient with a course of antibiotics for a few weeks and the patient will recover. However, not everyone bitten by a tick will have the classic “bullseye” shaped rash that commonly accompanies a tick bite. If the patient does not know they have been bitten the tick will then infect its host with bacteria and the end result can be catastrophic.

When Lyme reaches the chronic state it has the ability to attack the joints, muscles, heart, brain and organs. Lyme is a great impostor, mimicking symptoms of other up to 300 other illnesses such as cancer, lupus, MS, fibromyalgia, arthritis, cardiac disease, brain tumor, Alzheimer’s, mono and Epstein Barr just to name a few. Diagnosing Lyme disease is a long and terrifying road.

Lyme testing and treatment protocol in Canada is severely outdated. The blood tests available often return a false negative and patients go on to suffer without answers while their health rapidly deteriorates. Many doctors will tell the patient that the symptoms are all in their head and should see a psychiatrist.

Protocol in Canada states that doctors should either treat as they see fit or do nothing as statements from infectious disease departments insist that chronic Lyme doesn't exist. This is because patients suspected of having chronic Lyme failed to recover after being treated with the basic course of antibiotics. The failure to recover is due to the fact that the patients did not receive the correct antibiotics, the correct dosage or the correct amount of time to allow the antibiotics to work. Lyme also brings with it many co-infections. If these infections are not isolated and treated the patient will not make any improvement. The Lyme bacteria is corkscrew shaped giving it the perfect defense, it has the ability to drill into the muscles, joints and organs and hang on for as long as it possibly can, reproducing and spreading in the process. 

Doctors in Canada have lost their license for treating patients with long term antibiotics for Lyme. Doctors can and will refuse to see a patient once it is discovered that they have chronic Lyme even if the patient is seeking help for something completely unrelated to Lyme. This is why many patients, Heather included, have to seek treatment from Lyme literate doctors in the USA and pay out of pocket for their treatment.

Heather spent 4 years in excruciating physical pain and her body began to breakdown and deteriorate. She had hundreds of doctor appointments, emergency transport by ambulance to hospitals, meetings with neurosurgeons, MRI scans, xrays, CT scans, infectious disease consultations, painful procedures and tests all resulting in no answers. Time and time again her symptoms were blamed on anxiety.

In 2009 Heather had a gym membership, she hiked, walked five miles a day, she spent time in nature and has produced some of the most breathtaking works of art and photography I have ever seen. Now she becomes fatigued so quickly she can’t walk more than 20 minutes at a time. She has difficulty breathing, chest pain, migraines, severe joint pain and stiffness, cognitive impairment resulting in brain fog, difficulty communicating and finding the right words to express herself. Her body swells head to toe with edema, she requires help with household chores, cooking, cleaning and getting to medical appointments. She has experienced hair loss, chronic sore throat, searing neck pain, sensitivity to light and sound, numbness and tingling in her body. She has panic attacks, dental problems, several bouts with shingles resulting in nerve damage, sleep apnea, and most recently she has started to suffer from possible partial seizures. She is awaiting a proper diagnosis for the strange out of body experiences. Heather describes it as "being trapped between two worlds" or feeling like she is falling out of her body. It goes without saying that this is a terrifying situation and they can strike without warning at any time. Recently Heather has undergone two tests to check for seizure activity in her brain. 

Heather started making good progress with her Lyme treatment and became 50% better over time thanks to her wonderful Lyme doctor and health team in Canada. Heather was on the same antibiotics for 18 months only to suffer a serious decline in March 2014. Heather was bitten by an unknown bug causing her ankle to swell double its size and turn red with intense itching. She was taken to hospital emergency three times in the span of a week and received no help, no treatment, no diagnosis. She went from  being 50% better to 10% with 80% of her Lyme symptoms returning.

Heather desperately needs your help. Her health is declining at an alarming rate. Her body no longer responds to her current course of antibiotics and she is now having to take even stronger antibiotics with incredibly alarming side effects and herxheimer reaction while the antibiotics do their job. It is possible that Heather is going to get much worse before she gets better. Heather is allergic to most antibiotics and it is currently unknown if she will have a life threatening reaction to these new drugs. Heather is unable to work due to her health and has no blood family to support her. She relies on the few close friends to help her get through when possible but we cannot do it all on our own. We need your help.

June 2015 Heather received information from blood tests that her liver enzymes are elevated. She began to experience severe back pain and feeling like someone had beat in her kidneys. Alone and afraid Heather went to the hospital. Her pain was ignored by hospital staff even when it made it impossible for her to walk. Eventually she was given an injection of an unknown substance, doctors would not tell her what she had been injected with. Heather informed the hospital staff that her liver enzymes are elevated however they refused to run any further blood tests. She was told that she made the decision as a Canadian to seek health care in the United States and she decided to take all these antibiotics so she can just go back to the USA for medical care. Heather has been denied treatmet yet again in her home country. Since this hospital visit Heather was able to have blood tests ran elsewhere and found out that her liver enzymes have doubled since the first test. 

Heather has it in her to fight but we need your help to keep the fight going. Even for the cost of a beer or a cup of coffee you can help save a life.

July 4th 2012 CBC News ran a story on Lyme featuring Heather.

November 20th 2012 Heather was featured in The Ward Ottawa's Health Weekly to discuss her battle with Lyme. 

May 10th 2013 the Ottawa Citizen featured an article on Lyme including Heather's story.

March 3rd 2014 CTV News Ottawa featured a story on Lyme in Canada and included Heather in their report. 

Here we have a YouTube video featuring Heather on what it's like to live with Lyme.

WAYS YOU CAN HELP:

Donating and sharing this campaign on social media.

PERKS:

$5 emailed photograph:
a photograph of Heather holding a thank you note with your name on it emailed to you.

$15 handmade card:
A handmade wildlife thank you card with a hand written note to you written by Heather snail mailed to your door.

$20 audio/voice email from Heather:
A one-two minute audio/voice email of Heather thanking you and acknowledging gratitude for your help.

$40 photography print:
A 8x8, 8x10 or 8x12 photograph, your choice from the 'gallery' tab on her website
www.redbubble.com/people/locustgirl
PLEASE EMAIL ME DIRECTLY with your choice of print. Please do not order off Redbubble. We will take your requests, professionally print and snail mail them to your door. 

$50 personal video:
A personal thank you video made especially for you from Heather and myself as well as a personal handmade card/written note snail mailed to your door.

$75 A beautiful handmade silver wire and gemstone owl bracelet made for you by Heather and shipped to your door.

$100 LARGE photographic print:
A 12x12, 11x14 or 12x18 signed photographic print of your choice from the pictures/gallery on here or Heather's gallery at 
www.redbubble.com/people/locustgirl
snail mailed to your door. 
PLEASE EMAIL ME DIRECTLY with your photographic choice, do not order off Redbubble. We will professionally print and snail mail the beautiful signed print to your door. 

$250 photographic prints:
Ten 8x8, 8x10, 8x12 photographic prints of your choice snail mailed directly to your door! You can choose from the photos in the gallery here or on Heather's website 
www.redbubble.com/people/locustgirl
PLEASE EMAIL ME DIRECTLY with your choice of print. Do not order off Redbubble. We will professionally print and snail mail your photographs directly to your door.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:

If you can’t contribute financially, we understand. Spreading the word through social media can make a profound difference.

When out in nature always check yourself, your loved ones, and your pets for ticks. They are small, about the size of a poppy seed. Always wear insect repellent containing DEET when hiking, camping, spending any time out in nature where ticks can be found. Ticks are spreading rapidly across Canada and the United States. A tick check could save your life.

Monthly costs in Canada (all out of pocket):

-travel expenses to medical appointments, specialists, etc. $200
-vitamins, supplements, tinctures, specific probiotics $500
- chiropractic / naturopathic / acupuncture treatment $1000

Every 3 months trip to USA:

-travel expenses $100
-doctor visits $500
-antibiotics $1500-$2500

Please help us change the life of dear Heather.

If you need to get in touch please email Rebecca at snowymomma777@yahoo.ca

It would also be helpful if you select a perk to also email the address above with your name and shipping information so we do not forget you!

story:
#ButICan  

"They said I was too weak." "They said I wasn't going to make it." "They said my sickness would stop me."

We are often told we can't do something. Kids Need More and Surpass the Limit are partnering up to inspire you to become stronger then those thoughts, and say "But I Can." 

Why should we do MoRe? Here's why:

Kids Need More is a 501c3 nonprofit charitable organization dedicated to creating a community through recreational events and camping experiences for children, families & young adults coping with cancer and life -threatening illness. Kids Need More Camp Adventure is a one-week sleep away camp that takes place on Shelter Island serving child cancer patients and siblings. The camp is completely run by volunteers. Learn more here.

Therefore, we need your help to make this possible for kids with cancer and their siblings enjoy this one week! To send a child to camp is approx. $2500.  About a 100 kids go to camp. 

Start saying #ButICan!

Surpass the Limit Inc is a community aimed to helping the youth grow in their fitness & personal lives. We offer team based exercise to make you the fittest and strongest person you can possibly be. Learn more here.

story:
Dear family and friends,

Thank you for all your support in my cricket journey so far.

I can never thank you enough for the support you have already given me.

Thank you for believing in me.

I am very grateful for all the publicity I have received in the media, both in Singapore and internationally. I have been on ICC 360 Cricket TV Show, which was shown worldwide, Straits Times, Tamil Murasu, 96.8FM tamil radio channel, various magazines and websites.

1. DIVIYA G K SINGAPORE STAR –

http://www.asiancricket.org/index.php/the-big-i...

2. When Karma called - Diviya G K answered http://cricketkarma.com/when_karma_called___div...

3. HOCKEY & CRICKET http://www.stmargaretssec.moe.edu.sg/cos/o.x?c=...

4. First International Fixture – Singapore vs. Malaysia –

http://www.cricket.org.sg/WomensCricket.html 

5. Diviya becomes first woman to play in SCA men's Div 2 league - http://www.straitstimes.com/breaking-news/sport...

6. Interview with ICC 360 Cricket Show (International)

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9tlkGqnfNQk#t=33

I have been fortunate to represent Singapore at international level since 2006, which has exposed me to many people of different countries and cultures - from Australia, South Africa, and to my most recent tour in the Netherlands.

I have always wanted to play cricket at a higher level than what is played in Singapore. Cricket in Singapore isn’t very big for ladies (as compared to men) so I have been sourcing out on my own so that I can get more opportunities to play.

To begin with I started playing in the men’s league (article 5) so I could get more exposure and whenever given a chance to play overseas I will seek out for sponsors.

So far I have been fortunate to go to South Africa and Netherlands because a few companies and clubs sponsored me. ‘Pharmaceutical company called Vetter and Joseph Grimberg (judicial Commissioner of the Supreme Court, Singapore) sponsored me to play in South Africa. HV & CV Quick club in Netherlands sponsored me to play in Netherlands.

Unfortunately I missed out on Sri Lanka and Australia last year because I wasn’t able to get sponsorship. I am hoping not to miss the second chance I have been given to play in Sri Lanka and Australia this year.

I have already shown promise as Singapore’s leading female cricketer and with my hard work and determination I am confident I will be able to play well in the women’s cricket league in Sri Lanka and Australia.

Hence, I would like to take this opportunity to raise funds for the upcoming leagues in Sri Lanka and Australia.

In order to play in Sri Lanka for the season from 21st July to 21st August 2015 (1 month), I need to cover my flight, accommodation, transport, and food expenses. I have calculated that to play first class cricket in the Sri Lanka for a month, it would cost about USD$3500 and I will have to raise this sum by 6th July 2015

Accommodation: USD $50/day

Food: USD$20/day

Transport: USD$10/day

Miscellaneous: USD $100

Flight Ticket: USD$1000 (maximum)

Total : USD$3500

In order to play in Australia for the season from September 2015 till January 2016 (4 months), I need to cover my flight, accommodation, transport, and food expenses. I have calculated that to play cricket in Australia for a duration of 4 months, would cost about USD$12,400. and I will have to raise this sum by 17th August 2015.

Accommodation: USD $50/day

Food: USD$30/day

Transport: USD$10/day

Miscellaneous: USD $100

Flight Ticket: USD$1500 (maximum)

Total : USD$12,400

While these amounts are by no means insignificant, the calculation is based on basic living expenses based on the cost of living in Sri Lanka and Australia. I promise that I have calculated the sums to the best of my abilities from experience, and have minimized all additional costs as much as possible.

I will be living on a basic allowance, not a lavish tour, just enough for me to train and to compete and will be fully transparent and accountable in handling the funds raised through this crowd funding effort.

I welcome alternative constructive ideas to complement my funding efforts (accommodation-, food- and equipment sponsor).

I must clarify that if I raise insufficient funds for Sri Lanka before 6th July 2015, it will be used for Australia. If funds are not raised in time for both, funds will be directed to future cricket tour and opportunities.

I would like to thank you in advance for your generosity and well wishes and I am infinitely grateful for your support.

Diviya

Clarification: IndieGoGo is a trusted crowd funding site. Funds received by credit cards are held until my campaign's deadline, then sent as a lump sum to my bank account within 15 business days. Once I have received my first contribution, IndieGoGo will ask me to fill out my bank account information.

I have calculated that to play cricket in Australia for a duration of 4 months, would cost about USD$12,400. and I will have to raise this sum by 17th August 2015.Accommodation: USD $50/dayFood: USD$30/dayTransport: USD$10/dayMiscellaneous: USD $100Flight Ticket: USD$1500 (maximum) Total : USD$12,400While these amounts are by no means insignificant, the calculation is based on basic living expenses based on the cost of living in Sri Lanka and Australia. I promise that I have calculated the sums to the best of my abilities from experience, and have minimized all additional costs as much as possible. I will be living on a basic allowance, not a lavish tour, just enough for me to train and to compete and will be fully transparent and accountable in handling the funds raised through this crowd funding effort. I welcome alternative constructive ideas to complement my funding efforts (accommodation-, food- and equipment sponsor).I must clarify that if I raise insufficient funds for Sri Lanka before 6th July 2015, it will be used for Australia. If funds are not raised in time for both, funds will be directed to future cricket tour and opportunities.I would like to thank you in advance for your generosity and well wishes and I am infinitely grateful for your support.DiviyaClarification: IndieGoGo is a trusted crowd funding site. Funds received by credit cards are held until my campaign's deadline, then sent as a lump sum to my bank account within 15 business days. Once I have received my first contribution, IndieGoGo will ask me to fill out my bank account information.

story:
Mindful Medicine Worldwide (MMW) sends volunteer acupuncturists to rural clinics in Nepal, where these volunteers treat up to 200 patients per week per clinic.  Some patients, who are mostly rural farmers, travel by foot for up to four hours to receive treatment. 

On April 25th, Nepal was hit with a 7.8 magnitude earthquake that leveled both of our clinics. Luckily our volunteers and staff are safe, but these vital local health resources -- which are for many residents the only healthcare option in their communities -- were destroyed by the earthquake. The village of Chanauti, the site of one MMW clinic, also was leveled in the quake. Many people are injured and without homes. This clinic served not only the people of Chanauti, but also many villagers from the surrounding hilltops.

Funds are now urgently needed to rebuild and repair the clinics in Chanauti and Bhotechaur. In addition to the clinics themselves, we must replace equipment and medical supplies so we may continue treating the many patients in need. 

Supporting MMW also helps these Nepali communities in the long-term and big picture. Our registered nonprofit provides translation training skills to local Nepali students to prepare them for future employment. If they're interested in Chinese medicine, the students may apprentice with our volunteers as well. Having a clinic and the necessary supplies helps to continue this mission, providing these communities with life-long affordable community health care and employment opportunities for youth.

http://www.mindfulmedicineworldwide.org/?m=Abou...

story:
Donna Shaw passed away on Tuesday, September 22nd. The family is asking for any contributions to help raise money for the end of life arrangements.

The target of $2500 will cover the cremation costs. Any additional funds raised will go towards the purchase of a plot and grave marker.

Please help with even a small donation of $5--and spread the word on social media.

Updates on Donna's end-of-life celebration will be posted on Facebook.

Any additional funds raised will go towards the purchase of a plot and grave marker.Please help with even a small donation of $5--and spread the word on social media.Updates on Donna's end-of-life celebration will be posted on Facebook.

story:
** [Campaign update] As of January 3rd 2014, 780 000 people watched her video, 86 000 looked at this campaign page.... but only 311 donated. I am sure we can do better to help her!! We are her only hope. (But please don't donate if you do not have the means - Robin would be very sad and shameful if so.) **

* WHAT ROBIN NEEDS

Robin is in a terrible life-threatening condition and she must quickly receive a surgery to save her life. Her hernia started swelling again, the cadaver sheath that maintains her organs has just expired... and if her intestines ever twist that might mean Robin’s death. Therefore Robin desperately needs some money to pay for a surgery to reconstruct her abdominal muscle (to insure her viscera stay in place) and to fix the hernia. The VA won't do this for her.

WE must help her !

* HOW THE MONEY WILL GET TO ROBIN

Donations that are made via Paypal can get directly to Robin via Paypal account, whereas ones made by a credit card will go to her savings account at the end of the campaign only. 

* CONTACT ROBIN

via e-mail: templerobin64@gmail.com or on her Facebook

+ OTHER WAYS TO HELP

* If you are (or know) a DOCTOR that might be willing to provide surgery at a dramatically reduced cost (or for free) - please get in touch. Please. [December update] We have actually found a reconstruction surgeon in the NY area that would help her… but this surgeon needs an internist to assist him. So we are still searching for him or her.

* If you are (or know) a MALPRACTICE LAWYER that would help Robin fight all this pro-bono or on a contingency - please get in touch. Please. What they did to her is criminal, and they need to take responsibility for this. 

* If you know a serious journalist that would cover her story - please get in touch.

* If you think you can help in any other way - please get in touch.

Thank you all! As Robin would say: ''Love and light fill you and keep you up!''

Keep DONATING & keep SHARING!!

** Robin posted a SECOND VIDEO in which she talks about the fundraising but most importantly about what she deeply wants to see coming out from her story!! It's here: Robin Temple's plea

story:
Who is TimerToppy


We are a real family of four with two little girls, Ansley and Addison.  Addison is our youngest and will be turning 1 this December and Ansley will be 4 on Christmas eve.  Mommy and Daddy (aka Katie and Daniel) are high school sweethearts and we continued dating through college even though we went to rival colleges.  We were married shortly after college and a few years after that were blessed with our first little angel.  When Ansley was born it was important to us to give her the best nutrition and upbringing that we could.  Katie was fortunate and able to produce enough milk to keep up with our new feeding machine.  It was also important for Katie to pump and store the milk in case she needed to leave Ansley with a sitter or daddy.  When she started pumping we found the storage and mainly the labeling of the bottles very difficult and a truly archaic process.  We tried sticky notes, dry erase, charting, and even a few clever apps that were out at the time.  None of these methods really seemed to make sense and although some were better than others we really didn't feel like any of these old methods were very simple.  Even IF the sticky notes didn't fall of in the fridge, or you didn't smudge the writing on the bottle, at 3 am it's not easy to do the reverse math to see how long a bottle has been in the fridge even if the dates are clearly written.  So we started thinking of how to make it easier and over the last 3 years we've finally gotten our prototypes COMPLETED and TimerToppy was born!!!  A simple, safe (BPA FREE) way to track how long your milk or forumla has been in the bottle.

Your support in ANY capacity is appreciated beyond what you can ever imagine.  We are launching this IndieGOGO campaign so that we can get the first production run out into the real world helping mommies and daddies like us to make one part of raising these precious angels just a little bit easier.  You can buy some of the tops, show us some love on any social media, or even donate to our cause and wish us the best of luck.  We also want to know what you think of the idea and hear how else the TimerToppy could be used!  

How Does It Work

It really very simple.  Once you have finished pumping your milk you remove the pumping adapter and replace it with the TimerToppy. Once the top is on the storage bottle you press the button to start the timer.  The timer will then count up by minutes, hours, and days until you return to use the milk and reset the timer for a new bottle.  Forget about dating and trying to do any math with this top, just read the amount of days, hours, and minutes on the top and then you can quickly determine if the milk is within your comfort level to be served to your precious little one.  We just want to help you remove the guess work from bottle labeling.


What We Need & What You Get

Here's the Deal

  • Your breast milk and formula is LIQUID GOLD and we want to make sure you aren't wasting a drop, so we've come up with some great perks for our supporters!
  • We need to raise $15, 000 to get our first production run out the door.  With your help we can get the factory molds and first run of real Tops out and into the hands of mothers that really need this product!
  • The gold coin is a single time pack and will get you started with an easier milk storage system.  This is for those who think that it's a great idea, but want to see for themselves first hand before ordering a whole box.
  • The pot of gold is a 3 pack and is for those who have been searching the internet for a better way to store their milk and want to say "ya we got and we want it BAD".  These people tend to keep a few bottles in the fridge and need to keep it organized. 
  • The gold mine is a 5 pack and is a great gift for working mothers.  This will give you enough Tops to have a few in the fridge while you're at work and keep some with you for pumping while you're at work.  These are for the serious milk mamas!

The Impact

  • This has been a long road for us to get to where we are today and with your contribution whether monetary or just a good luck we know we can get TimerToppy into the hands of people that will truly love the product.  It's a simple design and it makes life easier, so what are you waiting for ~ share or contribute, you won't be disappointed!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Get the word out and help us tell those who need this product that we're here to help
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Thanks for reading through our campaign and taking at least a small interest in who we are and where we're going!

The gold mine is a 5 pack and is a great gift for working mothers.  This will give you enough Tops to have a few in the fridge while you're at work and keep some with you for pumping while you're at work.  These are for the serious milk mamas!



The Impact
This has been a long road for us to get to where we are today and with your contribution whether monetary or just a good luck we know we can get TimerToppy into the hands of people that will truly love the product.  It's a simple design and it makes life easier, so what are you waiting for ~ share or contribute, you won't be disappointed!


Other Ways You Can Help

Get the word out and help us tell those who need this product that we're here to help
Use the Indiegogo share tools!
Thanks for reading through our campaign and taking at least a small interest in who we are and where we're going!

story:
With Your Help 

We can save over 100 children from the #2 cause of child death in Puno, Peru.


The Sanitary Kit:  Create Clean Water, Washing Station, and a Basic Oral Rehydration Solution (ORS) Drink

The echo+ Sanitary Kit for Puno, Peru is everything children and their families need to make:

  • Safe-drinking water
  • Hand washing station
  • ORS solution

These simple, low-cost and highly effective tools are critical to stopping the #2 cause of children death in Puno: Diarrhea.

According to the World...

Without safe-drinking water and basic hygiene education children and their families place themselves at high risk. Dirty water contains various kinds of bacteria, viral, and parasitic organisms that make young children (who don't have strong immune systems) get very sick. Lack of poor hygiene, such as absence of proper hand washing can also result in severe illness. Diarrhea is both easily preventable and treatable, all a community needs to solve this situation are the few basic supplies offered in our simple kit along with an educational echo+ workshop. With these tools, we can literally save hundreds of infants from suffering a miserable condition. Think of it almost as a first aid kit that enables families to use simple sanitary practices and treatment education to keep from getting sick. In many cases, clinics that offer proper care are usually far away from rural communities we are working with so it is important to give families the tools to manage the situation at home in case of an emergency.

With your help we can purchase everything necessary to put together the sanitary kits!

Here's what the kit includes:

·  1 Liter plastic pitcher (with lid) 

·  1 Teapot 

·  2 bars Anti-bacterial Soap

·  1 Sanitary Water Storage Container 

·  1 Clean Hand Drier

·  2 teaspoons 

·  1 Package of salt 

·  1 Package of sugar 

·  1 Instruction manual (English and Spanish) for making Oral Re-Hydration Solution

·  echo+ community leadership medal

This is all they need to know how to produce, use, and retain clean, sanitary water, and create ORS (oral rehydration solution) the basic drink to save children with fatally low levels of sugar, sodium, and electrolytes in their blood from extreme vomiting and diarrhea.

Here's how the kit can and will save lives:

Prevention & Hygiene

·  The teapot is provided to boil water and make it safe to drink.  Boling is important because it kills all the germs and bacteria that can make someone sick.

·  Next, a water storage container with a lid and a spout are provided. Unfortunately, many communities in the developing world use open buckets to store water and these can be easily contaminated. For example, when a person with unwashed hands dips their cup and hand in the bucket all the water will become dirty. Echo+ is offering a water storage vessel that comes with a lid and a nozzle. The nozzle is key because instead of reaching into the clean water supply, they just can turn the knob at the bottom of the bucket and water will pour our bug-free!

·  We also provide a hand drying towel and a small tub to wash over, and now they have a proper washing station!

·  Antibacterial soap is one of the most important and cost-effective tools to prevent the spread of disease. Soap does not only get rid of the dirt and grease that carry the bacteria, but it also increases the amount of time a person spends washing their hands. According to the WHO, handwashing with soap can reduce the incidence of diarrhea by 40%.

Treatment: ORT (Oral Rehydration Therapy)

 “In global terms, ORS is the most important medical discovery since penicillin”. – Doctors without Boarders

Oral Rehydration Therapy is a life-saving solution that is cheap, effective, and easy to prepare. It prevents dehydration among children suffering from mild to severe diarrhea. ORT solution is composed of: 1 Liter of water, ½ teaspoon of salt, and 5 teaspoons of sugar. The reason a child gets dehydrated is because the bacteria and parasitic organisms that cause diarrhea damage the lining in the intestines make an extreme amount of water and electrolytes be released rather than absorbed. ORT is a glucose-electrolyte solution that promotes water reabsorption by osmosis. When the Oral rehydration solution reaches the intestines, the salt and sugar bind together and are able to cross the intestinal lining. Water immediately follows the high concentration of salt across the lining, and is once again absorbed back into the body. 

The sanitary kit provides a 1 Liter plastic pitcher, 2 teaspoons, plus a package of salt and sugar. We try to make it as easy as possible so that any family member can prepare this life-saving formula using the correct measurements.

Instructions and empowerment:

echo+ doesn’t just give out kits, we want to make sure that families understand how to use them and why it’s so important. For that reason, the echo+ team travels hundreds of miles to Puno, Peru to provide educational workshops. These hands-on workshops make it easy to explain our mission as well as explain the proper use of each item in our kit (also outlined in our instruction manual).

echo+ wants to empower children and young adults as leaders of their community. At the end of each workshop we hand out medals and ask each new “echo+ leader” to help promote good hygiene practices in their homes, with their friends and in their communities.

The Team

The Echo team is comprised of a thoughtful group of friends and a mix of people who were originally from Peru, and the United States.  Founded by Alessandra Koenig and her family, the team also includes Rosanna Zagazeta, Sean Powell, Martin Pierrend, Eric Koon, Spencer Koon, and Geoff Bonham. 

The Funding

The funding here will purchase the supplies and assemble the kits. The supplies will be purchased in Peru to save shipping costs and driven and hand delivered to Puno where they will be delivered by the Echo team.  The more we raise, the more kits we can provide.  Hopefully we can make much more than our $1000 goal and provide for many more kids out there in the area.

Charitable Donations, 501(c)3

The fiscal sponsor for this project is The Mary Powell Foundation, a registered non-profit organization.  So, your contribution is a valid write off as a charitable donation.  All moneys from the kickstarter will be handled by MPF and used to purchase supplies, create and deliver the kits.

The Story

The story will be documented and articles posted online on the Echo website with pictures to show the kits and the delivery
