story:
Brief:

This is an opportunity to be part of a wellness movement by supporting innovation and a company whose mission is to make things better for you and someone you know.

FUNKSH is committed to using innovation and technology to improve health and well-being for every day life and strives to provide the world with safe, effective, and affordable products that promote Health & Wellness.

Objective:

PRE-ORDER, CONTRIBUTE and SHARE our indiegogo project to fund production of the first element, FUNKSH 360: the world's first adjustable smoking device.

The 360 and three development stage products are chameleons. Despite the powerful impact these tools can have if instructions are followed, they are subtle and blend easily into the environment. 

Innovator:

Kyle Vincent Boisselle

With over 16 years combined experience as a "best of breed" specialist in Health and Wellness, Fitness and Technology, I've been fortunate to have represented some of the worlds most innovative manufacturers and to have worked with and learned many things from world class athletes, doctors and other technical specialists. 

My passion and inspiration has come from witnessing the transformation in people’s lives when combining the correct tools and techniques.

Company:

FUNKSH is both my philosophy and now an extension of my professional evolution as an innovator powered by the combination of my experience, inspiration and motivation to make life better for all.

Evolution:

Although FUNKSH innovates and utilizes technology of the present and embraces those of the future, it also remains a throwback to a time when quality meant something.

It also stands as a symbol to remind us of our humanity amidst the ever changing world we live in, connecting us. Teaching us. Moving forward. Better tools are a part of global progress and this is one of them. Two further concepts will roll out at a layer date to be determined. 

Innovation & Design:

The  design has evolved over the last few years and now is truly a well rounded SOLUTION for smokers in that it's overall performance, portability, design and function, are still unparalleled to this day. 

The FUNKSH 360 IS the first handheld tool of its kind, which both reduces the harmful effects of smoking on the body and puts in your hand in an innovative, simple and practical design that addresses the shortcomings of other methods.

The Device:

Crafted from surgical grade stainless steel, the device is both indestructible and waterproof. It's equipped with a unique valve design that allows for a smooth controlled inhalation, you decide. 

After all the R & D we've done, the 360 provides unparalleled value, simplicity, functionality and efficiency in the palm of your hand. It's round, requires rotational movements only for operation and it's a solution. It truly is a modern tool for every smoker. The device includes a kit to keep things organized for storage and travel.

Q-tips and sanitizer or nail polish clean the device in minutes. Completely clean and clearly an indication you are choosing a scientific approach. 

It has a weight and feel to it that really set it apart from what you're used to seeing. This is a finely crafted instrument. Some new images to come with the logo engraved on the device. They look really nice with engraving. 

Indestructible

Waterproof

Air Control/Airflow

     X-ray vision reveals: It's designed and inspired from the inside out.  When it became apparent that internal design resulted in a smooth and potent experience, the exterior was eventually further designed with the same philosophy in mind. Form and function. Acting both as a vault to your cargo and a valve control for the right air flow it's undeniably smooth and secure. Drop it in your purse or pocket and it's ready when you are.

Specifications:

  • 316L surgical stainless steel, passivated & polished.
  • CNC Machining
  • Weight: .415 lbs / 6.64 ounces
  • Dimensions: 3 x 1 x 1.5 inches 
  • 3 pieces (stem,base,cap)
  • Waterproof & air tight
  • Warranty: Lifetime Guarantee

Passivation: Stainless steels are corrosion-resistant by nature, the added passivation assures that the metal is less affected by environmental factors such as air and water. Passivation involves a shielding outer-layer which can be applied as a microcoating, is a light coat of a protective material that creates a shell against corrosion. This technique is used to strengthen and preserve the appearance of the metal. 

Inspiration & History:

In 2009, I watched a Canadian documentary featuring Greg Cooper, a patient suffering from multiple sclerosis and severe ataxia. It was gripping to watch and while it struck me that the device in my hand, would have allowed the clip to continue. It was the first time I recognized the true therapeutic benefits of the pipe I'd created for myself a year earlier. As a non smoker, I reasoned that I would need to control the heat and airway for my inhalation. I had resisted the urge to smoke most of my life based on a few bad experiences, but the device helped me to utilize it therapeutically. Due to the number of people who tried the pipe in the following year and claimed it was the smoothest pipe they had ever smoked, I became obsessed with researching other existing devices and then developing the product further to ensure it provided both an efficient and functional solution for it's owner.  There are dozens of prototypes in the hands of patients and friends around the globe who, like me, swear by it. 

- Greg Cooper (MS Patient)

- Larry & Adam 

Opportunity:

For you, the contributors, the opportunity to improve the quality of life for millions of people is tangible by being a part of this campaign. This is just the beginning.

Pricing has been discounted for the purpose of this campaign, delivery and handing charges are extra. The device pays for itself, but we'll group ship where we can.

I am looking to raise a total of $50,000 to jump-start manufacturing, company expansion and further product development.

The financial support of the contributors means much more than purchasing a product, manufacturing or launching a company. It is a part of the evolving global wellness movement of empowering the individual to be in charge of their physical and mental health. With each innovation planned for release, it is highly likely someone you know will experience an improved quality and duration of life, due to one of three elements being rolled out by FUNKSH.

The campaign will provide the opportunity for people to own a lifelong smoking device that reduces the harmful effects of existing devices and additionally as a tribute to Greg Cooper (Canada), my friend Larry Quinn (USA) and all patients world wide, the contributors will be able to donate the devices to patients and care-giving organizations through the "featured perk" listed at the very top of the page. 

And most importantly all contributors will receive a listing on our Founders Page found at FUNKSH.com


Kyle Vincent Boisselle 

Founder of FUNKSH




Patents pending

FUNKSH is a trademark of Kyle Vincent Boisselle

*For use with natural herbs or tobacco

**Must be legal age to purchase in your jurisdiction.

https://www.facebook.com/FUNKSH

http://funksh.wordpress.com/2011/03/08/instructions-and-such/

story:
Let's Get Amanda To Wisconsin!

Hello. The girl you see in the photo above is my daughter Amanda. She turned 5 on the 28th of November. 

I wish I could say that her 5 years have been as any other child. But, I cannot.

Amanda suffers from Hypotonia, development delay and obstipation. She recently has had a diagnosis of Functional Constipation complicated by hypotonia. She is in the mere 5th percentile for her weight which is only 30lbs. She has speech, physical and occupational delays. She has been 'tracked' as being mentally and physically able of a compared 2 yr 8 month child.

Amanda has always had trouble with having bowel movements. From a young age, 1-2 months, I would see her struggling much more than an infant would. I brought it to her Pediatricians attention numerous times with no help. 

At approximately 1 year of age Amanda started having bowel movements less and less. She would strain, cry and scream to get it out with nothing more than tiny pellets and blood. Thus is when the roller coaster of this poor childs life began.

Because of her delays in speech, she was unable to communicate her needs or struggles. But it became all too obvious with the lack of stool and destended stomach. I brought her to the Hospital ER where they tried everything from manual removal to fleet enemas with no result. I remember the Doctor saying, "My goodness, she has a lot of stool in there" when reading the x-rays. So it was no wonder I was shocked when they ordered us home with a regimen of laxitives, suppositories and 2 enemas per day.

I followed their advice. I cried daily with my child as she screamed with the invasive torment I delivered. And for what? More pain and pellets.

I will not tell you the amount of medications and procedures I was told to do to my child throughout the next couple of years. It was horrific. Finally, I said enough and more had to be done. I was (after much insistance) referred to a Gastrointestinal Specialist.

Within the last 2 years of Amandas life she has had numerous NG-tube clean outs (tube through her nose that delivers high amounts of Golytly into her stomach), Gastric Barium enemas, Disimpactions, biopsies of her rectum, and the latest being Botox injections into her rectum. The Botox was to relax her anal sphincter so that basically the stool would just "fall out." Again this has failed. She has done all of this along with her treatments for her delays and hypotonia. She has such anxiety of going to the doctor now that she has been diagnosed with PTSD and anxiety. I am now bringing her to a Psychologist once a week to cope.

But a wonderful thing has happened! Amanda has been referred to a Motility Specialist.   http://www.chw.org/display/PPF/DocID/48891/Nav/1/router.asp

There are only a few in the USA and the closest to us is in Milwaukee WI. It is approx 874 miles away. We are to arrive on the 28th of Decmeber and stay until that Monday for results.

This specialist is a bleesing for us. We will finally get the answers she needs. Possibly a cure?

I have never used the 'single-mom' as an excuse. I work hard and do the best to provide for my children (I have one other daughter who is 14). But I find myself not being able to obtain the funds to make the trip. I am limited to hours I can work due to her therapies 2x weekly and numerous trips to the doctors and hospitals for procedures. And unfortunately the company I work for is in the slow period for available hours.

I have never asked for much in my life, but I am swallowing my pride to ask for help now. Please give my daughter the chance at a productive pain free life?

 

Thank you

story:
So, my mission is this... We are hoping to take Pink Weddings NATIONWIDE!!!  To give FREE weddings to those who have and are being affected by Cancer!  We are like the Wedding Version of the Make a Wish for Grownups! ;)  We comprise a list of Vedors who will donate what they can of themselves(trade) and then we have to find a way to do the rest!  

We are raising money to get Pink Weddings OFF the ground!  This will help us cover expenses for the Pink Weddings that we just cannot get Vendors to donate in their services!  

************************************************

From: Pink Weddings
We the founders of Pink Weddings are Reverend Kimberly Kelly and Shelley Chamberlin; we are the founders of the newly formed Pink Weddings. We are an organization that has gathered a group of various weddings vendors (and growing nationwide) to donate their services to those who are terminally ill with any cancer or who are within a 7 year window of remission. We are also open to case by case situations that could affect the children of these patients. 
We are also taking other terminally ill clients as well.

We freely take nominations from family, friends, agencies, and the couples themselves. We do require a diagnosis from a medical doctor that is verifiable just to ensure that they are receiving the proper services as well as arrangements for them when their wedding day ar-rives.


Additionally to find us on facebook you can follow us and keep up with all of the exciting things happening! Facebook.com/pinkweddings and our website is www.dreamalittledreamweddings and click on the Pink Weddings Tab(s).

***************************************

Here is a copy of a few heartfelt words I shared with our guest! Thank you all again from the bottom of our hearts! 

Take a walk with me if you will… and put yourself in the shoes of someone who is sick or in love with someone who is sick… 
The big question I have for you through all of these stories are; what would it mean to you? 
….If
The love of your life was facing their eternity without you and your life here without them. Would you want the opportunity to give them your name or take the name of that special one? Would you want to know that you have shown the ultimate gift of love before the ultimate and final goodbye, by marrying that special person? On the other hand, what if they have fought so hard to overcome their illness into remission and you would like to do nothing but marry them and spend the rest of your life with them as the ultimate reward of a second chance of life. Nevertheless, the illness that you now have put behind you has left you with memories of a savings account, memories of extra money, and only dreams in the wind of affording the fairy tale wedding that both people deserve. What if you have the chance to do that because a group of very special, loving people decided to give of themselves to put the stars back in the eyes of the couple in love and the dreams and hope back into the hearts of those who dare to dream because illness is smoldering their futures. 

Or what if you have been with that special someone for 25 years of wonderful marriage, children, and then grandchildren and suddenly illness strikes within the home… what if you fought the fight and find that your time was running near? In addition, you knew that all she wanted for the last 15 years was to renew your wedding vows by doing the wedding ceremony she always wished you could have afforded when you first wed… Now that illness has touched your lives, that dream again has been stolen. On the other hand, has it? Again, what if you knew that you could turn to Pink Weddings to give your wife the wedding that she always wanted and deserved… 

We all make plans to grow old together; but many couples that will not get to. Also, we all make plans to do things like get married, or renew our vows to show our special someone that we are truly committed to them and to give them the ultimate gift of love. But then again, truly have you ever thought outside of watching a tearjerker movie what happens in real life when illness strikes and interrupts those plans. Well, I will tell you what happens… There are several scenarios… 
Scenario One- The couple does not get to get married at all or renew their vows. 
Scerario Two- The couple does get married by the hospital chaplain, their pastor in their living room/ hospital room, or a family or friend attempts to put together a wedding on no money budget to try and help a friend. 
Scenario Three- They come to Pink Weddings and they get to have their dreams come true. Now, we may not be able to give them the Cinderella Carriage and the several thousand dollar wedding gown, but we can offer them as close to perfect as possible. 

Weddings Professionals, do you remember why you went into business in the wedding industry? Probably because it was some decent income to make in it, right? Well, do you remember WHY you stayed in it? I know why I stayed in it; as I am addicted to the Love Stories! I am obviously a helpless romantic who cannot help but be head over heels in love with the LOVE that these couple brings with them. I cannot imagine what it will be like to experience the first Pink Wedding… How exciting will that be.

I am obviously a helpless romantic who cannot help but be head over heels in love with the LOVE that these couple brings with them. I cannot imagine what it will be like to experience the first Pink Wedding… How exciting will that be.

story:
Our Story

Maurice is a 37-year old loving father and husband who is always helping others; even at the expense of himself. But now Maurice needs help. He needs the help of others to pay for his medical and recovery expenses that will occur when he undergoes a kidney transplant in September. He has insurance; but insurance doesn’t cover all of the expenses. Plus, there are already pre-existing medical bills that have occurred over the course of this journey. I ask that you please open your heart as you continue to read this rest of this campaign.

In 2005, Maurice went to the doctor for a routine physical examination. The doctor noticed traces of blood in his urine and ordered further testing. He spent three days in the hospital being tested. During that time, he was informed that he had Chronic Kidney Failure. Maurice had been born with 1 functioning kidney, and it was failing. Despite the news, Maurice remained upbeat. He continued to live as he normally would - working and caring for his family and friends.

At the end of 2008; with the decline of the economy Maurice found himself unemployed. He actively looked for employment, but had not luck. To make matters worse, in 2009 I became unemployed as well. I was fortunate to regain employment a few months later, but at a lower salary and without benefits.

In October 2010, Maurice went to the doctor’s for another checkup. The next day he was informed that his kidney had 0% functionality and was ordered to go the hospital and have himself admitted. He was admitted and spent the next 11 days in the hospital. During that time he underwent immediate surgery to have a port inserted in his carotid artery of his neck. The port would be how he would receive his dialysis treatments until his veins properly formed for a fistula. Once he was discharged; he found himself with thousands of dollars in hospital expenses.

The search for a donor began immediately. Several family members and friends were tested – and no one viable donor emerged. Maurice went on the donor list and until a suitable donor was found, began dialysis treatments. For the past year and a half, Maurice has been undergoing home dialysis 4-5 hours a day, 6 days a week. His life, as well as that of his family, has revolved around his dialysis schedule.

Last month, his cousin Jamal stepped forward to get tested. Jamal, is a perfect match and will be donating one of his kidneys to save Maurice’s life.

The Impact

The surgery will take place sometime in either October 17th or November 7th of  this year. After the surgery Maurice will have to be incapacitated for 30-45 days recovering. During this time, he will be constantly monitored to make sure that his body will not reject Jamal’s Kidney. He will also have to have round the clock assistance and care; so either a nurse will be required or his wife will have to take an unpaid leave of absence.

Jamal will also have to stay at the hospital for about a week after surgery to be sure that everything is going to be okay then he will get to return home. However, he cannot return to work for approximately 3-4 weeks depending on his recovery. Jamal has a job, however it does not offer any paid leave benefits.

Once the doctors clear Maurice, he can then go back to living life as normal. However, he will have to remain on medications for the rest of his life, in order to keep his body from ever rejecting the kidney.

Please keep in mind that this has been hard on everyone involved. Friends and family are helping out in any way possible, but the financial burden has become too great. We have depleted their savings; and face going into debt even further when the surgery takes place.

We are seeking money they need in order to help them out during their time of stay at the hospital & with the expenses associated with recovery. So, with immense gratitude, we humbly reach out to the people of the world for a donation to support this campaign. We plead that you find it in your heart to help us ease Maurice’s financial burdens.

What We Need & What You Get

We are not quite sure about how much money will be needed in order to take care of Maurice and Jamal during and after the transplant, but we were told the estimated cost is greater than $20,000. With this campaign we are hoping to raise a portion of this and have set our goal at $12,000. This money will go to cover both Maurice & Jamal medical and recovery expenses not covered by insurance. Any money received in excess of our goal will be donated to other campaigns. We are not asking for a free handout; just need a little help. If you are not able give a donation, I would like to ask that you please keep them in your prayers.

Besides our undying gratitude, there are several perks being offered at various donation levels.

Other Ways You Can Help

We would like to ask that everyone who reads this to please share this with your friends on Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, My Space, etc. Let’s all try to get the word out. If you are not able to make a donation, you can still help out with your prayers & telling or sharing this with others.

Thank You all for everything & GOD Bless You !
story_txt:
Our Story
Maurice is a 37-year old loving father and husband who is always helping others; even at the expense of himself. But now Maurice needs help. He needs the help of others to pay for his medical and recovery expenses that will occur when he undergoes a kidney transplant in September. He has insurance; but insurance doesn’t cover all of the expenses. Plus, there are already pre-existing medical bills that have occurred over the course of this journey. I ask that you please open your heart as you continue to read this rest of this campaign.
In 2005, Maurice went to the doctor for a routine physical examination. The doctor noticed traces of blood in his urine and ordered further testing. He spent three days in the hospital being tested. During that time, he was informed that he had Chronic Kidney Failure. Maurice had been born with 1 functioning kidney, and it was failing. Despite the news, Maurice remained upbeat. He continued to live as he normally would - working and caring for his family and friends.
At the end of 2008; with the decline of the economy Maurice found himself unemployed. He actively looked for employment, but had not luck. To make matters worse, in 2009 I became unemployed as well. I was fortunate to regain employment a few months later, but at a lower salary and without benefits.
In October 2010, Maurice went to the doctor’s for another checkup. The next day he was informed that his kidney had 0% functionality and was ordered to go the hospital and have himself admitted. He was admitted and spent the next 11 days in the hospital. During that time he underwent immediate surgery to have a port inserted in his carotid artery of his neck. The port would be how he would receive his dialysis treatments until his veins properly formed for a fistula. Once he was discharged; he found himself with thousands of dollars in hospital expenses.
The search for a donor began immediately. Several family members and friends were tested – and no one viable donor emerged. Maurice went on the donor list and until a suitable donor was found, began dialysis treatments. For the past year and a half, Maurice has been undergoing home dialysis 4-5 hours a day, 6 days a week. His life, as well as that of his family, has revolved around his dialysis schedule.
Last month, his cousin Jamal stepped forward to get tested. Jamal, is a perfect match and will be donating one of his kidneys to save Maurice’s life.
The Impact
The surgery will take place sometime in either October 17th or November 7th of  this year. After the surgery Maurice will have to be incapacitated for 30-45 days recovering. During this time, he will be constantly monitored to make sure that his body will not reject Jamal’s Kidney. He will also have to have round the clock assistance and care; so either a nurse will be required or his wife will have to take an unpaid leave of absence.
Jamal will also have to stay at the hospital for about a week after surgery to be sure that everything is going to be okay then he will get to return home. However, he cannot return to work for approximately 3-4 weeks depending on his recovery. Jamal has a job, however it does not offer any paid leave benefits.
Once the doctors clear Maurice, he can then go back to living life as normal. However, he will have to remain on medications for the rest of his life, in order to keep his body from ever rejecting the kidney.
Please keep in mind that this has been hard on everyone involved. Friends and family are helping out in any way possible, but the financial burden has become too great. We have depleted their savings; and face going into debt even further when the surgery takes place.
We are seeking money they need in order to help them out during their time of stay at the hospital & with the expenses associated with recovery. So, with immense gratitude, we humbly reach out to the people of the world for a donation to support this campaign. We plead that you find it in your heart to help us ease Maurice’s financial burdens.
What We Need & What You Get
We are not quite sure about how much money will be needed in order to take care of Maurice and Jamal during and after the transplant, but we were told the estimated cost is greater than $20,000. With this campaign we are hoping to raise a portion of this and have set our goal at $12,000. This money will go to cover both Maurice & Jamal medical and recovery expenses not covered by insurance. Any money received in excess of our goal will be donated to other campaigns. We are not asking for a free handout; just need a little help. If you are not able give a donation, I would like to ask that you please keep them in your prayers.
Besides our undying gratitude, there are several perks being offered at various donation levels.
Other Ways You Can Help
We would like to ask that everyone who reads this to please share this with your friends on Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, My Space, etc. Let’s all try to get the word out. If you are not able to make a donation, you can still help out with your prayers & telling or sharing this with others.
Thank You all for everything & GOD Bless You !

story:
Sponsors needed

I was awarded the Anne Marie McSweeney scholarship 2012 and will be attending the PAC Arizona training camp.  In order to attend the scholarship week I need to get funding for the flight,bike rental, energy and evening food expenses.


The Story

My name is Nicole, Iâ€™m 43 and a mother of 2.  Most of my adult life Iâ€™ve focused on my career.  Over the last 3 years thru a series of changes I have taken a new direction in the way at which I live my life.  My focus turned from career to family and self exploration.  In doing this I fell into an obsession of bike riding. It started as a different way to get my daily exercise then grew into racing and more recently long distance challenges.  Over 2 years ago my average ride would be about 25 miles.  Today my rides reach and slightly exceed 100 miles.  As a middle aged woman and not being the youngest of many in this male dominated world it became more than just daily exercise.  Biking to me became a refuge, a place to think, reflect, plan and basically regroup. I although have become more competitive as the years have gone by.  Pushing myself harder and harder.  About 2 months ago I took a long shot and applied for The Anne Marie McSweeney Scholarship, which included a week PAC Arizona training camp.  Being so new the this obsession and trust me long distance cycling is an obsession I never thought I would be chosen out of the many applicants.  To my amazement I was notified that I indeed was awarded the scholarship.  I was filled with excitement, fear and feeling of accomplishment.  The scholarship focuses on long distance womenâ€™s cycling.  This scholarship was created to carry on and hopefully spread the word of women cyclist.  Iâ€™m proud to be representing Anne Marie spirit for riding.  This will be a great and memorable event in my cycling adventures.  The scholarship provides to me the training camp tour and all training event and seminars, accommodations, breakfast and lunch.  The things that is does not cover is the travel to and from camp and energy supplements for rides and evening food expenses.  I signed up for the Century Week at which we will be riding from 60-100 miles per day for a period of 6 days.   In order for me to attend this camp in honor of Anne Marie I will need to pull together enough private sponsors.  Iâ€™m reaching out to family, friends and fellow cyclers that would like to support me in carrying on the spirit of Anne Marie and her passion for cycling, which I too share with her.

What We Need

Total funding needed for this is $1,600.  This will provide transportation to and from NY airport, Flight from NY to Arizona, bike rental, energy supplements for the rides themselves and any additional expenses


What you get

Any amount will help from $10 to what ever :)  

Any donations over $100 will receive souvenir cycling tee.

I will be posting a blog of my training up to the event... please follow :)

story:
At the end of this month (April) I won't be embarking on a dream of mine that I have had ever since becoming a nurse.I will be traveling to Ethiopia to the city of Addis Ababa in order to take care of children with varying medical issues. I'll be traveling with a team of Florida Hospital emergency room doctors and nurses to to provide care to children that will not otherwise receive medical attention. We are so fortunate living in this country to have decent health care available to us. But the children are not so fortunate. Please help me by donating whatever amount you are able to to help me in this endeavor. Any amount would be greatly appreciated even $1. 

From the bottom of my heart...Thank you. 
Andrea

story:
No matter how often you wash your hands, they always win. 

Cleaning bacteria after they attack you, is just a follow-up motion.

Why don't we focus on advanced prevention?

Create a proactive way to sterilize our surroundings and realize personal hygiene.

We made Cleanty v2 with that goal like never before.

All the places & things you could imagine, are in an invisible danger.

Bacteria & germs found on these items are no different than those on toilets or maybe more.

Every time we experience a whole environment, whether it's familiar or not, we feel awkward and discomfort. And yes, that uncomfortable feeling comes from the possibility of illness by bacteria existing in that environment.

We cannot see micro-organisms like bacteria, germs & other contaminants with the naked eye. Indeed, we can only see objects as small as about 0.1 millimeters.

Many illness, infection, and other hygiene problems come from bacteria.

You may have heard of some of the most popular ones: Colon Bacillus, Staphylococcus, Salmonella.

When we get infected by these bacteria, it could be terribly dangerous due to their contagious nature.

It all starts with personal hygiene; by sterilizing the most used items, we can significantly decrease the possibility of infections, etc.

 

Last year, we launched 'Cleanty v1', and got a lot of love from early adaptors in Kickstarter.

And now, we cameback with a new version of Cleanty!

With upgraded UVC LED, COOL DESIGN & ADDITIONAL FUNCTION.

You can experience the most powerful sterilization with the smallest mobile sterilizer.

Just Click and Clean anytime anywhere.

Cleanty is the most easy and simple way to keep you safe.

Keep Bacteria & Germs away with Cleanty

Kill 99.9% of bacteria, germs, and other contaminants. Cleanty is made with the newest UVC LED technology. With a stroke of UVC LED light, within seconds, it will sterilizes anything around you!

 

Fight and Kill Bacteria in most simple way

Don't be scared of What-Cannot-Be-Seen anymore! 

Simple One Button Operation : We did not want to install safety like a pistol while maintaining a easy, simple one button solution.

  • Short Press once to execute on/off action 

  • Short Press twice to activate the Sterilizing LED 

  • Long Press once to activate the bulit-in timer

 

Click and Clean Anytime Anywhere

29g! Simple and Slim : Create bacteria free environment anytime anywhere. The minimal design allowed us to create a highly portable sterilizer. Ultimate Portability : Cleanty is as small as a thumb - index finger, but it holds huge potential inside its tiny package.

 

Built-In Timer Automatically Shuts Off Cleanty

Leave the Scene : Just put Cleanty in your belongings as you turn it on. Built-in timer will control the sterilization period. You can easily clean inside of your belongings. It will automatically shut off after 10 mins of sterilization.

 

UVC LED Sterilizer, Cleanty : PEACE of MIND

Cleanty is rechargeable via USB cable like your phone. 1 charge guarantees about a month of daily normal use. And the life time of the LED is over 10,000 times. Cleanty will semi-permanently keep you safe. Also, the LED doesn't create any mercury or ozone. Use environmentally-friendly Cleanty!

UVC LED blocks proliferation of bacteria by destroying the DNA in them. UV sterilization is the best way to clean & keep you safe, compared to other methods(heat, chemical, ozone, radiation, etc). It kills all kinds of bacteria, that live in air, water, and surface. It takes just a few seconds for sterilization.

Compare it with sterilization of other UV lamps : LED is the most powerful, effective, and efficient way to sterilize. Especially, our LED partner LG Innotek is one of the unique companies producing UVC LED. We use UVC LED that emit perfect UVC wavelength.

We tested it everywhere from cellphones to bathroom. 90-99% Difference Consistently! (Do not use it directly on the body; use it on objects)

 

Uncut Demonstration

Here is some preview of Uncut Demonstration video! (Check full version at here) We used ATP measuring instrument from 3M. And you can check effectiveness of Cleanty with moving picture below.

 

Did you see? It comes out the smartphone button has 1048 RLU. 3M regulated three section for ATP measurement.

Safe: <250 RLU Pass: <500 RLU Caution: 501–999 RLU Fail: >1000 RLU

So, our team member's phone located in FAIL section.

 

And after Cleanty, it drops down to 18 RLU! 98.28% EFFECTIVENESS.

A nature of Cleanty is UVC LED technology. And actually, LED technology already have been proved to be effective. And Cleanty's creative point is that we applied high quality of LED (which has exact wave length for sterilization) to personal hygiene product like never before.

And Cleanty is the most smallest portable sterilizer. So everyone, you can totally trust it.

Find Your Own Infinite Use Cases

Cleanty world is boundless, and it's up to You. What does Cleanty mean to you? Is it a tiny sterilizer for your belongings? Is it a simple timer-function item? Or, is It your own creation that keeps growing with unique use cases?

Get Cleanty! Go create your OWN Cleanty world.

 

We help people with a stroke of light

We made Cleanty because we wanted to solve personal sterilization problems we face everyday.

As you checked at the top part of this project, actually a lot of hidden dangers are surrounding us in those environments. Invisible bacteria always leave people with illness, confection, and bad sanitation.

Why suffer from these uncomfortable feelings? Can't we kill bacteria in a simple way?

And finally, after 2 years of development, we made Cleanty. We illuminate your SURROUNDINGS to bring the cleanest environment possible with high quality sterilizing LED. Also we upgraded sterilization power, compact design, and additional function.

Risks and challenges

We have spent many working hours developing the final product. Our manufacturing network will be ready to begin mass production by the time the campaign comes to an end. There are no real risks involved.

We have shipped orders of CLEANTY ver.1. We can do this! Let's go!

story:
Campaign Update:

Hi Everyone, we want to take this opportunity to thank you for the overwhelming interest and enthusiasm. Thanks to your amazing support, we are now sold out with reservations for our first 7,000 pair. We have reached capacity and are no longer accepting pre orders, but will focus on fulfillment and improving our supply chain to deliver your Parásoles as smoothly as possible. 

For those who missed out on our limited first batch, we are sorry. Thanks for your understanding as we grow to better meet the demand. We promise to be back soon with new options and colors. Please keep in touch for the latest news and release dates through our social media and at parasolesocks.com

 

Parasoles are the world's first 3D recovery footwear that combine the comfort and freedom of a compression sock with key properties of a supportive insole, and traction and protection of an outsole.

Our Patent Pending technology is engineered with a generative designed polymer sole providing dynamic arch support, improved pressure distribution, and micro-cushioning.

Foot pain can have a profound impact on quality of life. A recent survey by The American Podiatric Medical Association (APMA) found that 77% of Americans have experienced foot pain and 51% have limited activity because of foot pain.

Many turn to insoles or prescription orthotics to help alleviate the pain, which is great, but what happens when we take off our shoes? We are left with an unsupported fatigued foot, which causes us to walk awkwardly while trying to avoid the pain, or look for the closest place to sit down and get off our feet.

We all love our socks but have always wished they could be more, and we could wear them in more places. 

 Parásoles help adapt the natural curves of your feet to the hard flat ground around you. The added utility of the polymer sole improves traction on slippery floors, and protects sock fibers from abrasion while relaxing inside or playing outside.

                                                                            

 

                                               
                

 Our newest color To Be UNLOCKED at $100,000. Teal/Heather. 

Premium form-fitting knit stretches to hug your feet for a custom fit and flexible support.

 

1. Click to Back this Project: Select the available reward tier you would like to pledge on the right side of the page or click here. Each backer may only make one pledge.

2. Payment: Enter your payment information. You won't be charged until the very end of our campaign.

3. Size, Color & Shipping Information: Don’t worry about that yet! You will get to select your size, color choice, and submit your shipping at the end of this campaign.

We are a team of industrial designers, biomedical experts, and footwear design professionals. Parásole Advanced Recovery was founded on the idea of creating wearable products and experiences that perform anatomically and environmentally better.

We believe there is a need for a new kind of footwear with measurable benefits like anatomical support and responsibly designed to help protect our environment.

Limited Edition Stealth Pack Available Now!

_

_

 
1. Click to Back this Project: Select the available reward tier you would like to pledge on the right side of the page or click here. Each backer may only make one pledge.
2. Payment: Enter your payment information. You won't be charged until the very end of our campaign.
3. Size, Color & Shipping Information: Don’t worry about that yet! You will get to select your size, color choice, and submit your shipping at the end of this campaign.


We are a team of industrial designers, biomedical experts, and footwear design professionals. Parásole Advanced Recovery was founded on the idea of creating wearable products and experiences that perform anatomically and environmentally better.
We believe there is a need for a new kind of footwear with measurable benefits like anatomical support and responsibly designed to help protect our environment.


 
 
 
 
We have spent the last 2 years on research and development of this patent-pending technology, and our team has been working tirelessly on wear testing and refinements to make sure Parásoles are ready for you. 
The generative designed polymer sole has gone through 5 generations of improvements. We are also working with our manufacturers on quality control, increased production capacity, and we have teamed up with a third party logistics company to ensure that we deliver your package efficiently and smoothly as possible.

story:
Inventor's Introduction

I am Tedessa Doff, a yoga instructor who has been practicing yoga for over 16 years. I have a long history of supporting people including:

  • Certified yoga instructor (200 hour RYT) and trained massage therapist
  • Undergrad degree in social work
  • Ten years as an executive administrative assistant
  • Eight years as a mom of young children

I created this campaign with the support of my husband, Jeff Doff, who has worked in product development & marketing for over ten years. Jeff has helped to launch products in the baby industry that have totaled over two million units sold, so it's been great to have an in-house consultant.

My company is Ujjaya ('ooh-jy-uh'), and our mission is to inspire & support people in taking better care of themselves, to create a kinder world.

The Balance Bottle is a perfect first product, as it literally supports people in yoga postures and in staying hydrated while reducing hassle & clutter.

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We have recently completed a successful crowdfunding campaign ($10,002 raised in 30 days) to support our tooling & first production run.
  • Now we are raising additional funds to support our first production run. Our goal is $3,000 but we are happy to raise more, and we're fine if we raise less. By taking orders through Indiegogo In Demand it helps to reduce our inventory risk and helps to get our product out into the market sooner, which will help us to spread the word.
  • You get to be the one of the first to have these exciting (we think) products and you get a discount for supporting us through Indiegogo.
  • This campaign succeeds at any level of funding - it is not dependent on reaching any particular dollar amount. The more $$ raised, the bigger our first production run can be / the less inventory we have to hold.

Risks & Challenges

  • We have lined up great manufacturing partners and we've done several rounds of prototyping. Everything is moving smoothly. One of the hardest parts was getting to the right design, which we did several months ago. We were delighted by the first foam prototypes, and we've refined the design and optimized the foam density for the Balance Bottle foam.
  • We are working with industry experts in every function (design, engineering, legal, graphics, sourcing, etc) to help reduce risk and ensure success.
  • Every project comes with risks and challenges. We have tried to plan conservatively for the unexpected so that we can deliver on time or early.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • We'd love your help in spreading the word via social media.
  • Please go ahead and try out / use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • If you know of any good contacts who you think we should connect with, please let us know.
  • We are also looking for product testers and product ambassadors. We have a limited supply of Balance Bottle prototypes. Let us know if you are interested in receiving one to use at your local yoga studio and/or yoga festivals, and we would greatly appreciate any and all feedback on the prototype.

Intellectual Property

  • Our trademarked names are UjjayaTM and Balance BottleTM
  • The Balance BottleTM is patents-pending
story_txt:
Inventor's Introduction

I am Tedessa Doff, a yoga instructor who has been practicing yoga for over 16 years. I have a long history of supporting people including:

Certified yoga instructor (200 hour RYT) and trained massage therapist
Undergrad degree in social work
Ten years as an executive administrative assistant
Eight years as a mom of young children

I created this campaign with the support of my husband, Jeff Doff, who has worked in product development & marketing for over ten years. Jeff has helped to launch products in the baby industry that have totaled over two million units sold, so it's been great to have an in-house consultant.
My company is Ujjaya ('ooh-jy-uh'), and our mission is to inspire & support people in taking better care of themselves, to create a kinder world.
The Balance Bottle is a perfect first product, as it literally supports people in yoga postures and in staying hydrated while reducing hassle & clutter.

The Balance BottleTM is patents-pending

story:
Short Summary

My name is Chris owner operator and head trainer with EliteFitnessGroup.ca. I have been training clients to effectively reach their goal for the last nine years. I have worked with clients of many different backgrounds:

  • Beginners looking to lose weight
  • Intermediates looking to step it up
  • Advanced athletes looking to take their game to the next level
  • People looking to change their habits to live a healthier happier life

I started in the fitness industry because I lost my father at the age of six to a massive heart attack due to being overweight with a poor diet. I had the experience of growing up with a single mother struggling to care for two boys. As soon as I was old enough, I made the decision that I wanted a career in preventing this from happening to other people - so I chose health and fitness.

What We Need & What You Get:

Currently, I am buidling my already growing client base as well as people intrested in belonging to EFG and the studio I'm looking to open. What I'm looking for is your help with the funding to open my dream studio. We will be starting small but growing together. It will take time but anything worth having always does. I will be dedicating a wall to everyone who helps begin this startup where I will put any name you send me on the wall. It will be know as the lifesaver wall. As the gym builds, I'm going to be printing t-shirts and hoodies and you will receive one of your choice. 

  • We're looking to raise $20,000 for first and last rent along with some equipment to start off with (as I currently own some to begin with already)
  • If we don't reach our target funding we will continue to work with our private clientele until we raise the necessary funds. 

The Difference Maker

I'm sure you're wondering what makes this gym different from any other? Well, first it's community: with the network of people I have met though my last nine years in the field, we have the ability to offer all types of fitness and alternative health options. We also have a large client base ready to join as soon as we are up and running. The other difference is our structure: our membership will be slightly more expensive at the basic level (only about 10-15 dollars extra per month). However, every member gets a free workout program and nutrition guide based on the outcome they want from a certified trainer every month to make sure they are getting the changes from the gym they want to see. Successful clients are happy and consistent clients. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Please use the Indiegogo share tool to get the word out to the community so we can start helping ours! Don't forget to follow us on Twitter (@Elitefitgroup) and 'like' our Facebook page (Elite Fitness Group)

And that’s all there is to it!

Thank you for your time and consideration,

 Chris De'Ath (Elite Fitness Group)

story:
Media

Below are a few links to some recent media stories that have been released over the duration of the campaign highlighting "Against All Odds - The Journey to New Mobility "  These stories have helped continue to spread the message far and wide.  Thank you to everyone for all that you are doing to help spread the message! 

BBC "Mallory Weggemann on paralysis, Paralympics and "walking" again" - September 29, 2013

Marie Claire "Mallory Weggemann: The Journey of New Mobility" - September 23, 2013

NBC KARE11 "MN Paralympian Vows to Walk Again" - September 4, 2013

Eagan Patch "Paralympic Gold Medalist, Eagan Grad Begins Campaign to Walk Again" - September 4, 2013

Swimming World TV "Morning Swim Show" - August 14, 2013


Swim Swam "Mallory Weggemann Launches Indiegogo Against All Odds Campaign" - August 7, 2013

Inside the Games "Paralympic Swimming Champion Launches Campaign" - August 6, 2013

My Story

January 21, 2008 my world completely changed.  I was 18 years old and just two months away from turning 19, I had just graduated high school the previous June and in a moment everything I knew changed.  I walked into a medical clinic to receive an epidural injection for back pain and I never walked out.  I walked in a healthy 18-year-old girl full of life and hope for what my future would offer and instead of walking out that afternoon I was admitted to the hospital because I had lost all feeling and movement from my belly button down; I was paralyzed.  It has been over five years since that day and I haven’t walked since that morning. 

For months I was determined that I would walk again until all the sudden the reality set in that I was paralyzed and I would never walk again.  I dreamed of what it would be like to put one foot in front of the other again, what it would be like to be able to simply stand up, to walk into a room and see my loved ones eye to eye.  I have dreamed of that day for years and here I am over five years later and I am ready to make that dream a reality but I can’t do it alone; I need your help. 

As I have worked on putting this campaign together it has been very hard for me to put it into words.  My biggest struggle is how do you vocalize a dream that is so incredibly simple?  For 18 years of my life I walked, I stood, I ran, I did all of it and I never thought twice about it, it was so incredibly simple.  Now here I am and it is one of my biggest dreams, something that for over 18 years of my life was second nature.  That memory of walking has faded for me, at times it feels so distant that it is hard to imagine that I ever did walk.

Now over five years later, I have decided that it is time to beat the odds and redefine mobility.  When I was paralyzed doctors, society and everything around me told me that I would have to learn to move about on four wheels and that was that, but that isn’t it, there are other options.  Options that allow me to stand up right, options that allow me to “walk” into a room and see my loved ones eye to eye for the first time in five years.  This is a dream that I have had for years but I have been fearful to chase.  I was diagnosed a T10 complete paraplegic (meaning I have no feeling or function from about my belly button down).  I guess for me I never thought it was possible for me to get up and walk again but I was wrong, I can and I will but I need your help to do it.

 

This Is What It Takes

Now many of you may be asking yourself how is a girl who is paralyzed going to get up and walk? Well, that is a very good question.  I have been diagnosed as a T10 complete paraplegic and my condition is stable and has been for the past five years.  My doctors have informed me that I will not regain function and that is not the purpose of going into this program at Rehabilitation Institute of Michigan.  What I will be doing though is learning how to use what I do have in my upper body to move my legs forward.  I will be fitted with leg braces that will lock out my knee joints out and fix my ankles at 90 degrees and then I will use my core and upper body to “swing” my legs forward.  I will also be using either forearm crutches or a walker to stabilize myself.  Now, this isn’t the graceful one foot in front of another that I used to do, however, it is still me up right on my feet moving towards something.

Unfortunately, insurance doesn’t cover the costs.  In order for me to achieve this dream of new mobility, this dream of “walking” I will be relocating to Detroit for an extended period of time (at least 4 weeks) to work with the Rehabilitation Institute of Michigan.  In order to do this I need to raise $50,000.  That money will go to cover the customized leg braces, the program costs (since my insurance doesn’t cover them) and costs associated with my stay in Detroit throughout this process. 

I know that $50,000 is a lot of money but I don’t want to stop there.  Although my goal is listed at $50,000 I want to raise beyond that.  I don’t just want to raise enough for me to walk, I want to raise enough so I can grant money out to other individuals like myself so they too can afford to chase their dream of new mobility.  Even if that means it is just one other person I want to know that this message and story went beyond me.

 

The Impact

Five years ago after I was paralyzed I created a dream, a dream of Paralympic Gold.  I grew up a competitive swimmer, I actually started swimming competitively at the age of 7 and when I was paralyzed at 18 I thought my days of swimming were over.  Less then 4 months after my paralysis I got back in the water and I created that dream, a dream that many said was impossible, until September 2, 2012 when I sat on the podium in London and saw our flag raised and heard the United States of America's national anthem play as I was presented with my gold medal.  That day I put all the doubters to rest.  That day I had achieved a dream of mine, but I didn’t do it alone.  I had a world of supporters behind me that allowed me to achieve that dream and this dream is very similar.  I have had people tell me everything that I won’t do again, one of the most obvious is that I will never walk again, but they are wrong and this is our chance to prove that.  This is our chance to give other individuals the hope that they too can walk someday.  This is our chance to leave an impact, to make a difference and to change the world. 

I grew up with a father that told my sisters and I, “You are the best.  You can make a difference.  You can change the world.” Over the past five years I have taken those words to heart.  Those words are what motivate me to do what I do on a daily basis and throughout this campaign I truly believe that we all have the ability to do just that. 

It is my goal to keep all of you informed and as this campaign unfolds continue to share my story with you.  I have created a blog that I will be posting on a couple times a week throughout the campaign and beyond. 

I know this may seem simple, it may even seem small to some but the freedom that comes with being able to simply stand up and place on foot in front of the other is something that I have learned first hand we can’t take for granted.  It is so easy to get wrapped up in life and forget about the little things but it is my hope that if anything this allows everyone to slow down, even if for just five minutes and take it all in, appreciate the little things, because you never know when it can all change. 

So please help me in making this dream come true for me and others out there like myself.  Help us enjoy the simplest joy of walking. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Every dollar counts and is greatly appreciated but it doesn’t stop there.  Please, I ask all of you, whether you are able to donate or not to spread the word.  Pass this along to your family, friends, post it on Facebook, Tweet it and hastag #againstallodds, share far and wide and help me spread the message, and of course thoughts and prayers are always appreciated because I can’t do this alone. 

The amount of gratitude that I have for each and every person that is reading this page is beyond anything I may ever be able to put into words but THANK YOU! I never thought I would have the ability to dream of walking again and the overwhelming love and support from people far and wide, from individuals that I don’t even know is so incredibly humbling and I can’t thank you enough.

So please pass along the word and be sure to follow this page and my blog for updates along the way. 

Thank you from the bottom of my heart.

- Mallory

 

The proceeds raised in this campaign go to help myself learn how to walk with leg braces and arm crutches for the first time since my paralysis in 2008.  The $50,000 will go towards paying for the customized braces, program costs and living expenses that go with relocating from Minnesota to Detroit while I am in the program at the Rehabilitation Institute of Michigan.  Unfortunately, insurance doesn't cover these costs so that is why I am asking all of you for your support.  Although my goal is listed at $50,000 I would like to raise an excess so I can help other's like myself achieve their dreams of new moblity. 

Note, if you donate through PayPal your donation IS tax deductible.  

Also note, if you are a business or an organization and you're interested in supporting this campaign, but you wish to inquire regarding other options please contact me at mweggemann@gmail.com

story:
UPDATE: 

The World Bank will match funds raised up to $50,000!

“This is an exciting opportunity to explore alternative mechanisms of financing projects, as well as to test the viability of mobile sensor technologies to address development challenges,” said Chris Vein, Chief Innovation Officer for Global ICT Development at the World Bank.


Read more about the World Bank's involvement in our press release.



New Perk: 

Backers will receive a digital copy of the World Bank’s official feasibility study of mobile infrastructure sensors for improved public service delivery, featuring an exclusive foreword for IndieGoGo donors.

-------------------------------------

All donations are tax-deductible contributions to WellDone International, the creator of MoMo and a 501(c)3 non-profit organization with EIN 27-1662243. 

What's the problem?

You have probably heard the statistics: nearly 1 billion people around the world without access to clean water, 2 billion without access to adequate sanitation.  But you might not have heard the other, equally alarming side of the story.  Water projects that are installed often do not last beyond a few years.  The International Institute for Environment and Development estimates that anywhere from 30-60% of community water projects do not last beyond 5 years, while WaterAid estimates that 1 in 3 water pumps in the developing world aren't functioning at any given time.

Nobody really knows the actual numbers behind failure rates, since long-term monitoring of projects is rare.  When projects fail, communities revert to unsafe water sources and open defecation, and the cycle of inequity continues. All the while, aid continues to pour into traditional water and sanitation projects around the world (UN Water estimates that roughly $8 billion dollars of aid was provided in 2010 alone).  

Here are some additional resources that illustrate just how widespread the problem is:

  • Handpump data from the Rural Water and Sanitation Network
  • Additional resources and statistics on the problem worldwide

What is MoMo?

We are developing and deploying a low-cost, low-power solution to monitor the functionality of water infrastructure remotely in the developing world.  MoMo (Mobile Monitor) is a mobile device that attaches to critical infrastructure and reports automatically via text message how the systems are used and when projects break or are abandoned.


MoMo is affordable, simple, and flexible, allowing workers in the field to install the product quickly, connect a variety of sensors and communicate data via the mobile network.  With MoMo, local governments, aid organizations, and individual donors will be able to easily check whether aid projects are still functioning from any computer or cell phone.  Anyone from a repairman in Tanzania to a private donor in the U.S. can check on the status of projects they're interested in with the click of a button.  When a facility breaks down or goes unused, local governments and donors will be immediately alerted, ensuring that no project goes unrepaired or left abandoned without notice.

MoMos are:

  • Open Source: our designs are freely available so anyone can build their own MoMo.
  • Low Power: we designed the device to run on cell phone batteries and last for long periods without maintenance
  • Low Cost:  we have reduced our cost of materials to below $50 so that MoMos are affordable to those who need them in poor communities
  • Flexible:  the device can connect to a variety of sensors in a plug-and-play fashion and send data via the mobile network.

For a more detailed background on MoMo, you can check out:

  • MoMo: A First Look
  • The MoMo Brochure
  • MoMo Product Brief

Track Record

We have tested and presented MoMo in Ethiopia, Uganda, Rwanda, and Tanzania. MoMo has been showcased at GE's Water 2.0, Mobile World Congress, and IRC's Water Monitoring Symposium, and was recently featured in Wired Magazine. Several organizations have expressed interest in adopting MoMo once we are able to demonstrate success at larger scale.

                 


The Pilot 

We are ready for a larger test to prove the impact of our technology, and we have partners in Tanzania that are willing to help us do it. This campaign will support a 300 MoMo pilot alongside WaterAid Tanzania.

All we need is the capital to produce 300 devices ($30,000), and test ($5,000), deploy ($5,000), and monitor ($10,000) them.

If you choose to help make this project a reality you will even be able to track the progress yourself by viewing MoMo reports on our website.

Should we exceed our funding target, the surplus will be used to fund further MoMo R&D as well as possible future small pilot projects across the developing world.

Team

MoMo has been developed by an all-volunteer team of engineers and product managers, staying up late and paying for prototyping out of our own pockets.  Your financial support at this stage in our work can provide our team critical resources to take MoMo to the next level.

Learn more about our core team members below:

Tim Burke, Hardware

As a Peace Corps volunteer, Tim developed a pico-hydropower system in rural Panama sponsored by UNDP. The project won international renown as an example of sustainable rural electrification. Tim has also worked on access to clean water and primary healthcare in Nicaragua. He is currently a doctoral candidate at Stanford University in Materials Science.

Austin McGee, Software

Austin is a software engineer at IBM with their Endpoint Manager platform infrastructure team and previously worked at BigFix and MoosePoint Technology. He has specialized in distributed systems, data security, and GIS. Austin graduated from UC Berkeley with degrees in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, and Music. He plays a mean trumpet.

Ben Armstrong, Operations

Ben has worked with entrepreneurs in Uganda and with agriculturists and technologists in Ghana and Nigeria. He previously worked at Google, where he sought to improve technology use at African universities and the Supreme Court of Ghana. He is also a PhD student at MIT.

We are also indebted to a number of excellent technical and non-technical advisors and volunteers who helped build MoMo. The larger team is listed at www.welldone.org.

Our biggest thanks go to Dan Schwartzbaum and James Buyayo for their videography and photography skills!

Mo' Money, Mo' Solutions

The money from this campaign will prove the MoMo concept for water and allow us to expand and address additional problems with unreliable infrastructure. Monitoring latrines can ensure that more people have reliable access to safe sanitation. Monitoring off-grid power systems can support more reliable power supply. The possibilities are massive if we can make it to scale. With MoMo, we ultimately envision the ability to track any rural infrastructure project remotely and in real time.

We believe this has the potential to radically change basic service delivery in the developing world, introducing a level of knowledge, transparency, and accountability that ensures all people can access the critical infrastructure that supports their health, wealth, and happiness.


About the World Bank’s involvement

The World Bank’s mission to reduce poverty and increase shared prosperity relies partly on experimenting with new ways of doing business. To this end, this initiative aims to: A) explore the feasibility of crowdfunding mechanisms to support development projects; B) pilot and evaluate the implementation of mobile sensors to improve public service delivery, and C) raise awareness about challenges and ICT-enabled opportunities facing the water sector in  Tanzania. The World Bank’s involvement in this campaign is not to be interpreted as an endorsement for Well Done, IndieGoGo, or other related entities, but rather as an experiment of the viability of this financing mechanism and of mobile sensor technologies to support development outcomes.
story_txt:
UPDATE: The World Bank will match funds raised up to $50,000!“This is an exciting opportunity to explore alternative mechanisms of financing projects, as well as to test the viability of mobile sensor technologies to address development challenges,” said Chris Vein, Chief Innovation Officer for Global ICT Development at the World Bank.Read more about the World Bank's involvement in our press release.New Perk: 
Backers will receive a digital copy of the World Bank’s official feasibility
study of mobile infrastructure sensors for improved public service delivery,
featuring an exclusive foreword for IndieGoGo donors.-------------------------------------All donations are tax-deductible contributions to WellDone International, the creator of MoMo and a 501(c)3 non-profit organization with EIN 27-1662243. What's the problem?
You have probably heard the statistics: nearly 1 billion people around the world without access to clean water, 2 billion without access to adequate sanitation.  But you might not have heard the other, equally alarming side of the story.  Water projects that are installed often do not last beyond a few years.  The International Institute for Environment and Development estimates that anywhere from 30-60% of community water projects do not last beyond 5 years, while WaterAid estimates that 1 in 3 water pumps in the developing world aren't functioning at any given time.Nobody really knows the actual numbers behind failure rates, since long-term monitoring of projects is rare.  When projects fail, communities revert to unsafe water sources and open defecation, and the cycle of inequity continues. All the while, aid continues to pour into traditional water and sanitation projects around the world (UN Water estimates that roughly $8 billion dollars of aid was provided in 2010 alone).  Here are some additional resources that illustrate just how widespread the problem is:

Handpump data from the Rural Water and Sanitation Network


Additional resources and statistics on the problem worldwide

What is MoMo?We are developing and deploying a low-cost, low-power solution to monitor the functionality of water infrastructure remotely in the developing world.  MoMo (Mobile Monitor) is a mobile device that attaches to critical infrastructure and reports automatically via text message how the systems are used and when projects break or are abandoned.MoMo is affordable, simple, and flexible, allowing workers in the field to install the product quickly, connect a variety of sensors and communicate data via the mobile network.  With MoMo, local governments, aid organizations, and individual donors will be able to easily check whether aid projects are still functioning from any computer or cell phone.  Anyone from a repairman in Tanzania to a private donor in the U.S. can check on the status of projects they're interested in with the click of a button.  When a facility breaks down or goes unused, local governments and donors will be immediately alerted, ensuring that no project goes unrepaired or left abandoned without notice.MoMos are:
Open Source: our designs are freely available so anyone can build their own MoMo.
Low Power: we designed the device to run on cell phone batteries and last for long periods without maintenance
Low Cost:  we have reduced our cost of materials to below $50 so that MoMos are affordable to those who need them in poor communities
Flexible:  the device can connect to a variety of sensors in a plug-and-play fashion and send data via the mobile network.
For a more detailed background on MoMo, you can check out:
MoMo: A First Look
The MoMo Brochure
MoMo Product Brief

He has specialized in distributed systems, data security, and GIS. Austin graduated from UC Berkeley with degrees in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, and Music. He plays a mean trumpet.Ben Armstrong, OperationsBen has worked with entrepreneurs in Uganda and with agriculturists and technologists in Ghana and Nigeria. He previously worked at Google, where he sought to improve technology use at African universities and the Supreme Court of Ghana. He is also a PhD student at MIT.We are also indebted to a number of excellent technical and non-technical advisors and volunteers who helped build MoMo. The larger team is listed at www.welldone.org.Our biggest thanks go to Dan Schwartzbaum and James Buyayo for their videography and photography skills!Mo' Money, Mo' SolutionsThe money from this campaign will prove the MoMo concept for water and allow us to expand and address additional problems with unreliable infrastructure. story:
Short Summary

First let me thank you for taking the time to stop by to see what this is all about.

The above video is an illustration of the treatments I go through every Mon., Wed., and Fri. I am very grateful for the life that dialysis has allowed me to have. You see, for the past 8 years, every Monday, Wednesday, and Friday for anywhere from 4-7 hours, I have had to hook up to a machine, have my blood filtered to remove toxins from my system and literally have the machine perform the duties that my kidneys can no longer perform. Without this life saving dialysis treatment, toxins would build up in my system, fluids would begin to build and soon, I would die.

Additionally, each year, for the past 8 years, I've had to undergo an evaluation to assess my body's ability to sustain a kidney transplant procedure and follow up recovery. In 2011, while undergoing my annual evaluation, a cancerous nodule was found on one of my kidneys. My doctors felt that the best course of action would be to remove both kidneys since the likelihood would be that the cancer would spread to my other kidney.

I live now with no kidneys. You may ask, how can I survive with no kidneys. The doctors assured me that I could survive with continued, regular dialysis and better yet, a kidney transplant. 

But I need your help!

My doctors have informed me that because of a high antibody count, my best chance for survival is a kidney from a living donor. Don't be afraid, we can live with just one kidney.

Even though my insurance company will cover most things, there are expenses such as hospital visits, clinics, medications, living expenses while I am recovering and other related expenses, that insurance will not cover. 

All funds raised in this campaign will go towards the transplant and related expenses. Any amount you can contribute will go a long way towards helping with the financial burden. 

I am also in desperate need of a caring individual, willing to give me a second chance at life. Some of the advantages of a live donor transplant include a much better quality of kidney, short ischemic time (expect kidney to function immediately), won't need to wait on the transplant list, transplant can be scheduled, less chance of rejection, live donor kidneys usually last twice as long as deceased donor kidneys.

So you can see why a live donor transplant is the best alternative for me.

I am on the transplant list with St. Luke's Hospital in Houston, Texas. If you want more information on donating a kidney to me, you can contact the Living Donor Nurse Coordinator, Elizabeth Martin, RN at St. Luke's Hospital at 832-355-7061.

While I am eternally grateful for the life that dialysis has given me, and all the wonderful staff at Davita Omni Dialysis Center, I long for the day when I am free of that machines sustaining my life.

As you may know, one of the tools used on Indiegogo is perks to encourage contributors. The only perk I can offer is deep gratitude. Please know that your contribution is going to aid a loving mother and grandmother who without help faces tremendous challenges. 

I'll keep you informed of my progress and please know that I offer my most sincere and heartfelt thanks!!

story:
My name is Alisha, I am trying to raise funds in order for my mother to receive a new eye.

My mother lost her eye approximately 23 years ago due to a bottle rocket incident, the bottle rocket flew out of control and blew up in her face, causing facial deformities and of course the loss of her entire eye, eye ball, socket etc. She had over 12 facial reconstruction surgeries which were beautifully done and today you would never know she had them done if she didnt tell you herself. Unfortunately, she has never been able to afford a new eye so she has been wearing the same glass eye for 23 years, doctors recommend by this time in her life to have had at least 3-4 new eyes but for her this is not the case. She steadily tells me that she wishes to have a new eye and I can tell by the sadness in her face that this is one of the few things she desperately needs. The eye being as old as it is, is now hurting her and she ends up having to take her eye out because it irritates her so much, the eye is now dull from the many years of use and her doctor, at every visit, insists she get a new ocular prosthesis already because she is so long overdue. My mother is a hard working woman, she works full time to support my 2 younger siblings, I believe she deserves this and I am hoping out of the greatness of your heart that she can receive the new gift she desperately needs. Thank you for taking the time to read this and I am anxiously hoping to reach our goal, she at this time is not aware that I am attempting to raise the funds for her, I am trying to keep this a surprise. Just to show her that I care and people care. Lets all help her together!

Thank you kindly.

 

-Alisha Edwards
