story:
Motivation, Accountability, Better Results

Now, more than ever, we need to make time for more meaningful exercise and the soul-enriching opportunity to spend time outdoors. Unfortunately, we've resorted to over-scheduling ourselves and procrastinating on personal wellness...

...Until now. For the first time ever, outdoor on-river rowing classes will be broadcast live streaming to your home. Trainers are top athletes, including some who have competed with the U.S. National Rowing Team. You can connect, compete, and reach your goals faster and easier than ever before.

 

Learn the basics of rowing and proper resistance training in just minutes from world-class rowing instructors live-streaming from the river.

 

 Stay motivated with workout buddies from across the nation. Row together as a team, or race each other to the finish line.  

 

HYDROW ANNOUNCEMENT: Stretch Goals!

Once our pre-order campaign reaches new heights, everyone can enjoy these great extra perks for being an early adopter:

 

The Live Outdoor Reality™ Rowing Revolution is Making Headlines

  • "Unlike any indoor rower you’ve ever seen. This objet d’art, with its sculptural design, features a sleek HD touchscreen monitor that delivers an immersive outdoor rowing experience at home." - Style of Sport 
  • "Stunning. Its smooth edges, silent strokes, and neatly fastened 22-inch screen give it a modern look and feel that is still rooted in the functional foundation of every rowing machine that came before it." - Chris Cardoza, Rowing Magazine
  • "When you get on, you'll feel just like you're on the Charles [River]." - Adam Weddle, Boston Magazine
  • "Using part-cameras, part-courage, and a whole ton of muscle, Hydrow's workout is an attempt to make a more visually appealing addition to the popular and competitive at-home digital workout market." - Jeff Tomko, Metro

 

Four Ways To Get Your Workout In

24-Hour access to classes for all-experience levels.

 

A Better Workout In Half The Time

24-Hour access to classes for all-experience levels.

 

 

200 Filmed Sessions and Counting...

As of today, we have filmed over 200 recorded outdoor rowing sessions and are working on many more. We can't wait for you to row with us.

 

Why I Love Hydrow Rowing

In this cut from our video, hear strength & conditioning coach Peter Donohoe talk about some of the things he loves about Hydrow.

 
 

 

Hydrow is in a League of its Own

This superior rowing machine is in a category all its own. These carefully thought out and precisely engineered features craft an experience unlike any other. 

 

See Hydrow in Action

 

 

Fully Immersive Rowing For the Whole Family

Feel the power of the river with a connected HD touchscreen and training programs that adjust your resistance in real time. Set up multiple users with multiple profiles for your Hydrow. 

 

 

Designed With Tight Spaces in Mind

The footprint of Hydrow is 86" long by 24" wide, so it can squeeze into a pretty tight spot (height is just less than 4 feet including the screen). It can be stored upright with a floor stabilizer available for purchase. The upright storage footprint is just 24" x 32"*.

 

Technology That Works As Hard As You Do

Hydrow's computer-controlled resistance technology can adjust 100 times per second to create resistance that matches traditional rowing machines, different types of on-water boats, or even a weight stack.

 

 

 

Specification Measurement
Dimensions Approx. 85"L x 25"W x 45" H
Stored dimensions*

24”x 33” and 85" high
*Floor Stabilizer needed for vertical storage
Hydrow Weight Approx. 130 lbs.
Height limit Fits up to a 36" inseam
Weight limit Holds up to 375 lbs.
Resistance Mechanism Quiet, microprocessor-controlled resistance that adjusts 100 times per second
Connections Bluetooth & WiFi
Heart Rate Monitoring Bluetooth and ANT+ enabled
Screen size 22"
Screen resolution 1920 x 1080 Full HD
Screen Touch Technology PCAP
Screen Sweat and Dust Resistance IP52
Speakers Amplifier x2 channel, 3W, 8 ohms, front facing for immersive experience
Microphone Included
Camera 2 megapixel
Seat Ergonically designed seat w/ advanced cushion system
Seat Rollers 10-roller system for a lifetime of extra smooth operation
Feet Soft rubberized feet to protect floors from scratches
Monitor Pivot Screen pivots 25 degrees in each direction for classes off the machine
Monitor Fold Monitor folds flat for storage
Monitor Angle Adjustment Monitor adjusts 15 degrees for the perfect viewing angle
Foot Stretcher Adjustment Easy adjustment for correct foot placement
Seat Height Designed for easy on-and-off
Handle Ergonic design for low-stress grip
Handle Connection High quality webbing for super smooth and quiet operation
Materials Aluminum and steel frame with flat anthracite polymer body

 

Row With The Best

Hydrow trainers are athletes who understand just how important it is to connect with people. Come join them and feel inspired to be your best!

 

Dani aka DaniHani learned to row at the University of Washington, she's a 2016 Paralympic silver medalist. She's also a 4-time silver medalist at the World Championships and won a gold medal at the 2018 World Championships. She designs her workouts to be accessible and fun. You can’t help but get inspired by Dani’s passion for rowing.

After rowing at UCSB, Adam moved to Boston to train for the US National Team. He designs his workouts to help you be the best version of yourself.  When he’s not out on the water for CREW, he’s chasing his dream to represent the United States in 2020. You can be a part of that dream by rowing with Adam.

Sera is a true outdoors woman, she competed internationally as a rock climber for over a decade and is now making her mark in the rowing world. An aspiring member of the US National Team, her workouts are designed to make you stronger; each and every row.

Nick is a nationally ranked Triathlete and rowing enthusiast. His workouts combine a deep knowledge of endurance sports and years of coaching and training experience. He maps his workouts and music to drive you to new fitness heights.

James is a true soul surfer of rowing. From representing the USA in international competition to coastal rowing adventures, you will feel his energy and love of life shine through.

 

New to Rowing? Join The Movement

Hydrow will catch you from the very first stroke! Don't believe us? We're committed to covering every detail:

 

Complete Your First 60 Rows & Help Provide Access to Safe Water for Families in Need

You know just how important water is to a healthy body and a fulfilling life. As soon as you hit your first 60 rows, Hydrow will donate to Water.org in support of providing access to safe water and sanitation for a family in need - making you part of the solution as well.

 

The Legend of Hydrow

 

 

 

We Are On Track To Deliver

Shipping

We are shipping to the USA first, and then we will be shipping worldwide depending on how many backers will pre-order from each country. We will keep open, honest communication about when we begin shipping your Hydrow, and we plan to refund your pledge if your country is not soon enough for you. VAT and GST not included. Please see reward details for the shipping cost that applies to you.

We plan to ship the product starting in May 2019. There will be lots of variation in when you actually receive your Hydrow based on your location. We are keeping a detailed account of shipping progress via the Indiegogo Updates section.
 

WHY CROWDFUNDING? 

Hydrow by CREW is a well-funded startup led by a respected and established figure in US rowing. Some people use Indiegogo to get funding for development and production, that is not the case with Hydrow. We are already in production. We are using Indiegogo to lock early orders, build a community, and accelerate production.

 

Warranty & Satisfaction Guarantee

We are sure you're going to love your Hydrow. We are so sure, we'll offer you a we'll offer you a full refund for 14 days after date of delivery. from date of delivery. If you are not satisfied, we will accept the a return but will require you to pay the return shipping, and the Hydrow must be in virtually new condition.

Hydrow comes with a limited parts and labor warranty when sold through the Indiegogo campaign.  Labor is covered for one year.  The screen, other electronics, and wear items are covered for two years.  The frame and other mechanical parts are covered for five years.


Warranties are not transferable.
story_txt:
Motivation, Accountability, Better ResultsNow, more than ever, we need to make time for more meaningful exercise and the soul-enriching opportunity to spend time outdoors. Unfortunately, we've resorted to over-scheduling ourselves and procrastinating on personal wellness......Until now. For the first time ever, outdoor on-river rowing classes will be broadcast live streaming to your home. Trainers are top athletes, including some who have competed with the U.S. National Rowing Team. You can connect, compete, and reach your goals faster and easier than ever before. Learn the basics of rowing and proper resistance training in just minutes from world-class rowing instructors live-streaming from the river.  Stay motivated with workout buddies from across the nation. Row together as a team, or race each other to the finish line.   HYDROW ANNOUNCEMENT: Stretch Goals!Once our pre-order campaign reaches new heights, everyone can enjoy these great extra perks for being an early adopter: The Live Outdoor Reality™ Rowing Revolution is Making Headlines
"Unlike any indoor rower you’ve ever seen. This objet d’art, with its sculptural design, features a sleek HD touchscreen monitor that delivers an immersive outdoor rowing experience at home." - Style of Sport 
"Stunning. Its smooth edges, silent strokes, and neatly fastened 22-inch screen give it a modern look and feel that is still rooted in the functional foundation of every rowing machine that came before it." - Chris Cardoza, Rowing Magazine

"When you get on, you'll feel just like you're on the Charles [River]." - Adam Weddle, Boston Magazine

"Using part-cameras, part-courage, and a whole ton of muscle, Hydrow's workout is an attempt to make a more visually appealing addition to the popular and competitive at-home digital workout market." - Jeff Tomko, Metro

 Four Ways To Get Your Workout In24-Hour access to classes for all-experience levels. A Better Workout In Half The Time24-Hour access to classes for all-experience levels.  200 Filmed Sessions and Counting...As of today, we have filmed over 200 recorded outdoor rowing sessions and are working on many more. We can't wait for you to row with us. Why I Love Hydrow RowingIn this cut from our video, hear strength & conditioning coach Peter Donohoe talk about some of the things he loves about Hydrow.   Hydrow is in a League of its OwnThis superior rowing machine is in a category all its own. These carefully thought out and precisely engineered features craft an experience unlike any other.  See Hydrow in Action  Fully Immersive Rowing For the Whole FamilyFeel the power of the river with a connected HD touchscreen and training programs that adjust your resistance in real time. Set up multiple users with multiple profiles for your Hydrow.   Designed With Tight Spaces in MindThe footprint of Hydrow is 86" long by 24" wide, so it can squeeze into a pretty tight spot (height is just less than 4 feet including the screen). It can be stored upright with a floor stabilizer available for purchase. The upright storage footprint is just 24" x 32"*. Technology That Works As Hard As You DoHydrow's computer-controlled resistance technology can adjust 100 times per second to create resistance that matches traditional rowing machines, different types of on-water boats, or even a weight stack.

Monitor Fold
Monitor folds flat for storage


Monitor Angle Adjustment
Monitor adjusts 15 degrees for the perfect viewing angle

Easy adjustment for correct foot placement

story:
Oh No! There’s A Stain on Your Teeth!

Have you ever experience such issue？Like food caught in between your teeth and you can’t seem to get it out. You won’t even take a slice of chocolate cake because you’re afraid of the stain.

 

Don’t worry, YOX dental floss will save your day in just 28 seconds.

Now you could enjoy any food you want.

A New Generation of Water Flosser

YOX is a compact and aesthetic water flosser for all types of users.This unique and neatly designed water flosser could release pressurize water of up to 65PSI It comes with 2 cleaning modes that cleans your teeth efficiently. The best part? It is user-friendly for people who are always on the go.

Sleek and Aesthetic Design

YOX is more than just a practical teeth cleaning tool. It is an aesthetic water flosser that uses a collapsible and neat design. YOX rectangular design comes with a “see-through” case and a metallic cap to complete the whole look.

Small in Size

YOX is smaller than a mobile phone, it can be carried in a pocket, and you can clean your teeth anytime, anywhere.

Convenient and Portable

YOX water flosser is so convenient, you could bring it anywhere with you, even when you’re having your meal. If you have food stuck between your teeth and need a quick rinse, all you need to do is use YOX water flosser for 28~38 seconds, and your teeth will be clean again. Besides, a fresh breath keeps your day going.

 

 Two Cleaning Modes

YOX comes with two cleaning modes to suit your personal needs.

Max 65PSI Water Pressure

YOX is safe and comfortable to all users. It uses a unique combination of water pressure and pulsations to deeply clean between teeth and below the gumline without causing damage. You could easily remove chocolate stain or greens stuck between teeth. Besides that, it could also remove food from hard-to-reach angles of the teeth where traditional brushing and flossing can't reach.

 

0.3mm Precise Nozzle

At 0.3mm, YOX has the smallest nozzle in the market. The high light of this nozzle lies at the precision of the water coming out of the nozzle. The pressurized and precize water could remove food stuck between teeth in a matter of seconds.

 

Suitable For Users With Braces

YOX's additional orthodontic head is specifically designed to clean braces. The orthondic head releases pressured water stream and the fine brushes could thoroughly clean dirty spots while being soft on the gums and braces.

Big Water Space

At 72ml, you could water floss twice a day.

Long Lasting Battery

YOX is equipped with 500mAh battery and could last you up to 40 days in a single charge. It’s great for using it outdoors and you don’t have to worry about low power anymore.

Forgot to turn off the power ? No sweat. Our power saving feature automatically shuts off the water flosser after 45 seconds. You don’t have to risk having water spurting everywhere.

Easy to Use

Each step of YOX is very simple. You can use it anytime and anywhere with water or bring your own mouth wash, which is very suitable for outing use.

 

Parts of YOX

Specifications

What Do You Get？

Behind The Scenes

YOX originated from Hm Brand Operation Management Limited.  And it started off with the idea of redefining teeth cleaning gadgets. It may be the start of our journey but YOX is committed to adhere strict quality control, innovative design and provide excellent services in personal health care products.

story:
Oksana's Story

Oksana Izio was involved in a  car accident outside of Slave Lake on August 5, 2012.  Her and her boyfriend were traveling back to Slave Lake from Edmonton when their vehicle struck a moose 12 km outside of town.  She sustained injuries to her C5-C7 vertebrae of her spine and is paralyzed from her shoulders down.  She is currently at a rehabilitation hospital in Edmonton and will be moving into a new home and continuing on her rehabilitation process in March, 2013.

Her compassion and positive attitude has never once faltered during the hardships she has had to face. Oksana is the most uplifting, courageous, self-less, kind spirited person you will ever meet. She has accomplished so many unbelievable things in her life so far - from teaching English in Japan, backpacking Central America, to researching in the Arctic and is currently working on finishing her last semester at the University of Alberta for a degree in wildlife biology.  She won't be stopped! 

Donate Today!

Oksana is determined to prove the doctors wrong and will walk again!  By donating you will help in this incredible healing journey.  Your donation will go towards the equipment she needs in her new home and for her rehabiliation.  

Thank you very much for your kind donation! 

Check out Oksana on CTV Edmonton!

http://edmonton.ctvnews.ca/edmonton-woman-who-i...

story:
Hier ein Auszug über diverse Artikel über diese heimtückische Infektionsart:

http://www.borreliose-infektionskrankheiten.de/diagnose-und-verlauf.html

Hierzu ein Auszug:

Während des zweiten Stadiums der Borreliose breiten sich die Erreger im Körper aus und können alle Organe und Gewebe befallen. In der Folge kann es zu einer Entzündung der Hirnhaut und des Herzmuskels kommen. Die hierbei auftretenden Symptome unterscheiden sich stark, abhängig davon, welche Bereiche die Borrelien hauptsächlich befallen haben.

Liegen bereits seit mehreren Jahren Beschwerden vor oder treten diese immer wieder in Schüben auf, ohne dass eine andere zugrunde liegende Krankheit gefunden werden kann, kann es sich auch hierbei um eine Borreliose handeln. In diesen Fällen wird zumeist von einer chronischen Borreliose gesprochen. Da bei einem derartigen Krankheitsverlauf häufig keine Wanderröte mehr festgestellt wird, fehlt diese von vornherein als krankheitsbeweisendes Anzeichen. Zudem sind die Symptome oft sehr diffus, was die Diagnose zusätzlich erschwert. Dennoch kann auch eine chronische Verlaufsform diagnostiziert werden. Hierzu sind zum einen Blutuntersuchungen angeraten, zum anderen können auch Biopsien Aufschluss bringen.

Hier ein Auszug:

Die AHIT®-Therapie (Autologe Immuntherapie) ist ein therapeutisches Prinzip zur Behandlung von Krankheiten, die auf eine Fehlfunktion des menschlichen Immun-
systems zurückzuführen sind. Hochwirksame Substanzen, die das Immunsystem regulieren können, werden aus dem Blut und/oder dem Harn des jeweiligen Patienten gewonnen. Danach werden sie konzentriert und aktiviert und so zu pharmazeutischen Präparaten aufgearbeitet, die individuell auf den einzelnen Patienten zugeschnitten werden.

Die AHIT®-Therapie verbindet die klassische mit der naturheilkundlichen Medizin. Sie wird mit großem Erfolg eingesetzt in der Therapie so genannter atopischer (allergischer) Erkrankungen wie Neurodermitis, Asthma, Schuppenflechte (Psoriasis) und Rheuma. Auch weitere – lebensbedrohliche – Zivilisationskrankheiten sind bereits mit Erfolg therapiert worden. Forschung und Entwicklung in dieser Hinsicht werden mit Nachdruck verfolgt.

Die AHIT®-Therapie wurde 1986 durch den Ludwigshafener Arzt Dr. med. Horst Kief entwickelt, der dem Leitgedanken folgte, eine Therapie zu entwickeln, mit der er das Immunsystem des Patienten steuern könnte. Die konsequente Verfolgung dieser Idee führte, insbesondere in ganz bemerkenswertem Umfang bei Neurodermitis - und Psoriasis-Patienten, zu einem äußerst effektiven klinischen Ergebnis. Patienten, die nach diesem Verfahren behandelt wurden, zeigten häufig schon nach kurzer Zeit eine drastische Besserung ihres Hautbildes, das auch nach Absetzen der Therapie erhalten blieb.

Die kontinuierlich optimierte AHIT®-Therapie wurde bereits in mehr als 17.000 Fällen angewandt. Untersuchungen belegen markante Erfolge bei der Mehrzahl der Patienten. Je nach Art der Erkrankungen liegen die nachhaltigen Behandlungserfolge bei 80 bis 90 %.

story:
The test of the morality of a society is what it does for its children.


Dietrich Bonhoeffer

PLEASE DON'T JUST VISIT WE HAVE HAD SEVERAL VISITORS TO DATE.  THESE KIDS NEED OUR HELP, THEY NEED YOUR HELP.  PLEASE HELP US HELP THEM TODAY!  THANK YOU FOR COMMITTING TO HELP FINANCIALLY  AND ALSO SPREAD THE WORD.  EVERY MOMENT THAT GOES BY MORE CHILDREN WILL BE PLACED IN MORE SITUATION THAT WILL DETERMINE THE FUTURE OF THEIR LIVES FOR THE BETTER OR THE WORSE WITH OUT YOUR HELP!
THANK YOU.


Our goal is to provide a private non-governmental campus for At Risk Kids.  A place where loving professionals can provide avenues of relief with the intent and hope of a life-long impact.  Having interviewed and discussed this vision to many individuals involved in this area of expertise we believe that Lothlorien Campus is the place for this to best provide for these plans.

The video demonstrates the significant need that children have for a safe place where life changing experiences can happen.  Though the video is made to raise concerns found in Canada, the Board felt that it really was not area specific and demonstrated the need that we are addressing at Lothlorien Campus. 

If you have a heart for Children at Risk please join us in this endeavour.  Your gift whether greater or smaller will have a important impact on Children at Risk.  Thank you for your involvement and please spread the word.  Our window is very narrow to capture this moment.  Thank you!

______________________________________________________________________

At-risk kids are kids that have demonstrated themselves to be "at risk" of emotional, social and learning disabilities. Often, kids are described as "at risk" if they have a history of emotional or physical abuse or neglect. If the child's parents are substance abusers, the children may be assumed to be at risk. The U.S. Census Bureau studied populations of children at risk and identified certain characteristics of this group, such as common personal and familial conditions.

Kids defined to be "at-risk" are between the ages of 5 and 17. This age group is school-aged. Children below this age are often too young to exhibit the symptoms of neglect or abuse. Students over the age of 17 are considered adults.

At-risk children may have been diagnosed with a learning disability, such as Attention Deficit Disorder (ADD), Attention Deficit Hyper-active Disorder (ADHD), Asperger's Syndrome, Autism or Dyslexia. They may have been retained in a grade at least once. They may not be proficient in English. The presence of any of these conditions does not indicate that a child may be at risk. Rather, these conditions have simply been identified as common among children at risk.

Some of the signs or symptoms that at-risk kids exhibit are difficulty concentrating, social or emotional withdrawal, violent or anti-social behavior and trouble communicating. Kids that are at-risk because of sexual abuse may exhibit more particular behaviors. For example, young kids that have been sexually abused often lose control of bladder or engage in inappropriate touching with other classmates. However, not all at-risk kids exhibit noticeable signs or symptoms of abuse or neglect, making it difficult to identify and help those in need

The intent of this campus is to provide a safe peaceful environment where children will stay from two weeks up to three months.  They will be provided with daily time with a professional Social Worker, Psychologist and other specifically trained individuals. 

The pictures found on this site are of a property with 50 acres, three buildings, The Log House, Offices, and training center, The Dormitory and The Classroom Building.  There are plans for a new Dormitory facility to be established in 2016.  Initially there will be an anticipated attendance of 25-30 children on campus, this is planned to grow to 125 by 2016.  A 25 acre portion of the property will be sold to a developer providing additional funds to be used toward the renovation of The Dormitory and The Classroom Buildings.

This campus is a private endeavour and not based upon or receiving any public funding.  All professionals are required to have been in their field of expertise for a minimum of five years and have supporting credentials that demonstrate their ability to perform at a standard established by the managing board.

*We are seeking funding for the purchase of the property; 
*We have a relationship with three philanthropist's that have arranged for annual operational funding for the first five years for this campus;
*We are asking you to consider being a part of this crowdfunding project to provide for the initial purchase of the property.  Upon realizing the first $25,000.00 there are individuals who will match this amount immediately upon receipt.
*The timeline for this project is to raise $15,000 by May 23, 2014 and the balance of $10,000.00 by the 30th of May, 2014.
story_txt:
The test of the morality of a society is what it does for its children. 



Dietrich Bonhoeffer

PLEASE DON'T JUST VISIT WE HAVE HAD SEVERAL VISITORS TO DATE.  THESE KIDS NEED OUR HELP, THEY NEED YOUR HELP.  PLEASE HELP US HELP THEM TODAY!  THANK YOU FOR COMMITTING TO HELP FINANCIALLY  AND ALSO SPREAD THE WORD.  EVERY MOMENT THAT GOES BY MORE CHILDREN WILL BE PLACED IN MORE SITUATION THAT WILL DETERMINE THE FUTURE OF THEIR LIVES FOR THE BETTER OR THE WORSE WITH OUT YOUR HELP!THANK YOU.Our goal is to provide a private non-governmental campus for At Risk Kids.  A place where loving professionals can provide avenues of relief with the intent and hope of a life-long impact.  Having interviewed and discussed this vision to many individuals involved in this area of expertise we believe that Lothlorien Campus is the place for this to best provide for these plans. The video demonstrates the significant need that children have for a safe place where life changing experiences can happen.  Though the video is made to raise concerns found in Canada, the Board felt that it really was not area specific and demonstrated the need that we are addressing at Lothlorien Campus.  If you have a heart for Children at Risk please join us in this endeavour.  Your gift whether greater or smaller will have a important impact on Children at Risk.  Thank you for your involvement and please spread the word.  Our window is very narrow to capture this moment.  Thank you!______________________________________________________________________At-risk kids are kids that have demonstrated themselves to be "at risk" 
of  emotional, social and learning disabilities. Often, kids are 
described as "at  risk" if they have a history of emotional or physical 
abuse or neglect. If the  child's parents are substance abusers, the 
children may be assumed to be at risk. The U.S.  Census Bureau studied 
populations of children at risk and identified certain  characteristics 
of this group, such as common personal and familial conditions.	Kids
 defined to be "at-risk" are between the ages of 5 and 17. This age 
group is  school-aged. Children below this age are often too young to 
exhibit the symptoms  of neglect or abuse. Students over the age of 17 
are considered adults.At-risk children may have been diagnosed 
with a learning disability, such as  Attention Deficit Disorder (ADD), 
Attention Deficit Hyper-active Disorder  (ADHD), Asperger's Syndrome, 
Autism or Dyslexia. They may have been retained in  a grade at least 
once. They may not be proficient in English. The presence of  any of 
these conditions does not indicate that a child may be at risk. Rather, 
 these conditions have simply been identified as common among children 
at risk.Some of the signs or symptoms that at-risk kids exhibit 
are difficulty  concentrating, social or emotional withdrawal, violent 
or anti-social behavior  and trouble communicating. Kids that are 
at-risk because of sexual abuse may  exhibit more particular behaviors. 
For example, young kids that have been  sexually abused often lose 
control of bladder or engage in inappropriate  touching with other 
classmates. However, not all at-risk kids exhibit noticeable  signs or 
symptoms of abuse or neglect, making it difficult to identify and help  
those in needThe intent of this campus is to provide a safe 
peaceful environment where children will stay from two weeks up to three
 months.  They will be provided with daily time with a professional 
Social Worker, Psychologist and other specifically trained individuals.

acres, three buildings, The Log House, Offices, and training center, The
 Dormitory and The Classroom Building.  There are plans for a new 
Dormitory facility to be established in 2016.  Initially there will be 
an anticipated attendance of 25-30 children on campus, this is planned 
to grow to 125 by 2016.  A 25 acre portion of the property will be sold 
to a developer providing additional funds to be used toward the 
renovation of The Dormitory and The Classroom Buildings.This 
campus is a private endeavour and not based upon or receiving any public
 funding.  All professionals are required to have been in their field of
 expertise for a minimum of five years and have supporting credentials 
that demonstrate their ability to perform at a standard established by 
the managing board.*We are seeking funding for the purchase of the property;  *We
 have a relationship with three philanthropist's that have arranged for 
annual operational funding for the first five years for this campus;*We
 are asking you to consider being a part of this crowdfunding project to
 provide for the initial purchase of the property.  Upon realizing the 
first $25,000.00 there are individuals who will match this amount 
immediately upon receipt.*The timeline for this project is to raise $15,000 by May 23, 2014 and the balance of $10,000.00 by the 30th of May, 2014.

story:
Introduction

Omahr has been pursuing the dream of becoming a professional footballer since he was a young boy. He has overcome financial difficulties, League closure in Togo, moving back to Ghana, learning English and working factory jobs to make ends meet along the way. 

Omahr's hard work has finally paid off and now he has been courted by a UEFA camp in Austria where teams from around Europe will come to scout him. He can attend if we can come up with $1,300 for the June departure. 

Be the first to join his family, who have contributed $200 towards this great opportunity for him.

What We Need & What You Get

An offer came from Quantum Sports Leap (GH) that was extended to several Ghana Premier League and Ghana First Division footballers to attend the  camp. The invitation includes airfare, room and board during his stay in Austria. Quantum requires that each footballer pay a $1,300 fee to show that they are commited and to finance the visa processing and entry requirements for his invitation letter.

Donate now and join Omahr's team and earn an awesome photo, mug or signature t-shirt. Or step up to the plate in a big way and enjoy an inspiring dinner with Omahr in Europe or West Africa (transport not included).

In the event that we don't raise the full $1,300 we will keep fundraising towards a goal of sending Omahr to a camp in Hungary in August or September although this may miss opportunities to sign with a club by the end of the summer transfer window.

 

The Story

Omahr played at an elite level in Togo and was invited to play on the U-17 Togolese national team. When the "Togolais Championnat" closed in 2010, it was the second time in three years and Omahr was forced to move back to Ghana, his country of birth. It was difficult for him. He had to learn English and take on a side job at Blue Skies Ghana to earn some pocket money while he stayed with his sister who lived nearby. At Blue Skies, he also Mark Brown, a friend who is helping out Omahr to find his football opportunities.

Omahr started playing with second division clubs for the first year in Ghana until he was invited to first division trials and even a Vancouver Whitecaps FC (MLS) trial. Quantum Sports Leap saw Omahr's potential and took advantage of inviting him while he was in a period of free agency, and now the Austrian opportunity beckons...

The Player

Omah is a powerful finisher up front. He has great vision for how plays will unfold and a keen eye for goal. He can finish with his head or either foot, although he is right footed.

Omahr played on the provisional U-17 World Cup Squad at age 14 alongside Prince Segbefia (Auxerre, Ligue 1), Fattou Dodja (Landskrona, Sweden) and Alikem Segbefia (Al-Jaish, Syria) but he did not travel to Korea. He had a very competitive career with Jeanne d’Arc of Lome FC in the second division as a youngster, with them he travelled to Nigeria and played in a seven nation tournament. As a youth he also played with Dove Wome (Free State Stars, PSL South Africa) and Ortega Djene (Cotonsport, Cameroon) both of who reached the Africa Cup of Nations quarterfinals in February. 

 

Blue Skies

Blue Skies is a UK based "Joint Effort Enterprise" which provides European supermarkets with tropical fresh cut fruits. Blue Skies has had the mission to create jobs for Ghanaians by moving as many of the value addition steps as possible from the UK to Ghana. The job Omahr found in the Blue Skies laundry room really helped Omahr make ends meet until his opportunity came. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute financially but you are interested in Omahr's story, please share the story on facebook and twitter and tell your friends. You can also send Omahr your words of encouragement by reaching out to him on facebook. He is always happy to hear from his fans. You can find his facebook at https://www.facebook.com/mahr.ibrahim.1?fref=ts.

story:
If you’re like us, you've become frustrated with the profit engine known as the smartphone market. A category once synonymous with innovation and technological advancement has been replaced with minor yearly “upgrades,” uninspired design, and a lack of uniqueness.  Manufacturers these days are dumping money into manufacturing technology to make the phones cheaper and at higher volumes; not into developing revolutionary technology. 

We were tired of being told what the epitome of technology and innovation were by the products offered to us on the shelf, so we sought to test those limits for ourselves and ask, “What do we want in a smartphone, and can we do it?”

The answer to that question was something so unique, versatile, and beautiful, we’ve made it our mission to bring it to life.

WHAT IS PORTAL? 

The Portal is a smartphone designed for tech enthusiasts, active individuals, and on-the-go professionals who are frustrated with bulky, cluttered, non-durable phones that constantly get in the way of their dynamic lifestyles. Our goal was to create a device that combines advanced smartphone technology with the convenience and mobility of smart watches and fitness trackers- a handheld phone when you need it, a wearable device when you want it. No longer will you need to carry and connect a smartwatch, fitness tracker and smartphone all at once.  Portal offers you the best of those devices at the times you choose.


HARDWARE 

Portal can be comfortably worn on either forearm and features no ports or cord connectivity, freeing your hands and pockets to keep your life active, connected, and hassle-free.

Portal is scratch & shatter proof, water resistant, and flexible, making it an ideal companion for the most demanding activities.

• Unlocked and usable with most major carriers*

• Soft Impact restive Kevlar infused body

• Durability and flexibly allowing a stress free use

• Button-less design which also makes it water resistant

• Wearability allowing to use your phone on the go at work, exercising, or even if you just have a busy lifestyle 


SOFTWARE 

People on the move want a phone that works with them, not against them- Portal harnesses an revolutionary new customizable user interface that redefines intuitiveness, accessibility and convenience. Most importantly it's stunning beautiful to look at and live with everyday.

• Android Based OS with Portal OS Customizable User Interface

• Ambidextrous (right or left handed) User Interface

• Gesture and motion based native function commands (volume, unlock, home, back, etc.)

• Futuristic new notification and ringtone library 


SPECIFICATIONS 

*Update: The 4" display will not be available until 2015. 

**Specifications are subject to change to ensure the best available components. We will update all backers on any notable changes.

Portal 600 Sport (white)

(black)

Portal 600 Executive (Organic Tan and Stainless Steel bands included)

WHO ARE WE? 

We tech enthusiasts, inventors, and serial entrepreneurs, are passionate about finding solutions rather than waiting for so called established corporations to take care of the issues we customers face.

In the smartphone industry space, innovation is getting limited to making them thinner and lighter with little thought put into making them durable. When we look  at other smart devices such as smart-watches and fitness trackers, we notice that they struggle with limited functionality and stickiness. 

We as a team decided to take this problem head on and have created a device that combines advanced smartphone technology with the convenience and mobility of smart watches and fitness trackers- a handheld phone when you need it, a wearable device when you want it. We named it as “Portal”.

Portal is a new unique Android based smartphone that is flexible, water resistant, shatterproof, and wearable. We are lucky to have award winning team members. Adam Eastman, our lead mechanical engineer is UC Berkeley inventor and entrepreneur. Jonathan Quintin is award winning graphic designer who has led design projects for companies such as Bosch, Google, Intel and Mitsubishi Motors. Dan Daogaru, CTO and award winning HW engineer, is himself a successful serial entrepreneur and has been in the wireless space since the analog phone days. 

We have roped in a passionate team of engineers, marketing enthusiasts, and finance gurus who have a singular passion to see Portal become the most successful launch in 2015.


WHERE ARE WE? 

Started with concepts, sketches, CAD, 3D prints, etc.  Built a team, PCB design, built a few prototypes, mechanical tooling, software development, set up supplier logistics, etc.

Contributions will help in final steps to deliver: 

• Production & Assembly tooling 

• Approvals & Certifications

The campaign is to raise initial funding for approvals, certifications, completion of OS development, and support in taking Portal to market. 


RISKS AND CHALLENGES?

Building a smartphone or a tech company isn't rocket science. However, somethings which are out of our hands that play the most risk to our timeline are:

• Testing & Government Certifications

• IP Licensing Negotiations

• Fulfillment Logistics involved in distribution


FULFILLMENT TIMELINE? 

We believe 12 months is incredibly fast for a start-up at our stage. For example Motorola's design to delivery time takes twelve to eighteenth months. We can and will beat that. The campaign is to raise initial funding, which would help us in approvals, certifications, development of OS, and support in taking Portal to market. 
Nov. Final designs are completed
Dec. Volume scale tooling completed
Jan. Components inventory established
Feb. Manufacturing and distribution logistics finalized
Mar. All licensing finalized 
Apr. Final debugging and software iterations completed
May. Government certification and testing submitted
Jun. Government certification approvals completed
Jul. High volume manufacture begins
Aug. Packaging materials and design completed
Sep. Ship to backers
Please keep in mind each month we will email exclusive video up dates with behind the scenes footage to all of our backers. 


MADE IN USA

  • Designed & Assembled in USA.


FAQs 


  • What happens if the campaign does not reach its goal?

We’re extremely thankful for all our backers thus far, and will turn to individual investors to complete the funding we need to build each of your Portal phones.  We’re incredibly inspired by the fantastic feedback Portal has received thus far, and guarantee you we will not let anything stop us from bringing Portal to life.  We have been in discussions and negotiations with VC firms for a while now.  We hope that with crowd funding, we (the founding team) can keep the majority of ownership in the company and avoid the VC route. 

  • Do I have to wear it?

Well, no.  Its still a smart phone- it just bends so you can.  The cradles are included but they are optional.  You can throw it in your back pocket just like every other phone- except your phone won't be a pain in the rear (literally) and you don't have to worry about breaking it.  

  • Where are the hard specs, what's the processor, why aren't there pics of the chips, what's the display resolution, etc?

Unfortunately the mobile space is very competitive and every supplier wraps us up in more legal documents than you can imagine.  This is why some of our details are so vague.  Some of them are vague simply for competitive advantage.  You don't see the "big guys" publishing specs prior to launch either.  The "big guys" just print money so they don't need to expose any details prior to launch so we have somewhat of a disadvantage with that. 

Every component manufacturer has a product road map.  The road map shows what they are coming out with 6 months from now, a year from now, sometimes even 2 years from now.  So, we selected a processor that isn't commercially out yet,  but has engineering samples available, and will be ready before we need it to be.  The same thing applies to the display and several other components that make up Portal. 

So here's the deal- the simple answer is all of our vendors put us under non-disclosure agreements (NDA).  This is standard practice in most industries but when you get into mobile; whoa you should see how many lawyers get involved with IP licensing, NDA's, etc.  

Since Portal is still being baked, in order to tell you the processor we have selected, what this or that is, etc.; we would have to tell you what our vendors product road maps look like which is their confidential information.  The chip maker isn't going to like a picture of their prototype chip that hasn't been released yet publicly, up on IndieGoGo.  We thought about it but the lawyers got mad at us.  So our hands are tied and we have to be somewhat evasive.

Portal isn't just something we just came up with a few weeks ago.  We've actually been working on Portal for a while now.  

In fact, here's an article from late 2013: 

http://upstart.bizjournals.com/news/technology/2013/12/13/sf-hackers-phone-coming-in-2015.html?page=all

Here is what we can tell you today:

1. At production release Portal will have the latest and greatest technology commercially available. 

2. The processor and all of the chips are well known by name and vendor.  We aren't inventing chips, and we aren't crazy. The majority of the components that make up Portal will be in other smart phones you don't know about yet from the "big guys".  There aren't very many mobile chipset manufactures- lets leave it at that. 

3. Yes, we do have prototypes and we have been working on this quite a while.

4.  All of our backers will receive detailed information and updates as soon as we can release the data without having lawyers on our doorstep the next day.

5. We intend to make this phone a revolutionary device and throw the book at it for innovation and functionality.  Our motivation is the failures we see as consumers with other manufacturers products.

6.  The specs aren't 100% yet baked in.  Some things will change but for the better.  We intend to max Portal out where it makes sense. At production launch, Portal's specifications will be competitive with other devices being released in the same time frame. 

  • What OS is on Portal?

Portal runs the latest stable build of stock Android with a custom user interface to support Portal's additional features.  At production, Portal will ship with the latest stable Android build.  

  • Does Portal support Android Apps and Google Play Store?

Yes, it's still an Android smart phone and will support most apps from the Google Play Store.  We just had to create a custom user interface to support features like landscape mode.  We think you'll love the user interface- Jonathan put a ton of time into creating it. 

  • What type of testing are you doing with Portal?

We are testing Portal against MIL-810G standards.  Once we determine the failure points we will then make additional adjustments in the design to correct the issue.  We are also going to do highly-accelerated life testing (HALT) on the final pre-production prototype.  This will show where the failure points are and where we can make improvements if we need to.  Our goal is to make Portal rugged enough that you really can jump out of a plane and send a Tweet at the same time.  Although that may not be a good idea and we are completely advising against it; if you do please use the hashtag  #disruptoverload  so we can retweet!

  • How bendable is Portal?

Well, you won't be rolling it up like a dollar bill.  There are still rigid components within Portal that are strategically placed to allow Portal to flex the way it does.  Portal consists of both flex and rigid PCB material.  This is very common and not a new thing.  Its simply semi-rigid PCB technology that's been around for a long time in many products. 

The largest factor in "bendable" is really rigid component placement on the circuit board.   Every single resistor, diode, LED, etc. had to be placed with an orientation that will allow maximum flexing without breaking a solder joint.  Where the larger parts are on the PCB, like processor and memory- that's rigid.  Even with the rigid PCB the amount of flex and bend-ability that Portal provides is astounding.  

  • How do you make a phone water proof?

We have some tricks up our sleeve.  These days, there are all kinds of compounds out there developed to protect circuit boards from exposure to the elements.  There is cold potting which turns the circuit board into a hockey puck, there is conformal coating which is like putting clear nail polish on top of the circuit board.  There are hundreds of different chemicals, materials, and processes that have been used in other industries to achieve the exact same result.  We'll just say we did some tinkering and made a few discoveries- the rest is top secret for now. 

  • Does the Portal have Wifi?

Yes, it does support WiFi - 802.11 b/g/n/ac to be exact.

  • What's with the battery?

None of us are chemists so we partnered with a major well known battery manufacturer to assist us in developing a custom battery for Portal.  Its not an off the shelf battery and we are still testing battery life, charge cycles, and so on.  

  • Will the Portal work internationally?

Internationally, it will run on any carrier that supports the wireless over-the-air interface protocols listed in the specifications.  Portal is a quad-band GSM based device with HSPA, LTE, and TD-LTE.  The ability for Portal to operate on a specific carrier is based on the carriers frequencies.  

  • Does the phone come with warranty if it malfunctions?

The standard warranty of 1 year will apply to all devices sold by Arubixs regardless of if it was purchased on Indiegogo or other outlets.

  • Where do we get to choose our color? Can we order multiple arm bands?

At the end of our campaign we will email each of our backers confirming their orders (including color preferences & band quantities) before shipping out the perks.

  • Why four cameras?

We have created an ambidextrous phone.  Two cameras are on the sides to film outward on either side, while the other two are front facing cameras.

  • How does the phone measure heart rates?

The Portal utilizes the same technology already existing in many wearable tech products.  See above regarding non-disclosure. 

  • What kind of SIM card is used in Portal?

Currently we are using an embedded SIM card.  This is essentially a soldered chip on the circuit board.  This isn’t new technology- it’s used mostly in automotive and telematics applications where “rugged” matters for extended temperatures and water resistance.  An embedded SIM card is the same as every other SIM card with the only difference being that you have to call your wireless carrier to do a SIM ID swap instead of just physically swapping out a SIM card.  We did this to make sure that Portal can withstand the abuse of active users.  We intend to still investigate using a nanoSIM however it’s not likely that having a SIM door of any kind will allow Portal to still remain submersible.

  • What certifications are you doing on Portal?

We have to do several wireless certifications.  This includes FCC, PTCRB, Bluetooth AG, Wi-Fi Alliance, etc.  We also have to do wireless carrier device certifications for several wireless carriers on the globe.  We have to do a lot of certifications actually, which is why we are doing this crowd funding event.

  • How nerdy are you guys?

Well, if you want to talk about coplanar wave guides, the differences between ENIG and OSP PCB, or MIPS we can go there and somewhat enjoy it.  If you have a "in the weeds" question shoot us a message and we'll be happy to discuss.


Something else?

If you have any additional questions, please send us the question and we promise we'll respond to every message as quickly as we can!

SPECIAL THANKS 

Francisco Ramirez

Troy McBroom

Noah Eastman 

Charlotte Skinner 

Noah Popick

Christina Knoll

Kyle Wilson

Clay Bonavito @bayareaskydiving

Nick @milweb1

Random Cyclist on Sand Hill Rd.

All of our suppliers

Our family and friends

and anyone else we forgot to mention!


OTHER WAYS TO HELP 

 Can't contribute? No worries. We understand. Ways you can help:

  • Use the share tools on this page to help spread the word about our movement.
  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Expect more from our competitors and voice your opinion.  It will help drive innovation in a stale industry.

*Update: The 4" display will not be available until 2015. 
**Specifications are subject to change to ensure the best available components. We will update all backers on any notable changes.
Portal 600 Sport (white)

(black)

Portal 600 Executive (Organic Tan and Stainless Steel bands included)

WHO ARE WE? 
We tech enthusiasts, inventors, and serial entrepreneurs, are passionate about finding solutions rather than waiting for so called established corporations to take care of the issues we customers face.
In the smartphone industry space, innovation is getting limited to making them thinner and lighter with little thought put into making them durable. When we look  at other smart devices such as smart-watches and fitness trackers, we notice that they struggle with limited functionality and stickiness. 
We as a team decided to take this problem head on and have created a device that combines advanced smartphone technology with the convenience and mobility of smart watches and fitness trackers- a handheld phone when you need it, a wearable device when you want it. We named it as “Portal”.
Portal is a new unique Android based smartphone that is flexible, water resistant, shatterproof, and wearable. We are lucky to have award winning team members. Adam Eastman, our lead mechanical engineer is UC Berkeley inventor and entrepreneur. Jonathan Quintin is award winning graphic designer who has led design projects for companies such as Bosch, Google, Intel and Mitsubishi Motors. Dan Daogaru, CTO and award winning HW engineer, is himself a successful serial entrepreneur and has been in the wireless space since the analog phone days. 
We have roped in a passionate team of engineers, marketing enthusiasts, and finance gurus who have a singular passion to see Portal become the most successful launch in 2015.



WHERE ARE WE? 


Started with concepts, sketches, CAD, 3D prints, etc.  Built a team, PCB design, built a few prototypes, mechanical tooling, software development, set up supplier logistics, etc.
Contributions will help in final steps to deliver: 
•	Production & Assembly tooling 
•	Approvals & Certifications
The campaign is to raise initial funding for approvals, certifications, completion of OS development, and support in taking Portal to market. 


RISKS AND CHALLENGES?


Building a smartphone or a tech company isn't rocket science. However, somethings which are out of our hands that play the most risk to our timeline are:
• Testing & Government Certifications
• IP Licensing Negotiations
• Fulfillment Logistics involved in distribution


FULFILLMENT TIMELINE? 
We believe 12 months is incredibly fast for a start-up at our stage. For example Motorola's design to delivery time takes twelve to eighteenth months. We can and will beat that. The campaign is to raise initial funding, which would help us in approvals, certifications, development of OS, and support in taking Portal to market. 

Nov. Final designs are completed
Dec. Volume scale tooling completed
Jan. Components inventory established
Feb. Manufacturing and distribution logistics finalized
Mar. All licensing finalized 
Apr. Final debugging and software iterations completed
May. Government certification and testing submitted
Jun. Government certification approvals completed
Jul. High volume manufacture begins
Aug. Packaging materials and design completed
Sep. Ship to backers
Please keep in mind each month we will email exclusive video up dates with behind the scenes footage to all of our backers. 


MADE IN USA
Designed & Assembled in USA.



FAQs 


What happens if the campaign does not reach its goal?
We’re extremely thankful for all our backers thus far, and will turn to individual investors to complete the funding we need to build each of your Portal phones.  We’re incredibly inspired by the fantastic feedback Portal has received thus far, and guarantee you we will not let anything stop us from bringing Portal to life.  We have been in discussions and negotiations with VC firms for a while now.  We hope that with crowd funding, we (the founding team) can keep the majority of ownership in the company and avoid the VC route. 


Do I have to wear it?
Well, no.  Its still a smart phone- it just bends so you can.  The cradles are included but they are optional.  You can throw it in your back pocket just like every other phone- except your phone won't be a pain in the rear (literally) and you don't have to worry about breaking it.  


Where are the hard specs, what's the processor, why aren't there pics of the chips, what's the display resolution, etc?
Unfortunately the mobile space is very competitive and every supplier wraps us up in more legal documents than you can imagine.  This is why some of our details are so vague.  Some of them are vague simply for competitive advantage.  You don't see the "big guys" publishing specs prior to launch either.  The "big guys" just print money so they don't need to expose any details prior to launch so we have somewhat of a disadvantage with that. 
Every component manufacturer has a product road map.  The road map shows what they are coming out with 6 months from now, a year from now, sometimes even 2 years from now.  So, we selected a processor that isn't commercially out yet,  but has engineering samples available, and will be ready before we need it to be.  The same thing applies to the display and several other components that make up Portal. 
So here's the deal- the simple answer is all of our vendors put us under non-disclosure agreements (NDA).  This is standard practice in most industries but when you get into mobile; whoa you should see how many lawyers get involved with IP licensing, NDA's, etc.  
Since Portal is still being baked, in order to tell you the processor we have selected, what this or that is, etc.; we would have to tell you what our vendors product road maps look like which is their confidential information.  The chip maker isn't going to like a picture of their prototype chip that hasn't been released yet publicly, up on IndieGoGo.  We thought about it but the lawyers got mad at us.  So our hands are tied and we have to be somewhat evasive.
Portal isn't just something we just came up with a few weeks ago.  We've actually been working on Portal for a while now.  
In fact, here's an article from late 2013: 
http://upstart.bizjournals.com/news/technology/2013/12/13/sf-hackers-phone-coming-in-2015.html?page=all
Here is what we can tell you today:
1. At production release Portal will have the latest and greatest technology commercially available. 
2. The processor and all of the chips are well known by name and vendor.  We aren't inventing chips, and we aren't crazy. The majority of the components that make up Portal will be in other smart phones you don't know about yet from the "big guys".  There aren't very many mobile chipset manufactures- lets leave it at that. 
3. Yes, we do have prototypes and we have been working on this quite a while.
4.  All of our backers will receive detailed information and updates as soon as we can release the data without having lawyers on our doorstep the next day.
5. We intend to make this phone a revolutionary device and throw the book at it for innovation and functionality.  Our motivation is the failures we see as consumers with other manufacturers products.
6.  The specs aren't 100% yet baked in.  Some things will change but for the better.  We intend to max Portal out where it makes sense. At production launch, Portal's specifications will be competitive with other devices being released in the same time frame. 

What OS is on Portal?
Portal runs the latest stable build of stock Android with a custom user interface to support Portal's additional features.  At production, Portal will ship with the latest stable Android build.  

Does Portal support Android Apps and Google Play Store?
Yes, it's still an Android smart phone and will support most apps from the Google Play Store.  We just had to create a custom user interface to support features like landscape mode.  We think you'll love the user interface- Jonathan put a ton of time into creating it. 

What type of testing are you doing with Portal?
We are testing Portal against MIL-810G standards.  Once we determine the failure points we will then make additional adjustments in the design to correct the issue.  We are also going to do highly-accelerated life testing (HALT) on the final pre-production prototype.  This will show where the failure points are and where we can make improvements if we need to.  Our goal is to make Portal rugged enough that you really can jump out of a plane and send a Tweet at the same time.  Although that may not be a good idea and we are completely advising against it; if you do please use the hashtag  #disruptoverload  so we can retweet!

How bendable is Portal?
Well, you won't be rolling it up like a dollar bill.  There are still rigid components within Portal that are strategically placed to allow Portal to flex the way it does.  Portal consists of both flex and rigid PCB material.  This is very common and not a new thing.  Its simply semi-rigid PCB technology that's been around for a long time in many products. 
The largest factor in "bendable" is really rigid component placement on the circuit board.   Every single resistor, diode, LED, etc. had to be placed with an orientation that will allow maximum flexing without breaking a solder joint.  Where the larger parts are on the PCB, like processor and memory- that's rigid.  Even with the rigid PCB the amount of flex and bend-ability that Portal provides is astounding.  

How do you make a phone water proof?
We have some tricks up our sleeve.  These days, there are all kinds of compounds out there developed to protect circuit boards from exposure to the elements.  There is cold potting which turns the circuit board into a hockey puck, there is conformal coating which is like putting clear nail polish on top of the circuit board.  There are hundreds of different chemicals, materials, and processes that have been used in other industries to achieve the exact same result.  We'll just say we did some tinkering and made a few discoveries- the rest is top secret for now. 


Does the Portal have Wifi?
Yes, it does support WiFi - 802.11 b/g/n/ac to be exact.

What's with the battery?
None of us are chemists so we partnered with a major well known battery manufacturer to assist us in developing a custom battery for Portal.  Its not an off the shelf battery and we are still testing battery life, charge cycles, and so on.  
Will the Portal work internationally? 
Internationally, it will run on any carrier that supports the wireless over-the-air interface protocols listed in the specifications.  Portal is a quad-band GSM based device with HSPA, LTE, and TD-LTE.  The ability for Portal to operate on a specific carrier is based on the carriers frequencies.  
Does the phone come with warranty if it malfunctions?
The standard warranty of 1 year will apply to all devices sold by Arubixs regardless of if it was purchased on Indiegogo or other outlets.
Where do we get to choose our color? Can we order multiple arm bands?
At the end of our campaign we will email each of our backers confirming their orders (including color preferences & band quantities) before shipping out the perks.
Why four cameras?
We have created an ambidextrous phone.  Two cameras are on the sides to film outward on either side, while the other two are front facing cameras.
How does the phone measure heart rates?
The Portal utilizes the same technology already existing in many wearable tech products.  See above regarding non-disclosure. 
What kind of SIM card is used in Portal?
Currently we are using an embedded SIM card.  This is essentially a soldered chip on the circuit board.  This isn’t new technology- it’s used mostly in automotive and telematics applications where “rugged” matters for extended temperatures and water resistance.  An embedded SIM card is the same as every other SIM card with the only difference being that you have to call your wireless carrier to do a SIM ID swap instead of just physically swapping out a SIM card.  We did this to make sure that Portal can withstand the abuse of active users.  We intend to still investigate using a nanoSIM however it’s not likely that having a SIM door of any kind will allow Portal to still remain submersible.
What certifications are you doing on Portal?
We have to do several wireless certifications.  This includes FCC, PTCRB, Bluetooth AG, Wi-Fi Alliance, etc.  We also have to do wireless carrier device certifications for several wireless carriers on the globe.  We have to do a lot of certifications actually, which is why we are doing this crowd funding event.

How nerdy are you guys?
Well, if you want to talk about coplanar wave guides, the differences between ENIG and OSP PCB, or MIPS we can go there and somewhat enjoy it.  If you have a "in the weeds" question shoot us a message and we'll be happy to discuss.


Something else?
If you have any additional questions, please send us the question and we promise we'll respond to every message as quickly as we can!

SPECIAL THANKS 

Francisco Ramirez
Troy McBroom
Noah Eastman 
Charlotte Skinner 
Noah Popick
Christina Knoll
Kyle Wilson
Clay Bonavito @bayareaskydiving
Nick @milweb1
Random Cyclist on Sand Hill Rd.
All of our suppliers
Our family and friends
and anyone else we forgot to mention!



OTHER WAYS TO HELP 

  Can't contribute? No worries. We understand. Ways you can help:

Use the share tools on this page to help spread the word about our movement.
Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
Expect more from our competitors and voice your opinion.  It will help drive innovation in a stale industry.

story:
Short Summary

 Joshua is a 13 year old young man that is very determined, funny, caring, and inspirational.  At birth Joshua was not breathing and was immediately rushed into NICU. After miraculously surviving two collapsed lungs and seizures, Joshua was able to go home to his family. After multiple trips to the doctor, Joshua was diagnosed with cerebral palsy nine months later.  Cerebral palsy is a congenital disorder that can affect muscle tone, muscle movement, and motor skills. There is no cure for CP but treatments, therapy, and special equipment that can help children living with the condition to help develop skills we take for granted in everyday life. 

  Joshua's family attends a program known as the Institutes for the Achievement of Human Potential (IAHP) twice a year. After sending Joshua to therapists, Jennifer and Kyle (Joshua's parents), felt that there had to be a more beneficial way to treat their son. The IAHP program guides Jennifer and Kyle on how to treat Joshua at home providing him with the best possible therapists in his life, his parents. By understanding how to help treat their son, Jennifer and Kyle do not need to schedule appointments and take Joshua across the state to provide him treatment. IAHP costs the Bolt family around $5,000 twice a year ($10,000 overall), none of which is paid for by insurance. This is where you can help. 

What We Need & What You Get

The goal of this is to raise money for Josh Bolt's family so he can attend the IAHP program. Any donations will be greatly appreciated. 

There will also be a benefit concert on October 25th at Longwood University from 7 pm to 9:30 pm to also raise money. 

The idea for this site is for those that can't attend to still have an opportunity to donate.


      Other Ways You Can Help

      If you can't donate then help spread the word on Joshua Bolt!

story:
My grandfather passed away in December after a long battle with Alzheimer's. When I look back at all the memories we shared, I forget the last few years of Alzheimer's and remember all the amazing times we've had. They say memories can last a lifetime. I'll be running the New York City Half Marathon March 15th in honour of my nonno. Help me raise money for Alzheimer's Disease research and make memories last forever. 


Dr.Vassilios Papadopoulos, the Executive Director and Chief Scientific Officer of the Research Institute at the McGill University Health Center, is doing his own research project on developing a blood test to diagnose Alzheimer's early. The Royal Victoria Hospital Foundation would be absolutely pleased to receive your donations and lead them to this very important research for Alzheimer’s. 


If you require a tax receipt please donate directly through www.royalvic.com or contact 514-843-1543.

story:
Short Summary

We are KÖVET Ministries in Debrecen, Hungary, an interdenominational, international Christian association founded in 1995 whose goal is to fulfill the Great Commission focusing on the Roma Community. We, Lajos Kovács and Endre  Szilágyi, have been serving here in Hungary and Barna Cséki in Translyvania, Romania. 

The Roma people are in a desperately disadvantaged state in Eastern Europe. In Hungary and Romania, they are a minority, and those who are Hungarian-speakers in Transylvania are double minorities: first as Roma and second as Hungarians. The vast majority of Roma are poor and uneducated; they support their large families through migrant work in the summer and social aid in the winter. They are perceived to be primitive in their behavior and thinking, with their only concern being how to get through today, with planning for the future being a foreign thought. 

Our first priority in ministry is to present the Gospel of Jesus Christ to the Roma (or to anyone, for that matter). The Roma need the Gospel, love, humanitarian aid, dignity, acceptance, places of worship - the full package. One of the most distressing sights for us to witness is hungry families, especially during Christmas. Since most of the Roma with whom we are involved only work during the warmer months, a way for us -- and more immportantly, you -- to help during this crucial time of unemployment is to provide a large bag of groceries. 

What We Need & What You Get

We want to put together and distribute 125 bags of food for the Christmas holidays for families in our ministry. Each bag will contain necessary items for their celebration: large chicken and or pork, flour, sugar, oil, cocoa, vegetables, margarine, pasta, Hungarian Christmas sweets, etc.

For a donation of at least $20, you will receive a 5" x 7" magnetic photo of an aspect of the ministry.  Placed on your refrigerator, you will be reminded of your contribution to help a family in need and also to pray for our ministry.

For a donation of $100 or more, you will receive a full-length CD of Hungarian Roma worship music recorded by our musicians (plus the 5x7 magnetic photo).

Every cent will go towards these food packages! 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you would like to contribute, but are unable, that's not a problem.  Your prayers are sincerely requested! We believe God can use many avenues to meet he needs of His people.  Feel free to share this project with others who may be able to help financially - use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Introduction

Patent Genius

Last Monday, Tony Cuthbert woke up in his remote welsh Cottage with an idea. He opened his laptop and tapped out;Hear is an inventoin for a new chuck deavice, using an aloy with a low liuqifactoin temprature;

Inventors normally guard their ideas and try to patent them before talking about them, but Tony, who is dyslexic, doesn't care who knows about Monday's little inspiration. "Having new ideas isn't a problem for me. I come up with a moderately interesting invention every day and a really good one about once a week" He says this without arrogance and with a touch of surprise, as if talking about someone else. "It may be something to do with my dyslexia, but I seem to think differently from other people."

At the age of 65, Tony cannot remember how many bright technological ideas he's had, but he reckons it must run into many thousands, "most of which I've forgotten". Michael Laughton, professor of electrical engineering at London University,

By Tony Edwards

Photographs BY Tony Edwards. Prof. Michael Laughton spent the last 25 years scouring Britain for out-of-the-way inventors, says Cuthbert is unique. Tony is the most prolific and gifted inventor I've come across. Given the right backing, he could surpass Edison's record of a thousand patents.

So how many Cuthbert patents are there? "I've no idea," says Tony. "The documents are somewhere in my work-shop assuming the mice and squirrels haven't eaten them." At our request, he agreed to count them;for the first time. There are 72. "There should be three times that many, but I must have lost some," he says with a shrug.

The rewards for technological creativity are notoriously fickle: Dyson's vacuum cleaner has made its inventor a multimillionaire, but the designer of a simple cardboard milk carton is worth billions. If there were any justice, Tony Cuthbert would now be in that league, for his Clutchless Gearbox alone. And then there's the Cuthbert Turbine, the Cuthbert Metal Separator, the Cuth-

The word about Tony soon spread far beyond Wales to no less than the Ministry of Defence, who have sometimes called upon him for advice. "They sit me in front of 50 or 60 high-powered scientists or engineers with PhDs and degrees, and say, "Tony, we've got a problem with a bit of kit, can you help?" One day it could be what they call novel power sources another day radars, or Chieftain Tanks.

"I've always been able to offer at least a couple of solutions."

A personal note from Tony

Despite having designed some experiments that have gone on to make lots of monies and other situations were large industries / organizations have solisictered my advise / input I have received very little monies from my endeavors. From the video above and the text it might seem I am solvent. But every thing you see above has been built by me personally, even the house and workshop. The equipment seen in some of the pictures has either been disposed of I.e. Thrown out and or given to me, which I have repaired.

I have done this at my own cost on a small pension, but now I am to old to do the physical work myself and have to pay people to do things for me. Some of my experiments may be very important to helping others in the world, others that might be commercially viable were proceeds / profits can also go to develop other projects to help others. Please see my web site http://cuthbert-physics.com/ can you help by donating to a good cause.

Campain description

There are many good technical projects that are not carryed forward because of commercial restraincts. They may be a good product, but companies are reluctant to invest the reason being they will not be able to take money from them or it may distable their existing business.

As an example, take my medical resonance project, the principle has been demonstrated in an lab experiment and deemed viable but the large farmaceutical companies will not invest or invstigate because they would not be able to sell threatments on a continuous basis, therefore they will avoid this type of projects.

It is my intention to try and raise monies to enable me to independently promote some of this projects, which if sucessefull will help lots of others wether the money is made or not.

However that is not to say that making money from a business is wrong, take my hybrid turbine variations of this design can be build cheaply and it will be a cheap and unique power generator for the third world countries using steam.

From a commercial standpoint, any money generated can go thowards others projects as well as making a good return for the initial sponsors. But making money is not the first goal. Its to help others, but by helping others you help yourself.

But large companies do not operate like this and will not fund projects like mine.

To further some of the following projects it will be necessary to purchase equipment and to retain expertise and to provide funding for the patents, this is not exactly cheap.

A sample of the projects can be found on my website front page

The problems of an inventor book

I have been inventing all my life. Not only must you think of the invention, then you must build it, then you must also then try to interest others which is the main problem an inventor faces.

The basic problem is raising funds either privately or from governments which is a huge issue.

I am therefore writing a book, that may help others to understand the problems and dificulties that an inventor faces.

Working project list as an example

  1. Elevator Project (*)
  2. Public Transport systems
  3. Engine Concept Mk2 (*)
  4. New IC engine Concept Mk 3
  5. Aerospace advanced propulsion systems
  6. Subsea Ice Technology
  7. Charged Baloon Lifting System
  8. New dome construction Technique
  9. Power generation system Mk1
  10. Power Generation Mk2
  11. New Oil drilling bit concept
  12. Identifying and eradication various pathogens
  13. Small projects to generate useful income to advance science and the wellbeing of all
  14. ThinkTank or problem solving consultancy for those who need help

(* Project information with video)

Additional links

Cuthbert-physics.com

Readers Digest - Meet Britain's most prolific inventor
