story:
Me llamo Javier Colorado, soy español y llevo dando la vuelta al mundo en bicicleta desde hace 26 meses, durante los cuales he pedaleado 47.600 kilómetros por 34 países de 3 continentes www.coloradoontheroad.com. Los 6 últimos meses he pedaleado 9.000 kilómetros por 4 países, viajando sin dinero y viviendo de la ayuda. Ya he concluido el viaje por mi tercer continente y el último que me queda es África.

Ruta llevada acabo hasta la fecha:



Aunque parezca una cosa de locos, se que podré cruzar África sin apenas recursos económicos, pero hay ciertos aspectos técnicos que necesito de vuestra ayuda para hacer realidad:

  1. Después de buscar y buscar un barco que me llevara a surcar el Océano Atlántico desde Brasil hasta Sudáfrica, he tenido que desistir ya que tras 50 días hablando con infinidad de empresas, ninguna ha querido ayudar. Mi única opción es conseguir un costoso billete de avión. Con el exceso de peso y la bicicleta no bajará de los 1200€.
  2. Necesito dos neumáticos Schwalbe Marathon Mondiale (55,90€ Und) para que las ruedas aguanten todo el viaje por África, más los gastos de envío desde Holanda (35€) ya que estos neumáticos no se encuentran en Sudáfrica. Estas cubiertas son vitales ya que son de muy alta resistencia y las actuales están destrozadas.

  3. Debo cambiar la cadena, el sistema de piñones trasero y repuestos básicos (100€) (pastillas de frenos, cableado, radios, parches, aceite, cámaras…etc.)

  4. Siempre busco el calzado más cómodo para pedalear pero que también lo sea para caminar. Tengo unas botas que me siguen desde hace un año, juntos hemos escalado montañas y volcanes, cruzado desiertos, selvas, ríos, lagos y bosques por todo América, pero necesito un reemplazo que me ayude a cruzar África.

(Unas botas con muchas historias y la rueda lisa con el Kevlar verde al descubierto)

En definitiva, ponerme en África con Bucéfalo (nombre de mi bicicleta) en condiciones de aguantar 12.000 Km y yo me la cruzo de Sur a Norte! Seguiré documentando todo el viaje con fotografías, vídeos, entradas en mi blog y mi página web, para compartirlo a través de todas mis redes sociales (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, YouTube, Vimeo y Wordpress)

    Resumen de la ayuda necesaria para continuar el proyecto:

                                      


    PayPal me aplica un 3,4% de comisión en cada donación que recibo en mi proyecto. Todo el presupuesto necesario asciende a los 1526,8 € y con la comisión de PayPal en 1580,5 €.

    Si alguna persona quiere hacer una donación, pero no le agrada ser participe en las comisiones que aplica PayPal, podéis hacer una donación directamente a la cuenta bancaria del proyecto.

                                      Cuenta EVO:  ES89 0239 2007 67 3040030203

    Recompensas:

    Escribiré el nombre de todos los Crowdfunders en las ruedas nuevas con las que cruzaré África a golpe de pedal, y os enviaré vía email la fotografía que lo corrobore.

    Para donaciones de 20€ o más, habrá una foto personalizada en el país que elijáis: Sudáfrica, Namibia, Botsuana, Zimbabue, Zambia, Malawi, Tanzania, Kenia, Etiopia, Sudan del Norte o Egipto. En cuanto llegue al país que escogisteis, realizare la fotografía personalizada y os la enviaré vía email.

    Para donaciones de 50€ o más, os enviaré una carta de mi puño y letra desde el país que elijáis (Sudáfrica, Namibia, Botsuana, Zimbabue, Zambia, Malawi, Tanzania, Kenia, Etiopia, Sudan del Norte o Egipto) contando alguna aventura por África que habéis hecho posible,  junto a una foto personalizada y dedicada.

    Para donaciones de 100€ o más, os enviaré una carta de mi puño y letra desde el país que elijáis (Sudáfrica, Namibia, Botsuana, Zimbabue, Zambia, Malawi, Tanzania, Kenia, Etiopia, Sudan del Norte o Egipto) contando alguna aventura por África que habéis hecho posible,  junto a una foto personalizada, dos postales impresas de mi viaje y un pequeño recuerdo que encuentre del lugar (pulsera, collar, diadema, amuleto...).

    Para recibir las recompensa y poder agradeceros vuestro apoyo, por favor escribir directamente al correo electrónico del viaje:

                                                       coloradoworldtour@gmail.com

                                                          De todo corazón, Gracias!

story:
Mission Statement

Iboga Care's mission is to contribute to the greater availability and affordability of Tabernanthe Iboga for therapeutic use by creating a non profit organic and sustainable iboga farm in Costa Rica. Iboga Care's intent is to donate the harvest for the treatment of addictions and various other physical, mental, and spiritual imbalances. In the process we hope to encourage more people to sustainably cultivate iboga worldwide.

Why An Iboga Revolution?

If you have never heard of iboga, it is one of the most powerful medicinal, detox and spiritual exploration plants in the world. Iboga is known as the Grandfather or King of plant medicines. Tabernanthe Iboga is a small tree that grows in the jungles of Central West Africa. For thousands of years it has been used as  a sacred ceremonial sacrament in Cameroon, Gabon, and Congo. The word iboga comes from a verb in the Tsogo language, “boghaga,” meaning “to care for or to heal”.  Practitioners of the  Bwiti religion regard this as the ultimate sacrament, the “Holy Wood.” Iboga is often referred to as the Tree of Life and the experience and its effects are very unique among other plant medicines.

1. Iboga is a revolutionary approach to addiction treatment
In the rest of the world it is famous for it's active alkaloid ibogaine, which to date, is the most powerful addiction interrupter known. It is typical that after one flood dose, the patient “awakens” 24 hours later with complete remission from their addiction. Thomas Kingsley Brown in his study Ibogaine in the Treatment of Substance Dependence, reports that "32 of 33 IV heroin users showed no signs or only very mild symptoms of opiate withdrawal 72 hours after being treated."  It is said that iboga/ibogaine has a 60-90% success rate while traditional 12 step programs have a 8-10% success rate. The numbers from a study on traditional 30 day alcohol rehab treatment center costing an average of $30,000 reports of 299 alcoholics treated at six different centers, one year later indicated:
 
  • 82% resumed drinking
  • of the 55 that remained abstinent:
  • 54% were overtly disturbed and unstable;
  • 24% had no sense of excitement or interest in life;
  • 12% replaced addiction with AA or a new purpose and
  • 10% were independent successes  -from hrc@healthrecovery.com
Americans consume 80% of opiate painkillers produced in the world. More than 17,000 Americans die each year from accidental overdose of painkillers—more than from heroin, cocaine and all other illegal drugs combined. Calling it an epidemic, the CDC reports that women's deaths from painkillers has risen 400% in just 10 years. Tragically, every hour, a baby is born in the United States with symptoms of opiate withdrawal. Iboga/ibogaine has been used to successfully treat prescription painkiller addiction.

 Most of us have been touched in some way by these maladies. Many people have been in and out of rehab all their lives and are still suffering. Many of us have lost someone we know, a loved one or a family member, and have wondered if there was more that we could have done. Iboga/ibogaine seems to create a path out of this hopelessness. It  is far more successful than most, if not all traditional treatment options. With other psychoactive medicines, the experience is over when the psychoactive is thrown out of the system and most often people goes back to the same problems that they were trying to heal. Ibogaine is unique where it can stay in your system for months to give you further insights, communication, and prolongs your ability to remain free from addictions, sometimes for many years after just one dose. Ibogaine is not a 'magic bullet', therefore aftercare is recommended in achieving lifelong freedom from addictions.   

2. Iboga is a revolutionary treatment approach for many mental disorders
From the Shamanic View of Mental Illness by by Stephanie Marohn (featuring Malidoma Patrice Somé):

"A common thread that Dr. Somé has noticed in “mental” disorders in the West is “a very ancient ancestral energy that has been placed in stasis, that finally is coming out in the person.”...thus, mental disorders are spiritual emergencies, spiritual crises, and need to be regarded as such to aid the healer in being born..."if these ancestors are not healed, their sick energy will haunt the souls and psyches of those who are responsible for helping them.”...in indigenous cultures all over the world, young people are initiated into adulthood when they reach a certain age.  The lack of such initiation in the West is part of the crisis that people are in here, says Dr. Somé.  He urges communities to bring together “the creative juices of people who have had this kind of experience, in an attempt to come up with some kind of an alternative ritual that would at least begin to put a dent in this kind of crisis.”

Iboga is used to treat PTSD, depression, anxiety, ADHD, dementia, Alzheimer’s and many numerous other mental, emotional, spiritual and physical disorders. Iboga cleans the mind of it’s unwanted and limiting negative programming, restoring you to the clarity of your pre-trauma or pre-addictive state. A complete mind, body, spirit ‘reset’ is often described. It can eliminate the initial emotional pain that may have caused you to seek painkillers, alcohol, sleeping pills, anti-depressants or other hard drugs. Your emotional body is temporarily relieved so that you can witness and process past traumas in a near-instant without getting caught up in old triggers and fears. Some say that taking journeys with other plants medicines for ten years would not be equal to one Iboga journey. "Iboga took me away from a cycle of self (and my loved ones) destruction. It gave me the chance to reset my existence as a human being."  Anonymous, TheIbogaineDossier.com.

Ibogaine has been found to increase levels of glial cell line-derived neurotrophic factor, or GDNF, which promotes the survival and replenishment of many types of neurons. A single dose of ibogaine can increase GDNF expression for weeks, depending on dosage. Ibogaine is also highly lipophilic and remains in body fat for months, gradually being released, further extending its influence on GDNF expression.

 Dr Carl Anderson and colleagues at Harvard Medical School and the Brain Imaging Center at McLean Hospital, Virginia, speculated that addiction is related to a disrupted relationship between the brain's two hemispheres, and that ibogaine may cause "bihemispheric reintegration". Ibogaine breaks the habitual cognitive-emotional patterns of drug addiction by resetting the vermis networks and restoring a more normal pre-abuse neural organization. Treatment with Ibogaine is a viable method of resetting the brain and freeing one’s dependance on trauma induced behavioral patters. Ibogaine, with it’s hemispheric reintegration, may potentially free the minds of many individuals (addicts, rape victims, violent criminals, victims of child abuse, war or natural disasters) suffering from the debilitating emotional disregulation resulting from hemispheric disharmony. Ibogaine works through multiple neurotransmitter systems to create a state of plasticity, similar to states of plasticity existing during fetal development. This critical brain state may facilitate the consolidation of traumatic memories, reversal of abnormal hemispheric functional and the dissolution of habitual motor patterns associated with addiction. -Excerpts from the study, Ibogaine Therapy and the Fractal Nature of Fetal REM Sleep and Interhemispheric Reintegration, nature.com

"I’m a 47 year old male. Up until about 8 months ago I was wishing to die and having daily bouts with suicidal thoughts. Since my mid 20s I’ve been trying to fix this internal memory that’s been trying to take control of my life...when I read that it reboots both the body and the mind to pre-trauma state, I said to myself, out loud, “Oh my God, this will fix me.” My life time battle with an internal childhood molestation memory was cured with a single Ibogaine treatment." -Dave Costarella, dcandco.net/ibo.htm

3. Iboga is a revolutionary approach to spiritual exploration
Iboga is not a drug nor entertainment. It is deeply spiritual and healing. Being a root medicine, iboga works directly at the roots of our center to heal a myriad of physical and mental traumas, addictions and is perhaps an unparalleled means to do so.

 "When solving problems, dig at the roots instead of just hacking at the leaves."
-Anthony J. D'Angelo

Iboga is about going inward and deeper, accessing the infinite nature of the soul. The sheer volume of information received during an iboga experience is unrivaled and part of what makes iboga an incredibly powerful spiritual tool. Iboga seems to ‘eliminate’ what is hindering a person’s ability to experience freedom or free will. It can awaken one to their true spiritual nature. "Ibogaine was a mental process for me, a form of spiritual purification and a truth serum in which I had to experience its results through time." -Anonymous from TheIbogaineDossier.com

Iboga as been reported to decalcify the pineal gland and is a third eye activator. Iboga teaches through direct, logical information and holographic visions. There is no translation issue as sometimes experienced with other plant medicines. People have called Iboga your ‘stern father’ and exposes your subconsciousness to truth. For most it offers a period of amazing clarity lasting 3-4 months and has been reported to remain present 8 years or more after one session.

Iboga is used as a right of passage and awakens one to their true spiritual nature. Many people report having a ‘life review’ from your own database of memories and can ask any questions and receive answers from a telepathic voice of truth. The Iboga visions can last 15-24+ hours. “My experience with iboga gave me what I was trying to achieve in 20 years of meditation, mental clarity and profound instant insights.” Anonymous from an IbogaCare fan. While iboga has varied physical and mental benefits, its bases as a medicine has always been about spiritual exploration. People's experiences are very diverse and if you would like to know more, there are many testimonials online.

4. Iboga is a revolutionary approach to detoxification and disease treatment
Iboga is also considered an extremely powerful detox tool. It reportedly raises the body’s frequency and removes pesticides, mercury and aluminum from the muscles and blood, and kills off parasites, candida, viruses and other low-vibration microorganisms (It is well documented that physical parasites and fungus have mind control abilities). Ibogaine has been proven to put Hepatitis C into remission. Another powerful detox benefit of Iboga it contains an alkaloid that been shown to significantly reduce viral loads in the body including HIV. Please refer to the above info graphic for more information.

Why Iboga Care?

A typical treatment costs an average of $5000, while considerably less than the cost of rehab, is still out of reach for many people suffering, and access can be difficult and expensive due to traveling outside of the countries where it is illegal for treatment. Currently iboga is becoming more and more scarce in the wild and the demand is increasing. The iboga tree in the wild is under intense ecological pressure. Estimates say that wild Iboga is disappearing at an alarming rate. We need more of these amazing small trees all over the planet, so that all who desperately need access may one day find a way to be treated, while not further negatively impacting Africa's ecology.

For some people with addictions and other health disorders, iboga is a miracle. To ensure greater access and affordability we need to take action now. The iboga tree takes about 5 years to mature, with the most desirable root bark being 10 or more years old.  Some plantations have been created, but demand is far greater than supply and availability. That means it is incredibly important to sustainably propagate more trees right now. We see a future where iboga trees are plentiful and people have more affordable and effective treatment options, whereas previously there was only hopelessness.

Iboga Care is asking you to help us create a sustainable and organic iboga farm in Costa Rica. Costa Rica is an ideal location because Iboga grows best in tropical environments.  If we are successful in this cultivation, in 4-6 years the rootbark would be sustainably harvested. The intent of this project is about giving, not profitability. It is our goal to donate 100% of the root bark to those who need it but otherwise cannot afford it. This means that we would work with qualified providers who can professionally administer it at a reduced cost, or for free, to lower income patients.  We do not intend to open our own treatment facility. These funds will also go to exploring the possibility of Iboga Care as a non profit. Iboga Care will be giving 5% of the funds, after fees and expenses, raised during our indiegogo campaign to Gabon to help them in their efforts to create sustainable iboga plantations in their country. 

Iboga Care's idea of giving was born 20 years ago, in the spirit and heart of the ancient gift giving practices Bart learned while living with the Hopi.

"Bart wanted to spend three months on the Hopi reservation to film the dying language of the Hopi tribe, and he needed $4000 in 16mm film stock to make this dream a reality. I decided then and there to start a grant program in honor of my father, Roy W. Dean, film philanthropist extraordinaire! I gave Bart the film, and the Roy W. Dean film grants were born. In the true spirit of “Pay it Forward,” after spending two years living on the Hopi reservation, Bart completed his film HOPILAVAYI, and offered his film and all film rights to the Hopi Nation. In appreciation for the film and its message, Brooks Institute of Photography offered a full scholarship to a Hopi student. Bart’s insight, boldness, and sensitivity caught the attention of the film industry, which awarded him the coveted CINE Golden Eagle Award, and the Townsend Tenacity Award. HOPILAVAYI was shown at the Directors Guild of America and was in national and international film festivals." Carole Dean, From The Heart Productions.

Lets work together to help create freedom from addiction and spiritual illnesses through the care, giving, and profound healing that iboga offers humanity. Help Iboga Care spread the word for this incredible opportunity to sustainably grow iboga and encourage interested people all over the world to join in as growers.  The gifts you give to Iboga Care, will allow us to freely give the iboga root bark and its life changing gifts to people in need. Join us in making this beautiful dream a reality! Help us to start this iboga farm right now and encourage others to do the same all over the globe. Bring hope and options to those suffering from PTSD, addiction, and so many more mental, emotional, spiritual and physical disorders. Check out our great perks from our wonderful and generous partners.  Know that any gift you can give to Iboga Care's campaign is deeply appreciated and will continue to generate more gifts in return. Please visit our facebook page and IbogaCare.com to learn more about our iboga projects.

There are a small handful of countries in the world where iboga and ibogaine treatments are illegal. Unfortunately, the United States is one of them. Luckily, there are excellent treatment facilities in Canada, Mexico and Costa Rica, as well as many other countries.

Meet the Team

Bart Hawkins of IbogaCare.com has been a filmmaker for over 20 years, with a focus on anthropological issues. He cares deeply about native cultures and their environment. Bart has gained much experience in producing large budget projects from conception to completion. He holds degrees in zoology and art, and a degree in film production from Brooks Institute of Photography. Some of his clients include CNN, Turner Broadcasting, ABC News, Coca-Cola, HGTV, and The Weather Channel. Early in his career, Bart lived with the Hopis in Arizona for 2 years, while he made two films. Then he traveled the world for seven years and had several private talks with the Dalai Lama. Later, in the late 90's he worked with an ex-CIA-lead consciousness research project called the Genesis Affect Project. It is based on nonlinear and non-rational experiences that exist prior to any consciousness or awareness. Collaborated with the Santa Fe Institute and the PEAR group at Princeton University. Bart also has custom home building skills, worked on eco designed sustainable communities and have learned ancient heart heat shamanic skills, use of herbs, and techniques for sacred planting, growing and harvesting. He is an avid hiker, nature enthusiast, healer, organic gardener, and has permaculture and aquaponics knowledge.

Cassandra Linnea grew up in Hawaii and has a familiarity with tropical agriculture. She is a Health Coach, artist and herbal medicine enthusiast. She has been in the holistic health sciences for over a decade. She has worked with some of the leading companies in the supplementation and fitness fields. Her motivation for partnering with Iboga Care stems from witnessing first hand the devastation and death brought on by addiction in her clients, friends and family member. In her experience no herbal or holistic treatment has shown the efficacy as iboga and ibogaine.

Eric Taub of ibeginagain.org is the founder and pioneer of the Ibogaine Movement in America, has worked since the early 1990′s to bring Ibogaine to the world.  He has developed over the years the safest and most beneficial way of administering an Ibogaine treatment. This culminated in the creation of his medically supervised model and the establishment of the first I Begin Again Treatment Center.  Since then he has been active in North and Central America lending his knowledge to other Ibogaine administrators and starting up Ibogaine treatment centers for drug dependency, withdrawal alleviation, and psycho-therapeutic benefit. Eric has long been a proponent of growing sustainable iboga trees and is pleased to support Iboga Care in it's mission.

Darin McBratney of costaricayogaspa.com has earned international recognition for his beautiful development of the Costa Rica Yoga Spa which is nestled on a 50-acre jungle ranch only minutes from the beach. He here you can unite yoga with iboga. Darin is also a Costa Rica real estate agent and know a lot about growing iboga and the required location. Darin will help us find the ideal land to create the iboga plantation.

Joe Stauffacher  I'm passionate about people demanding businesses supply ethical, ecological, and empathetic global solutions. I love to attach myself to projects and people that are making things better for humanity and mother earth. Deception has led me to become a NLP practitioner, a marketing consultant, and a student of business and life both reality and imagined. I'm a scientist experimenting with my own life both thoughts and actions. I'm a byproduct of my experiences. Life has taught me to LOVE!


What We Need

Here is a breakdown of our funding needs:
  • Land aquisition, 10-15 acres
  • Land improvements; grading, soil samples and soil conditioning/improvement 
  • Fencing, security, general structural improvements, drilling for a irrigation well
  • Hoop house or green house construction and supplies
  • Purchase sustainable Iboga cuttings.
  • Ongoing plantation maintenance for the first year
  • On call iboga arborist

Projected Timeline

By the end of 2014 we plan to travel to Costa Rica, investigate for a non profit status and find appropriate land. Our intent is to create a sustainable iboga farm that becomes self sufficient through donations, gifts and volunteers, thereby creating the opportunity for Iboga Care to donate 100% of the yield. The purchase of the land is not intended to be used for personal uses or personal residency, rather as a working farm. A qualified specialists will over see the daily operations, training and supervising the volunteers. The first few years is the most sensitive time for young iboga trees, needing careful monitoring. Sustainably sourced cuttings will be acquired  from Asian and Latin American sources. In 4-6 years they will be producing the root bark needed for treatments. At this point our partner treatment providers would aid us in creating the best strategy for creating programs for low or no cost treatments.

Our first step with the funds is to pursue a non profit status, then if we reach our goal to acquire land and do necessary land improvements. We will create a second funding campaign until goals are met.   

    The Perks, What You Get

    An iboga/ibogaine journey may become the greatest decision you will make in your life. It is a deeply powerful life changing event that can last a lifetime.  You are creating a living legacy to one of the most powerful and sacred addiction medicine in the world. Your are contributing to an exciting global iboga sustainability movement and this will help many others to experience this gift called iboga. This is truly an amazing opportunity.

    A 5 day 4 night Iboga Spiritual Healing at Costa Rica Yoga Spa Retreat

    Costa Rica Yoga Spa
    Experience the only iboga yoga treatment in the world. Spend 5 days/4 nights nestled between two majestic rivers overlooking the jungle and out into the blue pacific ocean from the beautiful ceremonial ranchito. Our medically supervised retreats include kiniesiology, accupunture, chakra balancing, massage, breathwork and plenty of activities. The food and support crew here will have you amazed. This is your home away from home!

    It includes:

    ·  All natural organic meals
    ·  Iboga treatments
    ·      1 custom massage
    ·      Endless free surf lessons
    ·      Guided tours
    ·      Relaxation techniques
    ·      Breathwork
    ·      Meditation
    ·      Nutritional planning
    ·      Recovery planning
    ·      Iboga teachings
    ·      Daily Iboga yoga
    ·      Pre and post cleansing and purification
    ·      Consultation with our Kinesiologist
    ·      A Beautiful comfortable room and bed
    ·      A Stunning view of the jungle below
    ·  One night out to dinner at the notorious "La Luna" restaurant.

    A 6 day stay with an Ibogaine treatment at I begin Again, Costa Rica

     

                      Lex Kogan & Dr. Vargas

    The ‘I Begin Again’ organization is the world’s first Ibogaine Treatment Center to offer psychotherapeutic Ibogaine treatment and opiate detox therapy sessions to the public. We are the original treatment facility to incorporate medically supervised ibogaine therapy within a holistically balanced medical setting in Costa Rica, Thailand and Czech Republic. Eric Taub has successfully treated thousands of people with ibogaine for over 30 years. He trained Lex Kogan twelve years ago, and who has conducted close to 900 treatments.  You will find our treatment center nestled among rolling hills in a small peaceful Costa Rica town just far enough way from the busy city of San Jose. Our facilities provide comfortable bedrooms with large king size beds, two available relaxing pools and lush vegetation providing a very tranquil setting. The treatment includes a 6 day stay, transportation to and from the airport, food, and many other amenities.

    A phone consultation with Eric Taub

    Eric Taub, founder and pioneer of the Ibogaine Movement in America, has worked since the early 1990′s to bring Ibogaine to the world.  Through out his long history with this novel therapy for drug addiction interruption and detoxification, he has developed over the years the safest and most beneficial way of administering an Ibogaine treatment.  This culminated in the creation of his medically supervised model and the establishment of the first I Begin Again Treatment Center.  Since then he has been active in North and Central America lending his knowledge to other Ibogaine administrators and starting up Ibogaine treatment centers for drug dependency, withdrawal alleviation, and psycho-therapeutic benefit. He is making himself available for a private 1 hour (can be broken into 2  parts if desired) conversation/consultation/interview to our donors on the subjects of iboga, ibogaine, his trip to Africa, spirituality and related matters. A wonderful opportunity for those of you who want a greater understanding of iboga from one of the worlds foremost experts. With his gentle manner and easy humour a conversation with Eric is always a delight.

    Health Consultation with Cassandra Linnea

    Cassandra has been in the holistic sciences for over a decade. She has worked with some of the leaders in the supplementation and fitness fields as she developed a great ability to work well under pressure and with a multitude of health concerns. Certified Herbal and Nutritional Supplement Specialist, Reiki Practitioner, Personal Training Certification. She is known as having a reassuring presence with keen problem solving abilities, quickly getting to the root of issues. 

    Lightning Medicine and Protection Anointing Oil 

    This very rare anointing oil has been charged by high level shamans undergoing powerful spiritual journeys. Contains a crystalline base of powdered lightning, where lightning strikes the jungle floor and creates a rare glassy substance which sparkles in the oil. The Bwiti use this substance as a mirror to deflect any negative thoughts, spells, or programming. The oil also contains rare oils of Palo Santo, Sandalwood, Spruce, Fir, Cedar, White Sage, and Saffron to help unlock your higher potential being. 

    Ibogaine Molecule Silver Pendant 

    Hand made ibogaine molecule pendant on a adjustable waxed cotton string.

    Casted in 935 Argentium silver. 4 cm long

    Ibiida Lahaa Visionary DVD

    A spectacular journey into trance is based on an ancient idea that images can alter consciousness and have a therapeutic effect on the psyche. The beautiful time-lapse cinematography and music by Craig Padilla perfectly blends a mind-altering, atmospheric musical score that uses Native American sacred locations for its imagery healing properties.

    Iboga Care Ultra Cotton T-Shirt

    Limited edition, high quality 100% ultra cotton shirt. Sizes: M or L. Color: Tan. Other sizes are available upon request. 

    Ibogaine Molecule T-Shirt

    Ibogaine Molecule Shirt - Blacklight reactive - Glow-in-the-Dark - High intensity reflective material. Each shirt is 100% organic cotton, handmade and I place each layer by hand and make each shirt one at a time. Size: S,M,L, XL, and XXL. They are made using Heat Transfer Vinyl as it produces the highest quality glow/blacklight reactivity, and reflectivity possible. By Shamanic Harmonics.

    Costa Rica Dolphin Energy Solid Sterling Silver Earrings


    Handmade in Taxco Mexico each piece is signed. 1.5".


    "Iboga Fruit Power" and "Little Iboga Tree" Art Prints, Signed by Artist Cassandra

    Limited edition artist signed archival quality photo print depicting the rays of hope and healing of the iboga plant. 12" x 12".

    Limited edition artist signed archival quality photo print inspired by the beauty of the small iboga tree. 12" x 12".

    Risks & Challenges

    As in any plant cultivation, we are aware of the risks of Mother Nature, pests, rodents and unseen natural disasters. We also know the risks involved in the difficulties of growing iboga and crops could potentially fail. We are taking many steps to eliminate as many risks as possible. We understand the risks involving being in a foreign country. We have researched and found that Costa Rica is the most politically and financially stable country south of the border and north of South America. It is also very American friendly, as many Americans live and vacation there. 

    It takes about 5 years for an iboga tree  to mature. The older the tree, the more powerful the medicine it produces. This is a long term labor of love for all involved and Iboga Care is passionate to bring more iboga medicine to those people who desire it's extraordinary healing properties. We want to give back what Iboga has given so many people, life saving freedom! Thank you for your time to read this, your contributions and sharing in our dream to propagate this extraordinary Tree of Life.    

    Other Ways You Can Help

    The most important thing you can do for Iboga's survival, is to educate yourself about iboga and spread the word to as many people as you can.  Use your email, Facebook, all social media outlets, talk to loved ones and friends.  Anyone who is addicted and needing help, suffering from depression, traumas, taking pain meds and anti depressants and all who wish to be freed from certain psychological patterns. Those that are suffering and stuck in life and anyone who dreams of being reborn into freedom.

    Please, if you cannot give to this project, use the Indiegogo share tools and help promote this 'gift' to humanity!

    Thank you...

Ibogaine, with it’s hemispheric reintegration, may potentially free the minds of many individuals (addicts, rape victims, violent criminals, victims of child abuse, war or natural disasters) suffering from the debilitating emotional disregulation resulting from hemispheric disharmony. Ibogaine works through multiple neurotransmitter systems to create a state of plasticity, similar to states of plasticity existing during fetal development. This critical brain state may facilitate the consolidation of traumatic memories, reversal of abnormal hemispheric functional and the dissolution of habitual motor patterns associated with addiction. -Excerpts from the study, Ibogaine Therapy and the Fractal Nature of Fetal REM Sleep and Interhemispheric Reintegration, nature.com"I’m a 47 year old male. Up until about 8 months ago I was wishing to die and having daily bouts with suicidal thoughts. Since my mid 20s I’ve been trying to fix this internal memory that’s been trying to take control of my life...when I read that it reboots both the body and the mind to pre-trauma state, I said to myself, out loud, “Oh my God, this will fix me.” My life time battle with an internal childhood molestation memory was cured with a single Ibogaine treatment." -Dave Costarella, dcandco.net/ibo.htm3. Iboga is a revolutionary approach to spiritual exploration Iboga is not a drug nor entertainment. It is deeply spiritual and healing.  Being a root medicine, iboga works directly at the roots of our center 
to heal a myriad of physical and mental traumas, addictions and is 
perhaps an unparalleled means to do so. "When solving problems, dig at the roots instead of just hacking at the leaves."-Anthony J. D'Angelo Iboga is about going inward and deeper, accessing the infinite nature of the soul. The sheer volume of information received during an iboga experience is unrivaled and part of what makes iboga an incredibly powerful spiritual tool. Iboga seems to ‘eliminate’ what is hindering a person’s ability to experience freedom or free will. It can awaken one to their true spiritual nature. "Ibogaine was a mental process for me, a form of spiritual purification and a truth serum in which I had to experience its results through time." -Anonymous from TheIbogaineDossier.comIboga as been reported to decalcify the pineal gland and is a third eye activator. Iboga teaches through direct, logical information and holographic visions. There is no translation issue as sometimes experienced with other plant medicines. People have called Iboga your ‘stern father’ and exposes your subconsciousness to truth. For most it offers a period of amazing clarity lasting 3-4 months and has been reported to remain present 8 years or more after one session. 
Iboga is used as a right of passage and awakens one to their true spiritual nature. Many people report having a ‘life review’ from your own database of memories and can ask any questions and receive answers from a telepathic voice of truth. The Iboga visions can last 15-24+ hours. “My experience with iboga gave me what I was trying to achieve in 20 years of meditation, mental clarity and profound instant insights.” Anonymous from an IbogaCare fan. While iboga has varied physical and mental benefits, its bases as a medicine has always been about spiritual exploration. People's experiences are very diverse and if you would like to know more, there are many testimonials online. 
4. Iboga is a revolutionary approach to detoxification and disease treatmentIboga is also considered an extremely powerful detox tool. It reportedly raises the body’s frequency and removes pesticides, mercury and aluminum from the muscles and blood, and kills off parasites, candida, viruses and other low-vibration microorganisms (It is well documented that physical parasites and fungus have mind control abilities). Ibogaine has been proven to put Hepatitis C into remission. Another powerful detox benefit of Iboga it contains an alkaloid that been shown to significantly reduce viral loads in the body including HIV. Please refer to the above info graphic for more information. 
Why Iboga Care?


A typical treatment costs an average of $5000, while considerably less than the cost of rehab, is still out of reach for many people suffering, and access can be difficult and expensive due to 
traveling outside of the countries where it is illegal for treatment. 
Currently iboga is becoming more and more scarce in the wild and the demand 
is increasing. The iboga tree in the wild is under intense ecological 
pressure. Estimates say 
that wild Iboga is disappearing at an alarming rate. We need more of these amazing small trees all over the
 planet, so that 
all who desperately need access may one day find a way to be treated, while not further negatively impacting Africa's ecology. 
For some people
 with addictions and other health disorders, iboga is a miracle. To ensure greater access and affordability we need to take
 action now. The iboga 
tree takes about 5 years to mature, with the most desirable root bark 
being 10 or more years old.  Some plantations have been created, but demand is far greater than supply and availability. That means it is incredibly important to 
sustainably propagate more trees right now. We see a future where iboga trees are 
plentiful and people have more affordable and effective treatment 
options, whereas previously there was only hopelessness.Iboga Care is asking you to help us create a sustainable and organic iboga farm in Costa Rica. Costa Rica is an ideal location because Iboga grows best in tropical environments.  If we are successful in this cultivation, in 4-6 years the rootbark would be sustainably harvested. The intent of this project is about giving, not profitability. It is our goal to donate 100% of the root bark to those who need it but otherwise cannot afford it. This means that we would work with qualified providers who can professionally administer it at a reduced cost, or for free, to lower income patients.  We do not intend to open our own treatment facility. These funds will also go to exploring the possibility of Iboga Care as a non profit. Iboga Care will be giving 5% of the funds, after fees and expenses, raised during our indiegogo 
campaign to Gabon to help them in their efforts to create sustainable 
iboga plantations in their country.  Iboga Care's idea of giving was born 20 years ago, in the spirit and heart of the ancient gift giving practices Bart learned while living with the Hopi. 
"Bart wanted to spend three months on the Hopi reservation to film the 
dying language of the Hopi tribe, and he needed $4000 in 16mm film stock
 to make this dream a reality. I decided then and there to start a grant
 program in honor of my father, Roy W. Dean, film philanthropist 
extraordinaire! I gave Bart the film, and the Roy W. Dean film grants 
were born. In the true spirit of “Pay 
it Forward,” after spending two years living on the Hopi reservation, 
Bart completed his film HOPILAVAYI, and offered his film and all film rights to the 
Hopi Nation. In appreciation for the film and its message, Brooks 
Institute of Photography offered a full scholarship to a Hopi student. 
Bart’s insight, boldness, and sensitivity caught the attention of the 
film industry, which awarded him the coveted CINE Golden Eagle Award, 
and the Townsend Tenacity Award. HOPILAVAYI was shown at the Directors Guild of America and was in national and 
international film festivals." Carole Dean, From The Heart Productions. 
Lets work together to help create freedom from addiction and spiritual 
illnesses through the care, 
giving, and profound healing that iboga offers humanity. Help Iboga Care
 spread the
 word for this incredible opportunity to sustainably grow iboga and 
encourage interested people all over the world to join in as growers. 
The gifts you give to Iboga Care, will allow us to freely give the iboga
 root bark and its life changing gifts to people in need. Join us in 
making this beautiful dream a reality! Help us to start this iboga farm 
right now and encourage others to do the same all over the globe. Bring 
hope and options to those suffering from PTSD, addiction, and so many 
more mental, emotional, spiritual and physical disorders. Check out our 
great perks from our wonderful and generous partners.  Know that any 
gift you can give to Iboga Care's campaign is deeply appreciated and 
will continue to generate more gifts in return. Please visit our facebook page and IbogaCare.com to learn more about our iboga projects. 
There are a small handful of countries in the world where iboga and ibogaine 
treatments are illegal. Unfortunately, the United States is one of them.
 Luckily, there are excellent treatment facilities in Canada, Mexico and
 Costa Rica, as well as many other countries. 


Meet the Team


Bart Hawkins of IbogaCare.com has been a filmmaker for over 20 years, with a focus on anthropological issues. He cares deeply about native cultures and their environment. Bart has gained much experience in producing large budget projects from conception to completion.  He holds
degrees in zoology and art, and a degree in film production from Brooks Institute of Photography. Some of his clients
include CNN, Turner Broadcasting, ABC News, Coca-Cola, HGTV, and The Weather Channel. Early in his career, Bart lived with the Hopis in Arizona for 2 years, while he made two films. Then he traveled the world for seven years and had several private talks with the Dalai Lama. Later, in the late 90's he worked with an ex-CIA-lead consciousness research project called the Genesis Affect Project. It is based on nonlinear and non-rational experiences that exist prior to any consciousness or awareness. Collaborated with the Santa Fe Institute and the PEAR group at Princeton University. Bart also has custom home building skills, worked on eco designed sustainable communities and have learned ancient heart heat shamanic skills, use of herbs, and techniques for sacred planting, growing and harvesting. 

He is an avid
hiker, nature enthusiast, healer, organic gardener, and has permaculture and aquaponics knowledge. Cassandra Linnea grew up in Hawaii and has a familiarity with tropical agriculture. She is a Health Coach, artist and herbal medicine enthusiast. She has been in the holistic health sciences for over a decade. She has worked with some
of the leading companies in the supplementation and fitness fields. Her motivation for partnering with Iboga Care stems from witnessing first hand the devastation and death brought on by addiction in her clients, friends and family member. In her experience no herbal or holistic treatment has shown the efficacy as iboga and ibogaine.Eric Taub of ibeginagain.org is the founder and pioneer of the Ibogaine Movement in America, has 
worked since the early 1990′s to bring Ibogaine to the world.  He has developed over the years the 
safest and most beneficial way of administering an Ibogaine treatment. 
This culminated in the creation of his medically supervised model and 
the establishment of the first I Begin Again Treatment Center.  Since 
then he has been active in North and Central America lending his 
knowledge to other Ibogaine administrators and starting up Ibogaine 
treatment centers for drug dependency, withdrawal alleviation, and 
psycho-therapeutic benefit. Eric has long been a proponent of growing 
sustainable iboga trees and is pleased to support Iboga Care in it's 
mission.
Darin McBratney of costaricayogaspa.com has earned international recognition for his beautiful development of the Costa Rica Yoga Spa which is nestled on a 50-acre jungle ranch only minutes from the beach. He here you can unite yoga with iboga. Darin is also a Costa Rica real estate agent and know a lot about growing iboga and the required location. Darin will help us find the ideal land to create the iboga plantation.



Joe Stauffacher  I'm passionate about people demanding businesses supply ethical,
 ecological, and empathetic global solutions.  I love to attach myself 
to projects and people that are making things better for humanity and 
mother earth. Deception has led me to become a NLP practitioner, a 
marketing consultant, and a student of business and life both reality 
and imagined.  I'm a scientist experimenting with my own life both 
thoughts and actions.  I'm a byproduct of my experiences.   Life has 
taught me to LOVE!
      

  What We Need





Here is a breakdown of our funding needs:
Land aquisition, 10-15 acres 

Land improvements; grading, soil samples and soil conditioning/improvement  

Fencing, security, general structural improvements, drilling for a irrigation well 

Hoop house or green house construction and supplies

Purchase sustainable Iboga cuttings.

Ongoing plantation maintenance for the first year

On call iboga arborist


Projected Timeline

By the end of 2014 we plan to travel to Costa Rica, investigate for a non profit status and find appropriate land. Our intent is to create a sustainable iboga farm that becomes self sufficient through donations, gifts and volunteers, thereby creating the opportunity for Iboga Care to donate 100% of the yield. The purchase of the land is not intended to be used for personal uses or personal residency, rather as a working farm. A qualified specialists will over see the daily operations, training and supervising the volunteers. The first few years is the most sensitive time for young iboga trees, needing careful monitoring. Sustainably sourced cuttings will be acquired  from Asian and Latin American sources. In 4-6 years they will be producing the root bark needed for treatments. At this point our partner treatment providers would aid us in creating the best strategy for creating programs for low or no cost treatments.
Our first step with the funds is to pursue a non profit status, then if we reach our goal to acquire land and do necessary land 
improvements. We will create a second
 funding campaign until goals are met.     

The Perks, What You Get

An iboga/ibogaine journey may become the greatest decision you will make in your life. It is a deeply powerful life changing event that can last a lifetime.  You are creating a living legacy to one of the most powerful and sacred addiction medicine in the world. Your are contributing to an exciting global iboga sustainability movement and this will help many others to experience this gift called iboga. This is truly an amazing opportunity.A 5 day 4 night Iboga Spiritual Healing at Costa Rica Yoga Spa Retreat





Costa Rica Yoga SpaExperience the only iboga yoga treatment in the world. Spend 5 days/4 nights nestled between two majestic rivers overlooking the jungle and out into the blue pacific ocean from the beautiful ceremonial ranchito. Our medically supervised retreats include kiniesiology, accupunture, chakra balancing, massage, breathwork and plenty of activities. The food and support crew here will have you amazed. This is your home away from home!It includes:


· 
All natural organic meals· 
Iboga treatments· 
1 custom massage· 
Endless free surf lessons· 
Guided tours· 
Relaxation techniques· 
Breathwork· 
Meditation· 
Nutritional planning· 
Recovery planning· 
Iboga teachings· 
Daily Iboga yoga· 
Pre and post cleansing and purification· 
Consultation with our Kinesiologist· 
A Beautiful comfortable room and bed· 
A Stunning view of the jungle below· 
One night out to dinner at the notorious "La Luna" restaurant.A 6 day stay with an Ibogaine treatment at I begin Again, Costa Rica


  




               
  Lex Kogan & Dr. Vargas
The ‘I Begin Again’ organization is the world’s first Ibogaine Treatment
 Center to offer psychotherapeutic Ibogaine treatment and opiate detox 
therapy sessions to the public. We are the original treatment facility to incorporate medically 
supervised ibogaine therapy within a holistically balanced medical 
setting in Costa Rica, Thailand and Czech Republic. Eric Taub has successfully treated thousands of people with ibogaine for over 30 years. He trained Lex Kogan twelve years ago, and who has conducted 
close to 900 treatments.  You will find our treatment center nestled among rolling hills in a 
small peaceful Costa Rica town just far enough way from the busy city of
 San Jose. Our facilities provide comfortable bedrooms with large king 
size beds, two available relaxing pools and lush vegetation providing a 
very tranquil setting. The treatment includes a 6 day stay, transportation to and from the airport, food, and many other amenities. 
A phone consultation with Eric Taub


Eric Taub, founder and pioneer of the Ibogaine Movement in America, has 
worked since the early 1990′s to bring Ibogaine to the world.  Through 
out his long history with this novel therapy for drug addiction 
interruption and detoxification, he has developed over the years the 
safest and most beneficial way of administering an Ibogaine treatment. 
 This culminated in the creation of his medically supervised model and 
the establishment of the first I Begin Again Treatment Center.  Since 
then he has been active in North and Central America lending his 
knowledge to other Ibogaine administrators and starting up Ibogaine 
treatment centers for drug dependency, withdrawal alleviation, and 
psycho-therapeutic benefit. He is making himself available for a private 1 hour (can be broken into 2  parts if desired) conversation/consultation/interview to our donors on the subjects of iboga, ibogaine, his trip to Africa, spirituality and related matters. A wonderful opportunity for those of you who want a greater understanding of iboga from one of the worlds foremost experts. With his gentle manner and easy humour a conversation with Eric is always a delight.Health Consultation with Cassandra Linnea



Cassandra has been in the holistic sciences for over a decade. She has worked with some of the leaders in the supplementation and fitness fields as she developed a great ability to work well under pressure and with a multitude of health concerns. Certified Herbal and Nutritional Supplement Specialist, Reiki Practitioner, Personal Training Certification. She is known as having a reassuring presence with keen problem solving abilities, quickly getting to the root of issues.  
Lightning Medicine and Protection Anointing Oil  





This very rare anointing oil has been charged by high level shamans undergoing powerful 
spiritual journeys. Contains a crystalline base of powdered lightning, 
where lightning strikes the jungle floor and creates a rare glassy 
substance which sparkles in the oil. The Bwiti use this substance 
as a mirror to deflect any negative thoughts, spells, or programming. 
The oil also contains rare oils of Palo Santo, Sandalwood, Spruce, Fir, Cedar, White 
Sage, and Saffron to help unlock your higher potential being. 


Ibogaine Molecule Silver Pendant 




Hand made ibogaine molecule pendant on a adjustable waxed cotton string.Casted in 935 Argentium silver. 4 cm long        


Ibiida Lahaa Visionary DVD


A spectacular journey into trance is based on an ancient idea that images can alter consciousness and have a therapeutic effect on the psyche. The beautiful time-lapse cinematography and music by Craig Padilla perfectly blends a mind-altering, atmospheric musical score that uses Native American sacred locations for its imagery healing properties. Iboga Care Ultra Cotton T-Shirt



Limited edition, high quality 100% ultra cotton shirt. Sizes: M or L. Color: Tan. Other sizes are available upon request. 
Ibogaine Molecule T-Shirt 





Ibogaine Molecule Shirt - Blacklight reactive - Glow-in-the-Dark - High intensity reflective material. Each shirt is 100% organic cotton, handmade and I place each layer by hand and make each 
shirt one at a time. Size: 
S,M,L, XL, and XXL. They are made using Heat Transfer Vinyl as it 
produces the highest quality glow/blacklight reactivity, and 
reflectivity possible. By Shamanic Harmonics.







Costa Rica Dolphin Energy Solid Sterling Silver Earrings




Handmade in Taxco Mexico each piece is signed. 1.5".


"Iboga Fruit Power" and "Little Iboga Tree" Art Prints, Signed by Artist Cassandra


Limited edition artist signed archival quality photo print depicting 
the rays of hope and healing of the iboga plant. 12" x 12".



Limited edition artist signed archival quality photo print inspired by the beauty of the small iboga tree. 12" x 12".



  Risks & Challenges





As in any plant cultivation, we are aware of the risks of Mother Nature, pests, rodents and unseen natural disasters. We also know the risks involved in the difficulties of growing iboga and crops could potentially fail. We are taking many steps to eliminate as many risks as possible. We understand the risks involving being in a foreign country. We have researched and found that Costa Rica is the most politically and financially stable country south of the border and north of South America. It is also very American friendly, as many Americans live and vacation there.  It takes about 5 years for an iboga tree  to mature. The older the tree, the more powerful the medicine it produces. This is a long term labor of love for all involved and Iboga Care is passionate to bring more iboga medicine to those people who desire it's extraordinary healing properties. We want to give back what Iboga has given so many people, life saving freedom! Thank you for your time to read this, your contributions and sharing in our dream to propagate this extraordinary Tree of Life.     
  Other Ways You Can Help




The most important thing you can do for Iboga's survival, is to educate yourself about iboga and spread the word to as many people as you can.  Use your email, Facebook, all social media outlets, talk to loved ones and friends.  Anyone who is addicted and needing help, suffering from depression, traumas, taking pain meds and anti depressants and all who wish to be freed from certain psychological patterns. Those that are suffering and stuck in life and anyone who dreams of being reborn into freedom. 



Please, if you cannot give to this project, use  the Indiegogo share tools and help promote this 'gift' to humanity! 




Thank you...

story:
Well, first off a big Thank You to Taylor for her donation.  Obviously, we had hoped for a stronger response among our family and friends.  I don't know, maybe rural Manitoba isn't ready for crowdfunding yet.  Anyway, I love my wife and we will continue to deal with her condition.  Hopefully, the weather settles into something nice and not windy soon.  Weather has a large impact on her pain levels.    

Hi,

My name is Tim and I've created this campaign in hopes of raising money to help my wife in her continuing battle with Fibromyalgia.  Our goal is to raise enough to allow Wanda to see her massage therapist on a more regular basis. And to restart her acupuncture and Chinese herbal treatments.

Wanda lives with chronic pain, pain that can leave her bedridden.  Each time she leaves our home, she has to weigh the physical cost.  One trip to the store, hours in bed hoping the pain will ease enough so she can get up and continue on with her day.  Never sure what will trigger the next severe session.  Yet, Wanda finds it within herself to help others.  Volunteering with Cancer Care Manitoba, driving cancer patients into the city for appointment and treatments.  A three hour round trip, often 5 times a week for weeks on end.  I see the physical cost she pays, but she wouldn't think of stopping.  These people become her people, her friends, she wouldn't want to let them down.  Add to that a few hours a week at the local museum, paying bills and archiving artifacts.  Fostering animals for a local shelter, a bit more of a handful when you add our shelter rescue dog Bullvie.  A Wolfhound/Terrier mix and Wanda's ever faithful protector. Before things got too bad, she volunteered at the local Humane Society, walking dogs, cuddling cats and driving to the city to pick up donated food.  

We have a great doctor, she helps Wanda as best she can.  Trying different cocktails of drugs to moderate pain.  But, Wanda has found that the most helpful things are regular visits to the massage therapist and to the acupuncturist.

Wanda's great joy in life is helping others, please help her to do what she loves.

Everyone who donates will have their name added to the wall.  It sounds impressive but it's just the wall across from the couch in our living room. (Don't tell the landlord).  We will post pictures of the wall here and on both Wanda's and my Facebook pages.  You will also receive our thanks and a promise that we both will continue to help people and animals in need.

If you would be interested in donating to Cancer Care Manitoba please visit their website at: www.cancercarefdn.mb.ca

If you would be interested in donating to the Pembina Valley Humane Society please visit their website at: www.pvhsociety.ca

story:
Quidditch. You might know it as the sport from Harry Potter. We do, too. We also happen to consider it a muggle sport in its own right.

Provo Quidditch is looking to become an official US Quidditch (USQ) team this season. The road to going "Provofficial" hasn't been easy, but we're closer than ever to achieving our dream! Once we're registered, we will be able to attend tournaments and represent Provo at the Western Regional Championship.

Part of going official means paying certain fees--both on a team and individual level--and much of this money will go towards those to help lighten the load for individual players. Any leftover funds will be reserved for travel expenses and, potentially, jerseys. The more we raise, the more we can do! So we are very grateful for any kind of a donation you can make.

For more information, you can check us out on Facebook (facebook.com/ProvoQuidditch) or Instagram (@ProvoQuidditch).

We'll see you on the pitch.

New: Get a t-shirt when you donate $30 or more! It's gonna look real snazzy.

When you donate $10 you can get one of three Provo Quidditch stickers to jazz up your laptop, water bottle, or notebook. (If you'd like a specific color, mention it with your donation!)

story: Barbrianna is a beautiful 6-year-old little girl, who was recently diagnosed with an Arnold-Chiari malformation.  This is causing 3.5 inches of her brain to protrude into her spinal canal.  It has caused her to go into cardiac arrest, seizures, and it causes her oxygen to drop to 45% when she sleeps.  She needs a maxillary appliance to expand her jaw, which will open her airways.  Unfortunately, it isn't covered by her insurance.  Any and all donations to help pay for this expensive, but lifesaving appliance would be greatly appreciated.  Thank you and God bless you!

story:
Hello,

My name is Tom Grier and I have been a Lyme patient advocate for over 20 years. Prior to being misdiagnosed with Multiple Sclerosis from 1989-1991, I was a scientist and worked in many areas of research, but by 1991 Lyme Encephalitis had taken its toll and I spent most of the next five years in bed in pain and unable to work or drive a car.

As a microbiology graduate student I took the entire first two years of medical school courses excluding clinical rotations at the U of MN Duluth Medical School. During that time in 1977 under the auspices of Dr.s Tom and Betty Hamilton I developed a fast test version of the “fluorescent-antibody-coated-bacteria” test that could help determine if bacteria that was present in a bladder infection, had originated from a kidney infection (pyelonephritis). The previous test being used took many hours to prepare and several hours of incubation, results took 24 hours. I shortened this test to less than 20 minutes by combining the infected urine and fluorescent antibody and applying it as an aerosol to the slide and then combined washing and buffering steps to a less than a few minutes.

Under Dr. Omelan Lukasevich I worked on the Mouse Model of Leukemia and worked specifically with T-cells, and developed skills working with rodents.

During these years I also worked on developing a colormetric assay to determine blood sugar in insect hemolymph and several other small projects.

My thesis work was on immunological contraception where I pursued two possible vaccines. One used the female ovum layer called the zonae-pelucida to create an immune response in female hamsters. This required delicate microsurgery techniques often used for limb reattachment. The other vaccine was simply using the beta chain of human chorionic gonadotropin HCG as a vaccine antigen.

When I transferred to the U of WA I entered into a PhD program simply called Geriatrics and worked that summer on rat bone cell densities. However the Geriatrics program was hastily moved from the college of Biochemistry into Social Sciences, and I left the program to pursue a career in the pharmaceutical industry.

During this time was when I was becoming sicker and sicker to the point where by 1991, I was on a waiting list for assisted living and unable to drive or remain upright without passing out. During that time while I was flat on my back I researched Lyme as best I could (in those early years there was almost nothing useful on the Internet that was patient oriented, and like so many other patients I was scared by what I had and what doctors did not seem to understand.)

So in 1994 I wrote a 105 page booklet for Lyme patients (for $7.95) called: “The 1995  Lyme Disease Survival Manual”  which within months of publication traveled all over the world, and I immediately received calls from desperate patients from Japan, Finland, Germany, Spain, France, Canada, and even Africa. It was clear I was not alone and that this was a worldwide dilemma. I am proud of that booklet not only because I researched it and wrote it when I was quite ill, but because all of the predictions that I made about Lyme disease have now come to pass.

Over the years since I never said no to anyone who wanted to copy the booklet or reprint it because I never wanted another human being to go through what I experienced with the feeling that there was no hope or treatment options.  

For the past 20 years I have run the Duluth MN Lyme Disease Support Group.  During that time I have accepted calls from all over the world and have tried to be accessible to all patients seeking questions day or night. I have always considered my role as helping patients better understand this disease and the microbiology that makes Lyme a persistent disease..

I wanted to help Lyme patients develop a useful and accurate scientific disease vocabulary and a cogent understanding of the science behind Lyme disease. In simple and understandable terms I wanted patients to understand testing, diagnosis and treatment. All my written articles have always been in the public domain and have circulated free to patients or doctors. Over three-dozen papers of my papers on Lyme disease have been available on web sites for two decades.

Contrary to any misbeliefs nothing I did received any funding except through the goodwill offerings at lectures and Lyme Disease Support Group. (The Duluth MN group is the longest continuing running LDSG in the World!)

During my time as a Lyme advocate I also returned to the lab several times to gain a personal insight with the Borrelia organism. But since 1999 the labs at the Medical School and the hospitals where I had lab access are now owned by HMOs and are essentially shut down to research, so my access to microscopes and equipment became very limited.

Currently I help register MS, Lyme and Dementia patients for brain autopsies. The lab we send tissue samples to then stains brain tissue and looks for spirochetes in the brain even in patients after they have had aggressive antibiotic therapy.

In 1995 I administered a antibiotic treatment study of 26 MS patients from Minnesota and found 3 of 26 seronegative MS patients, seroconverted and had Lyme antibodies. Eight of the twenty-six patients improved after 3 months. Another patient who was a treatment failure at three months, continued antibiotics for 15 months had a nearly full recovery. The Minnesota Department of Health refused to acknowledge the study despite repeated visits to their medical officers.

Although our numbers of autopsies in our current and on-going brain study are low, we have not only had positive brain samples, but we have also seen correlations on brain-MRIs that can now help us differentiate some misdiagnosed Multiple Sclerosis cases that have unquestionably turned out to be Lyme disease. We need bigger numbers and more patients to attract interest by medical institutions to do a multicenter brain pathology study.

I am sorry to say that without any financial support or a regular income over the past 20 years I have found myself financially unable to take on bigger and better Lyme disease research projects or maintain much of a normal lifestyle beyond simply surviving.

Currently I intend to get back into the laboratory and do some basic Lyme research. To do this I require some basic lab equipment. The good news is that because of Russian and Chinese competition in the last dozen years or so, the costs of microscopes have come down.  The bad news is almost all lab equipment has become more expensive than ever.

I am seeking a minimum amount of money to begin some simple yet important Lyme disease projects. What follows is a partial list of needs that come to about $5,000 .  This does not include such things as lab space costs or personal time. All of the intended use of this equipment is non-profit and for research and not for creating a business, creating an income or to provide human testing. I have no conflicts of interest to report and hope my work can be as nonbiased as possible.

Thank you,

Thomas Grier

 

Equipment Needed

A trinocular compound microscope 40-2000x with Dark Field w/case

Camera for the microscopes

Video monitor for teaching

Dissection scope for work with mice, ticks and small samples

 

Lab Equipment

Slides – Cover Slips

Petri dishes

Culture tubes

ELISA trays and sample dispenser

Pipettes

Stains and Reagents

An incubation cabinet

Centrifuge

Medical sample freezer for -70F or lower

Thermal multiplier PCR machine

Tissue dehydration trays

Chemical Hood

Paraffin

Microtome for sample slicing

A fluorescent microscope

For two decades I have been an advocate for better pathology in Lyme disease research and have developed a relationship with both Dr. Judith Miklossy Neuro-Pathologist (Switzerland) and Dr. Alan MacDonald (retired pathologist) who have given me input and guidance. I believe I can create a mentor relationship with graduate students interested in working on Lyme disease, and generate interest and skills in pathology for new and younger scientists.

Please help me in my endeavor and contribute what you can. Any amount above and beyond this equipment list will go directly 100 % to research and projects.

Thank you for your help and continue to support pathology based Lyme disease research and increase our understanding of the pathogenesis of this disease.

Sincerely,

Thomas M. Grier M.S.

Check out some of Tom's articles.

Click here to see how Tom got involved in Lyme Research:
http://sfec.cfans.umn.edu/prod/groups/cfans/@pub/@cfans/@sfec/documents/article/cfans_article_422768.pdf

Tom's Personal Lyme Story
http://www.mdjunction.com/forums/lyme-disease-support-forums/studies-research/374434-tom-griers-lyme-ms-story

Why do we call them experts, by Tom Grier
http://whatislyme.com/why-do-we-call-them-experts-by-tom-grier/

Who will be the heroes of Lyme Disease, who will be the villians? by Thomas Grier, M.S.
http://whatislyme.com/who-will-be-the-heroes-of-lyme-disease-who-will-be-the-villains/

Lyme on the Brain
http://www.mdjunction.com/lyme-disease/articles/lyme-on-the-brain-by-tom-grier-part-1-of-4-august-5-2010
story_txt:
Hello,
My name is Tom Grier and I have been a Lyme patient advocate for over 20 years. Prior to being misdiagnosed with Multiple Sclerosis from 1989-1991, I was a scientist and worked in many areas of research, but by 1991 Lyme Encephalitis had taken its toll and I spent most of the next five years in bed in pain and unable to work or drive a car.
As a microbiology graduate student I took the entire first two years of medical school courses excluding clinical rotations at the U of MN Duluth Medical School. During that time in 1977 under the auspices of Dr.s Tom and Betty Hamilton I developed a fast test version of the “fluorescent-antibody-coated-bacteria” test that could help determine if bacteria that was present in a bladder infection, had originated from a kidney infection (pyelonephritis). The previous test being used took many hours to prepare and several hours of incubation, results took 24 hours. I shortened this test to less than 20 minutes by combining the infected urine and fluorescent antibody and applying it as an aerosol to the slide and then combined washing and buffering steps to a less than a few minutes.
Under Dr. Omelan Lukasevich I worked on the Mouse Model of Leukemia and worked specifically with T-cells, and developed skills working with rodents.
During these years I also worked on developing a colormetric assay to determine blood sugar in insect hemolymph and several other small projects.
My thesis work was on immunological contraception where I pursued two possible vaccines. One used the female ovum layer called the zonae-pelucida to create an immune response in female hamsters. This required delicate microsurgery techniques often used for limb reattachment. The other vaccine was simply using the beta chain of human chorionic gonadotropin HCG as a vaccine antigen.
When I transferred to the U of WA I entered into a PhD program simply called Geriatrics and worked that summer on rat bone cell densities. However the Geriatrics program was hastily moved from the college of Biochemistry into Social Sciences, and I left the program to pursue a career in the pharmaceutical industry.
During this time was when I was becoming sicker and sicker to the point where by 1991, I was on a waiting list for assisted living and unable to drive or remain upright without passing out. During that time while I was flat on my back I researched Lyme as best I could (in those early years there was almost nothing useful on the Internet that was patient oriented, and like so many other patients I was scared by what I had and what doctors did not seem to understand.)

Contrary to any misbeliefs nothing I did received any funding except through the goodwill offerings at lectures and Lyme Disease Support Group. (The Duluth MN group is the longest continuing running LDSG in the World!)
During my time as a Lyme advocate I also returned to the lab several times to gain a personal insight with the Borrelia organism. But since 1999 the labs at the Medical School and the hospitals where I had lab access are now owned by HMOs and are essentially shut down to research, so my access to microscopes and equipment became very limited.
Currently I help register MS, Lyme and Dementia patients for brain autopsies. The lab we send tissue samples to then stains brain tissue and looks for spirochetes in the brain even in patients after they have had aggressive antibiotic therapy.
In 1995 I administered a antibiotic treatment study of 26 MS patients from Minnesota and found 3 of 26 seronegative MS patients, seroconverted and had Lyme antibodies. Eight of the twenty-six patients improved after 3 months. Another patient who was a treatment failure at three months, continued antibiotics for 15 months had a nearly full recovery. The Minnesota Department of Health refused to acknowledge the study despite repeated visits to their medical officers.

The good news is that because of Russian and Chinese competition in the last dozen years or so, the costs of microscopes have come down.  The bad news is almost all lab equipment has become more expensive than ever.

Thank you,

story:
Eighteen years ago, Duane and Lisa Crabbs moved into the Summit Lake neighborhood and established a presence as a family, as neighbors, and as pastoral friends. As the Crabbs family grew up, presence turned into programming and the youth activities of South Street Ministries were formed: after school program, bike shop, youth gardening, summer camp, open gym, football camp, girls group, and throughout it all, a continued neighborhood presence.  South Street Ministries is a tax-exempt 501(c)(3) non-profit organization that is committed to the physical, socio-economic, and spiritual well being of the South Akron/Summit Lake neighborhood.

For over 5 years South Street Ministries has been under construction! In 2010, the Front Porch building was donated to South Street Ministries. Renovation began and the Front Porch café opened in 2011, creating a hub for employment and conversation. When the Arid Club (Akron’s longest running dry-club) closed their doors, an influx of recovery groups moved to the Front Porch, creating a hub for recovery.  The Summit county Reentry Network began meeting at the Front Porch for weekly support and informational meetings. The building located a block from the Summit County Jail was enacting it’s mission as a hub for reentry.  The roof was replaced on the second floor, and a vision began to emerge of a professional office space that would facilitate trainings, classes, and conversation that spurred on community development. South Street Ministries was becoming a community development organization, starting with our own renovation process.  The Front Porch was becoming a hub for community development.  In 2014, new organizational partners approached South Street Ministries about working together. World Relief set up an Akron office for refugee resettlement and Faithful Servants began the collaborative conversation with South Street Ministries about developing a mobile health clinic in the back room of the Front Porch.  The Front Porch is a hub for organizational collaboration and community health.

South Street Ministries has completed $250,000 worth of renovations for only $125,000 actual cash.  At the end of 2014, South Street Ministries was a recipient of a fundraising campaign that brought in approximately $138,000 to further the next phases of construction, including kitchen renovations, first and second floor restrooms, and plumbing.  However, there is still a large amount of construction remaining: the second floor, the exterior stair-well, and the back-room.

story:
Our goal is to raise $10,000 in December!! We are an organization that supports treatment for adults and children that have suffered sexual and childhood trauma.
 

Take 5 minutes, donate $5 and read on for more information about our small charity:

The Centre for Treatment of Sexual Abuse and Childhood Trauma was established to provide services to people that have experienced childhood abuse and/or sexual abuse. We also provide services to clients that have experienced any kind of trauma.  We are a registered Canadian Charity and our mandate is to provide trauma-focussed, accessible psychotherapy and counselling; offer professional training and education so that therapists gain competency in working with sexual trauma; and promote public awareness in the areas of trauma and recovery

Our annual operating costs are small and funded by the generosity of donations and by funds raised by our training events. The organization is run by a volunteer Board of Directors and a team of Associate Therapists . This campaign is to raise funds to support our operations and current varied contributions.  In November, we hope to raise a total of $10,000 from various sources to support operating costs in 2015-2016. Operating costs include our monthly expenses such as phone bills, internet bills, insurance, and other regular office needs and supplies. Or in other words: 

All expenses that sustain, and to keep the office functional, so that we can continue to do the important work we do with clients.

Our organization completes approximately 200 client intakes per year. We supervise students and host conferences to provide specialized training to professionals  who work with clients having experienced childhood and/or sexual trauma.  

The Centre for Treatment of Sexual Abuse and Childhood Trauma was established in 1991 and has provided services to thousands of clients impacted by abuse and trauma since its inception. 

We hope to diversify our fundraising efforts in order to achieve our stated goals (and some other longer-term fundraising goals).  Other fundraising goals include the purchase of a long-term home for the Centre and launching a long-term planned giving model to support the cost of our low-fee and subsidized service.  Donations larger than $10 will a receipt for income tax purposes (due to rules and regulations, please do not select a perk if you would like a receipt).
Please contact us to be added to our mailing list to receive updates in the future info@centrefortreatment.com

and don't forget to

Share this campaign with your networks! 
Thank-you from the team at CTSACT!!
