If you were wondering who brought their family and absolutely turned the party upside down with NOLA style dancing, marching and singing, that was also Sherise!  Sherise is the only Saints fan I know who doesn’t annoy me - this includes you Andre - and has been an incredible influence on my life.  She has had my back for over a decade - it’s time I returned the favor.  Last but not least:  Have you been staring at your TV screen this week and wondering how you can make a difference in your community here at home?  Here's your chance. Click "contribute now."  PS: Thank you to Emmaus House for helping to create genuine and supportive community that helps to facilitate authentic relationships that cut across cultural and racial divides. If you aren’t an Emmaus House donor, I strongly encourage you to join me as an Emmaus House donor today! http://www.emmaushouseatlanta.org/donate/PPS - below is says "Help raise fund for Sherise Brown and Bryan Schroeder" - I want to be clear that no funds will go to me! That's a formatting issues since I'm acting as a financial liaison.

story:
Help Us Send a Medical Team to West Africa

As of Dec 11 2014, over 18,000 Cases of Ebola have been reported to the World Health Organization.  WHO estimates that the true number of cases may be much higher.   In Africa, 7 of 10 Ebola patients die.  Yet, in the developed world, the death rate of patients who receive early and comprehensive supportive care is near zero.


Shortage of Clinicians

Ebola has overwhelmed the resources of affected countries and caused collapse of local healthcare systems.  While the international response to Ebola has been mounting, there remains a persistent shortage of organizations willing and able to send and support trained clinicians to run new and existing medical facilities in West Africa.  International Mutual Aid is a Maryland nonprofit, founded by a group of medical professionals.  IMA's purpose is to provide the organizational structure, funding, and logistical support for our team of volunteer doctors, nurses, paramedics, and logisticians to work safely in West Africa, treating patients and helping to rebuild local healthcare systems.


Simple Supportive Care

IMA is coordinating with WHO, existing NGOs, and local partners to provide assistance where it will be most effective.  Our small, highly trained and experienced group of clinicians will train and equip a larger group of local civilians who will work with us to safely treat patients.  We will focus on achievable, outcome-changing treatments, including rehydration, electrolyte replenishment, and treatment of opportunistic infections.  

While supportive care for Ebola patients is relatively simple, the logistics of providing it safely are not.  A key part of our operational expenses will be medical equipment.  IMA's opening funding goal of $20,000 allows us to ship a 40' sea container filled with $500,000 of medical equipment and PPE, donated by Project Cure, to West Africa.  IMA is a small, flexible organization, founded in response to the Ebola epidemic.  Every dollar contributed has a direct effect on our ability to accomplish our goals.


$20,000 Pays IMA's Matching Portion of a $500,000 Equipment Grant Offered by Project Cure.

This comes in the form of a 40' sea container packed and shipped by Project Cure with the PPE and medical equipment we request, including IV fluids, IV sets, needles, mattresses, gloves, gowns, goggles, boots, and much more. 

You Can Fight Ebola: More than Money

We are witnessing the first great acutely deadly epidemic of the Age of Globalization.  The Western world has been affected by a corresponding plague of fear and misinformation.  The way we respond to this epidemic sets a precedent for future health crises, and an example for our children. 

Take action to stop not only Ebola, but the misinformation and fear surrounding it!

  • Help us get the word out about our campaign.  Tell your friends, visit our website at www.im-aid.org, and use Indiegogo share tools to share this page.
  • Watch our website and blog for updates, stories, and pictures of IMA's work.  Help to support us beyond this Indiegogo campaign!
  • Ebola Zaire has been studied for decades.  Inform yourself by seeking facts from reputable health organizations and scholarly articles.  Ask your friends if they can back up the Ebola info they are spreading with facts.  Foster well-informed opinions within your social circle.  See the links page on our website: www.im-aid.org/ebola-links-1.html
  • Healthcare workers and soldiers returning from West Africa have served on the frontlines to stop Ebola at its source, help those in need, and keep us safe at home.  If someone from your community is returning from Africa, welcome them home with respect and encourage your friends and loved ones to do the same.


Where exactly does my donation go?

Every dollar raised in our Indiegogo campaign will go directly to procuring and transporting medical supplies and equipment for use by our team in West Africa, and to the logistical support of that team.

International Mutual Aid is now a 501 (c) (3) nonprofit organization, based in Abingdon, MD.  Because IMA has been formed specifically to address the Ebola public health crisis, we have received expedited 501 (c) (3) status from the IRS (a process that usually takes 6-12 months took 3 weeks).  In order to begin shipping supplies and beginning our response as early as possible, IMA launched our fundraising campaign on Indiegogo in November, while our 501c3 application was being processed.  What does this mean to donors?

First, the International Mutual Aid, Inc. Board of Directors have voted and approved by corporate resolution that all funds raised in this Indiegogo campaign shall be transferred directly from Indiegogo via Paypal into an IMA business account with Bank of America.  These donated funds will be used in accordance with the Bylaws and Conflict of Interest Policies of the corporation to achieve our stated charitable programs. To put it simply, by state law, these funds must be used for nonprofit purposes.  Even if, for some reason, IMA was dissolved as a company, legally, any funds remaining in our accounts would have to be dispersed to another nonprofit.  Funds donated here will be used for nonprofit purposes and will not be dispensed to any individual for that individual's personal gain or misused in a any other way. 

Because crowdfunding donations are not necessarily tax-deductible, donors who wish to make a tax-deductible contribution should do so directly on our website, not on Indiegogo: www.im-aid.org. 

IMA is committed to transparency.  IMA's Corporate Resolution on use of Indiegogo Campaign funds, as well as other public corporate documentation, can be viewed on our website here: http://www.im-aid.org/transparency.html







4 November: IMA receives an official letter of support from Liberian Ambassador Jeremiah Sulunteh: http://www.im-aid.org/blog-and-photos.html  

International Mutual Aid, Inc. is a 501 (c) (3) organization
story_txt:
Help Us Send a Medical Team to West Africa
 As
of Dec 11 2014, over 18,000 Cases of Ebola have been reported to the World
Health Organization.  WHO estimates that the true number of cases may be much higher.   In Africa, 7 of 10 Ebola patients die.  Yet, in the developed world, the death rate of patients who receive early and comprehensive supportive care is near zero.


Shortage of Clinicians

Ebola has overwhelmed the resources of affected countries and caused collapse of local healthcare systems.  While the international response to Ebola has been mounting, there remains a persistent shortage of organizations willing and able to send and support trained clinicians to run new and existing medical facilities in West Africa.  International Mutual Aid is a Maryland nonprofit, founded by a group of medical professionals.  IMA's purpose is to provide the organizational structure, funding, and logistical support for our team of volunteer doctors, nurses, paramedics, and logisticians to work safely in West Africa, treating patients and helping to rebuild local healthcare systems.


  Simple Supportive Care 

IMA is coordinating with WHO, existing NGOs, and local partners to provide assistance where it will be most effective.  Our small, highly trained and experienced group of clinicians will train and equip a larger group of local civilians who will work with us to safely treat patients.  We will focus on achievable, outcome-changing treatments, including rehydration, electrolyte replenishment, and treatment of opportunistic infections.  
While supportive care for Ebola patients is relatively simple, the logistics of providing it safely are not.  A key part of our operational expenses will be medical equipment.  IMA's opening funding goal of $20,000 allows us to ship a 40' sea container filled with $500,000 of medical equipment and PPE, donated by Project Cure, to West Africa.  IMA is a small, flexible organization, founded in response to the Ebola epidemic.  Every dollar contributed has a direct effect on our ability to accomplish our goals.

and much more.

story:
What is the Elemental Yoga + Meditation Wellness Package?

The Elemental yoga videos and the accompanying meditations are wonderful for building a guided yoga & meditation home practice, as well as a great way to start your day!

The package includes (total or combinations of):

  • Elemental Yoga Videos
  • Five Elements Meditations
  • Elemental Yoga Videos (for pregnancy) 
  • Elemental Yoga Videos (Japanese Version) 

Feel totally recharged and rejuvenated after practicing these sequences and meditations, which bring harmony to the body, mind & spirit through a connection to the five elements of nature :)

These yoga sequences & meditations are great for first time or experienced yogis or meditators.

More about the Elemental Yoga Videos

We have created 11 videos in all, each video is 30-40 minutes long.

These Elemental yoga videos are suitable for absolute beginners or experienced practitioners.

They will help to improve strength and flexibility of the body and mind, and are also therapeutically designed to bring harmony to specific elemental energies. 

These specially designed sequences create balance on a physical, emotional and mental level, helping to redistribute prana or qi along the meridian pathways associated with each Element.

We hope you will enjoy practicing these sequences and you can experience for yourself the benefits of Elemental Yoga!


Elemental Yoga Pregnancy Videos

The pregnancy videos are a simpler version,  modified for mothers to be. These can be practiced even if you are not pregnant :)


Elemental Yoga Videos Japanese Version

エレメンタル・ヨガ　日本語版

The Japanese version will have a voice over by our dear friends Fumika Naito and translated by Hisana Makino.

私達の親愛なる友達が担当してくれました。

声）内藤文香　

訳）牧野久奈


エレメンタル・ヨガ　+　瞑想　ウエルネス　パッケージとは

これらのビデオは、ガイドに従って行う素晴らしいホームヨガと瞑想です。一日のスタートにお勧めです！

パッケージには、以下が含まれます。 
  • エレメンタル・ヨガ　ビデオ 
  • ファイブ・エレメンツ　メディテーション 
  • エレメンタル・ヨガ　ビデオ　（妊婦用） 
  • エレメンタル・ヨガ　ビデオ　（日本語版） 
これらのヨガ・シークエンスの練習と瞑想で、完全にリチャージし活力がみなぎるのを感じましょう。 

これらのヨガ・シークエンスと瞑想は、初心者から上級者のヨーギ、瞑想者までお勧めです。


エレメンタル・ヨガ　ビデオについて

全部で１１本のビデオを各30-40分の長さで作りました。

これらのエレメンタル・ヨガ　ビデオは、全くの初心者から上級者までご参加いただけます。

これらは、体と心をより強く、柔軟性を高めるのを助け、そして、セラピーとしても、各エレメントのエネルギーに、調和するように作りました。

特別なシークエンスを組み立てて、肉体と感情と精神のバランスを整え、経路に沿ってプラーナ（気）が巡るように作りました。

これらのシークエンスを練習を楽しんで、エレメンタル・ヨガの効果を体験して頂ければ幸いです。


What are the Five Elements Meditations about?

By following the Five Elements guided meditation and visualisation, you will connect with the wisdom of our environment through the qualities of Earth, Water, Fire, Air and Space. Observing the qualities of these elements, you can then understand your own body, mind and spirit, bringing you into harmony with your inner Nature.

Here are the qualities of the elements that you will connect with

  • Earth - Stability, Belonging & Centering
  • Water - Feeling, Potential & Balancing
  • Fire - Transformation, Radiance & Devotion 
  • Air - Inspiration, Vitality & Letting Go 
  • Space - Possibility, Freedom & Belief
  • Five Elements

They are a perfect complement to the yoga videos, and are wonderful to practice after (before or independent from) your yoga sequence.


Who are we?

Angela Chng

Angela filmed and is currently editing the videos in this project, is also the now not so secret mastermind behind this project. :D

Amber Sawyer

The yoga sequences & meditations are guided by Amber Sawyer, who spent over 15 years studying and practicing Yoga, Ayurveda & Meditation. She also has a PhD in Biomedical Engineering where she previously studied stem-cells and grew bones in petri-dishes! 

She also has a gentle soothing voice that makes these guided meditations easy to follow.

Wendy Phua

Wendy for audio mastermind behind recording & mastering the Five Elements Meditation recorded at her home studios :)  More about Wendy at www.wendyphua.com

Hisana Makino

Super fast and efficient, Hisana is responsible for the Japanese translations of the Elemental Yoga videos.

Fumika Naito

The also gentle and soothing voice over for the Japanese version of the videos.

Daniel Rojas

Boom mic operator (in our case it's actually a self made selfie stick boom mic!) and constant supporter!


Help us with this project

This project has so far been self funded, and is truly a labour of love with many hours spent filming, recording, translating and editing to create this beautiful package of videos and meditations.

We are looking for your support via the pledges to help us fund this project.

Even if we don't reach the campaign goal, we will still proceed to fulfil our commitment to your pledges, as we believe strongly in these yoga videos and guided meditations.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you also believe in the benefits of yoga or meditation, or would just like to help in other ways, please spread the word and share this campaign with your family and friends!

Wendy for audio mastermind behind recording & mastering the Five Elements Meditation recorded at her home studios :)  More about Wendy at www.wendyphua.com

story:
Zone DPMX™ is the world's first wearable power meter for cyclists. 

From your training bike to your best bike to your static trainer, your power meter comes with you.

Zone DPMX measures your power (watts) and your cadence (rpm) as you ride, and sends the values wirelessly to your standard ANT+ bike computer for display and recording.    

Everything is on your shoes, and installation is as easy as fitting new cleats. There's nothing on the bike, not even a magnet, so you have your own power meter whatever bike you choose to ride. That means you get consistent power measurement and recording every time you ride. No more frustration because your power meter is on your other bike. No more wondering whether different power meters are calibrated the same.

  • Wearable - Nothing on the bike.
  • Portable - Comes with you on any bike you ride.
  • ANT+ - Use with standard ANT+ wireless bike computers.
  • Installation - As easy as fitting new cleats.
  • Affordable - Get value every time you ride, on any bike.

We've done all the research and development, we've done all the production preparation and planning, and now it's time to manufacture the first batch and deliver to you.

There are 2 versions of the power meter.

  • Zone DPMX Single measures power on your left shoe only (upgradable to dual in the future).
  • Zone DPMX Dual measures power on both shoes.

Do you wonder why you don't seem to be getting much better even though you ride long miles each week? There's a reason. Focused training will help, and for that you need to measure power.     

  • To perform better you must increase your power output. To increase power you must measure it.
  • Power measurement is proven to allow you to get more benefit in less training time.
  • Next to competition results, power measurement is the best objective measure of riding fitness and improvement. Measures such as heart rate are not enough.
  • Power measurement is scientifically recognised as a critical part of training to be a better bike rider.
  • Most cycling coaches recommend or even require their riders to use power meters.

Under your shoe, in your Speedplay® Zero cleat, the special sensor plate measures force, and on top of your shoe the pod measures motion. The pod uses all this to calculate power (watts) and cadence (rpm).    

If you have a Zone DPMX Dual then the pods on each shoe talk to each other to calculate the total power and the left/right balance. If you have a Zone DPMX Single then the pod doubles its power calculation to get your total power. The power and cadence are transmitted via ANT+ , and are picked up by your ANT+ bike computer or smartphone for display and recording.


Every movement of each of your shoe is measured by tiny motion sensors inside the pod. It recognises when you are pedalling and when you are not. Your shoe is locked to your pedal, so measuring movement of your shoe allows the pod to calculate movement of your pedal and crank. 100 times per second the pod knows exactly what angles your crank and pedal are at, and how quickly they are rotating and rocking back and forth.    

Watch the Zone DPMX Dual in action in the video, measuring power (watts), cadence (rpm) and left/right power balance (%). Values are sent wirelessly to a standard ANT+ bike computer for display and recording. You can see power and cadence reacting to the rider's efforts, and you can see power balance change when the rider unclips one shoe. Finally, you can see what happens when the Zone DPMX Dual is reduced to a Zone DPMX Single by removing one pod.  

 Someone asked us why we worked so hard on the Zone DPMX power meter, and we thought you might be interested in a few of the reasons we put in our list of "why?":    

  • Because we can make a better power meter. 
  • Because measuring power is about the rider, not the bike.
  • Because people told us it couldn’t be done. 
  • Because we know it can be done.
  • Because we believe in doing things right, whatever it takes.
  • Because it takes hard work to create simple results.
  • Because high technology products should “just work”.
  • Because great design looks simple.

Zone DPMX is available in two different versions: Single and Dual.    

Zone DPMX Single is fitted to your left shoe only, and measures power and cadence from your left foot. The power measured is automatically multiplied by 2 to give an estimate of the total power from both your feet. It is upgradable to the full dual-sided functionality. The upgrade is not yet available, but will be at some time in the future.


Zone DPMX Dual is fitted to both shoes. It measures total power, cadence, and left/right power balance to give you full accurate power measurement.    

Your Zone DPMX Single includes:    

  • A left side sensor plate & base. 
  • One pod. 
  • Charging dock, with room for two pods. 
  • USB wall charger, with international wall plugs. 
  • Torque screwdriver for correct tightening of cleat screws. 
  • Quick Start guide. 


Your Zone DPMX Dual includes:    

  • Two sensor plates & bases (left plus right). 
  • Two pods. 
  • Charging dock, with room for two pods. 
  • USB wall charger, with international wall plugs. 
  • Torque screwdriver for correct tightening of cleat screws. 
  • Quick Start guide. 

To use the Zone DPMX Single or the Zone DPMX Dual you must have the following:    

  • Speedplay® Zero pedals and cleats.
  • Shoes that have the standard 3-hole pattern for fixing cleats (Speedplay 4-hole pattern will not work).
  • Shoes that have at least one strap (shoes with only lacing will be difficult to fit).
  • An ANT+ compatible bike computer or smartphone that can receive and understand ANT+ power and cadence.

Installation is as simple as changing your cleats. When fitting your cleats to your shoes just use the Zone DPMX sensor plate instead of the Speedplay® black plastic adapter plate, and slide the Zone DPMX base onto your front shoe strap. You're done!    

It’s a simple swap – leave out the Speedplay adapter plates and use the Zone DPMX sensor plates instead. Moving the power meter to a new pair of shoes is just as easy.

We've put a lot of time and resources into getting the Zone DPMX to a finished design and preparing it for production, but we need your help to get it over the line and deliver it.    

Almost all the production tooling and samples are completed and tested. The electronic boards, the plastic enclosures, and the software are complete, and pre-production samples have been in test for more than a year. During that time a major focus of our work was on design improvements to the force sensor plate, and now we are working on some refinements to the production tooling and processes associated with that part of the power meter.

All product development and production preparation to date is fully paid for. Your contributions will be used to fund the final tooling adjustments, final production planning, and to manufacture your Zone DPMX power meter.

You can see power and cadence reacting to the rider's efforts, and you can see power balance change when the rider unclips one shoe. Finally, you can see what happens when the Zone DPMX Dual is reduced to a Zone DPMX Single by removing one pod.  

 Someone asked us why we worked so hard on the Zone DPMX power meter, and we thought you might be interested in a few of the reasons we put in our list of "why?":    

Because we can make a better power meter. 
Because measuring power is about the rider, not the bike.
Because people told us it couldn’t be done. 
Because we know it can be done.
Because we believe in doing things right, whatever it takes.
Because it takes hard work to create simple results.
Because high technology products should “just work”.
Because great design looks simple.






Zone DPMX is available in two different versions: Single and Dual.    
Zone DPMX Single is fitted to your left shoe only, and measures power and cadence from your left foot. The power measured is automatically multiplied by 2 to give an estimate of the total power from both your feet. It is upgradable to the full dual-sided functionality. The upgrade is not yet available, but will be at some time in the future.






Zone DPMX Dual is fitted to both shoes. It measures total power, cadence, and left/right power balance to give you full accurate power measurement.    










Your Zone DPMX Single includes:    

A left side sensor plate & base. 
One pod. 
Charging dock, with room for two pods. 
USB wall charger, with international wall plugs. 
Torque screwdriver for correct tightening of cleat screws. 
Quick Start guide. 







Your Zone DPMX Dual includes:    

Two sensor plates & bases (left plus right). 
Two pods. 
Charging dock, with room for two pods. 
USB wall charger, with international wall plugs. 
Torque screwdriver for correct tightening of cleat screws. 
Quick Start guide. 











To use the Zone DPMX Single or the Zone DPMX Dual you must have the following:    

Speedplay® Zero pedals and cleats.
Shoes that have the standard 3-hole pattern for fixing cleats (Speedplay 4-hole pattern will not work).
Shoes that have at least one strap (shoes with only lacing will be difficult to fit).
An ANT+ compatible bike computer or smartphone that can receive and understand ANT+ power and cadence.











Installation is as simple as changing your cleats. When fitting your cleats to your shoes just use the Zone DPMX sensor plate instead of the Speedplay® black plastic adapter plate, and slide the Zone DPMX base onto your front shoe strap. You're done!    
It’s a simple swap – leave out the Speedplay adapter plates and use the Zone DPMX sensor plates instead. Moving the power meter to a new pair of shoes is just as easy. 

























We've put a lot of time and resources into getting the Zone DPMX to a finished design and preparing it for production, but we need your help to get it over the line and deliver it.    
Almost all the production tooling and samples are completed and tested. The electronic boards, the plastic enclosures, and the software are complete, and pre-production samples have been in test for more than a year. During that time a major focus of our work was on design improvements to the force sensor plate, and now we are working on some refinements to the production tooling and processes associated with that part of the power meter.
All product development and production preparation to date is fully paid for. Your contributions will be used to fund the final tooling adjustments, final production planning, and to manufacture your Zone DPMX power meter.

story:
PiCO is the first compact, portable device to measure a full range of harmful substances in the air. Just plug PiCO into your phone and instantly get real-time updates on the air around you.

  • It sniffs out PM10 and PM2.5 fine dust
  • It detects VOCs (Volatile Organic Compounds)
  • It measures CO₂eq (Carbon dioxide) concentrations
  • It even tells you the temperature and humidity

 

 

PiCO works indoors and out, and also connects to global AQI databases, to give you a bigger picture on air quality

 

 

PiCO is small. Really small. Smaller than a surgical mask, PiCO is powered by your smartphone and will quickly sniff and analyze the room and also give you general weather predictions based on your phone’s GPS. Alternatively, PiCO can connect to an external battery and link up with any smart device via Bluetooth.

Being so small has its advantages. PiCO can easily slip into a handbag, backpack or even phone case for quick and easy scans of your immediate surroundings.

 

We’ve selected the best and most accurate air quality sensors for PiCO.

Laser Particle Sensor: PiCO's laser-based particle sensor is far more accurate than cheap, dull LED sensors, ensuring accurate measurement of fine dust (PM2.5 and PM10) in the air. These small particles are among the most dangerous and difficult forms of air pollution to protect yourself against. PM2.5 particles (just 0.0025mm in size) are so small they get through most masks and window seals.

MEMS Metal-oxide Gas Sensor: MEMS is the industry standard for detecting potentially harmful gases in the air. PiCO senses Volatile Organic Compounds (VOCs) released by cleaning agents, paints, and carpets, flooring, and even your family! The MEMS sensor picks up any trace of Acetone, methanol, ethanol, and other harmful compounds in the air.

High levels of VOCs in the air can have an impact on general comfort and well-being, as well as taking a toll on cognitive abilities.

The MEMS Metal-oxide Gas sensing element is first class when it comes to real-world application. It has long-term stability and a low drift (meaning 1 will always be 1). It’s also protected against dust and water making it extremely robust and durable.

CMOSens® Sensor: When professionals need to measure temperature and humidity, they trust CMOSens®. So we do too.

 

We’ve partnered with BreezoMeter a world leading air pollution AQI (air quality index), which lets us forecast outdoor air quality and weather by collecting big data from satellites, weather stations and traffic control centers.

In addition, we’re excited to fully support IFTTT. Which means PiCO can interact with smart home appliances such as humidifiers, air purifiers, and air conditioners and fully automate air quality levels in your home.

Let’s say PiCO forecasts a wave of pollution coming in late afternoon. It’ll let you air purifier know when to switch into high gear and keep things clear. As soon as the cloud passes, PiCO will detect that the air in the room is a little dry and balance things out with a nearby smart humidifier.

 

 

Our app connects to PiCO via Bluetooth so you can monitor, track and analyze every speck of dust in the air around you.

PiCO doesn’t have to be with you to keep you updated. You can check real-time air quality levels from anyone registered with the app. This means you’ll be able to launch the PiCO app and monitor levels in your living room from the office at any time.

  • Forecasts on outdoor air quality and weather
  • Monitors air pollution levels locally and all over the world
  • Remotely check what PiCO is picking up back at home or the office.
  • Measure Fine particles(PM2.5/10), Temperature & Humidity, VOCs, and Equivalent CO₂
  • Public data: Fine particles(PM2.5/10), Temperature & Humidity, UV index, Ozone

 

Now, more than ever, people are becoming more concerned about the air quality in and around their homes and offices. While smoking levels have decreased, we are only now becoming aware of the dangers of other pollutants from industry, automobiles and energy production. According to Google, search volumes for “air quality” and “air purifier” were the highest ever in early 2017 and don’t show signs of slowing down.

If you’re lucky enough to live in a city that isn't living under a cloud of smog, PiCO is still here to help you out around the home.

Kitchen 

Sometimes we can get wrapped up in the madness of putting together a last minute meal. PiCO is your kitchen companion and will monitor the air for any harmful gases and alert you when you need to turn on ventilation. 

Bedroom

 Bedrooms (especially apartments) can be small and feel cramped, especially for couples. PiCO will tell you when CO₂ levels creep up too high and tell you to open a window and get some fresh air.

Garage

 The garage is usually home to a variety of paints, chemicals, and tools. It’s important to have a device like PiCO monitor the air with MEMS for any silent VOCs in the air. These could be from poorly sealed chemicals or an idle engine that isn’t properly ventilated.

 

Step 1: Connect to smartphone (or external battery)

Step 2: Power on and PiCO will give you an immediate visual reading of your room with an multi-color LED.

Step 3: Launch the PiCO app for more detailed information and tips

 

*Only powered by OTG supported phones

 

 

 

 

In 2017, Seoul, South Korea recorded its worst air quality readings in history. It was briefly the most polluted city in the world. Schools shut down, and people locked themselves indoors. Despite these precautions, they were unsure of when the pollution would clear or if what they were breathing indoors was safe. In many cases, the air inside people’s homes was worse than the air outside… but they had no way to know this, or what to do about it.

 

 

 

Ryan, is CEO at Brilliant & Company and has suffered from chronic allergic rhinitis since he was young. (That means he sneezes a lot.) Being personally affected by the effects of poor air quality was all Ryan needed to bring PiCO to life.

 

 

FAQ

Q. Where is PiCO developed and manufactured?

A. PiCO was designed at HIT(Hanyang Institute of Technology) and manufactured in Seoul, South Korea.

Q. Does PiCO require an external power supply?

A. Yes. PiCO does not have an internal battery. It needs to be plugged into a smartphone, external battery, or an adapter of 5V 1A or lower connected by a USB cable.

Q. Can a PiCO device be connected to multiple smartphones at the same time?

A. No. A PiCO device can only be connected to one smartphone at a time. However, you can register other users on the same PiCO app and check what PiCO is picking up in real-time from anywhere.

Q. Can I use the PiCO app without a PiCO device?

A. Yes. Even without a PiCO device, you can still check air quality, weather information , and forecasts on the PiCO app

Q. Can I use the PiCO anywhere in the world?

A. Yes. PiCO connects to satellites and weather stations all around the world. This gives you the power to check air quality anywhere in the world at any time.

Q. Does PiCO keep working even if the Bluetooth connection drops out?

A. Yes. The sensor still works even if the Bluetooth is disconnected. PiCO will let you know what’s happening via the multicolored LED indicator on either side of the device.

Q. The PM 2.5/10 levels measured through PiCO are different from the ones I can see online. Why?

A. PiCO measures air quality in your immediate location in real time. So, the levels may differ from what you see online.

Q. Can I use PiCO’s readings for medical purposes?

A. No. The PiCO APP offers air quality information and well-being guides, but it is not a medical device. The PiCO device and app cannot be used for any diagnosis, treatment, or prevention of a disease or medical condition.

Q. Is the PiCO app going to receive updates?

A. Yes. The PiCO app is expected to be upgraded over time in order to maintain a high level of accuracy and usability for our backers.

Q. Where does the other air quality and environmental information come from?

A. This information comes from governmental institutions such as Korea Environment Corporation, and from global big-data service providers.

Q. Can I use another USB cable other than the one included in the box?

A. No. PiCO can only be powered through the provided USB cable. Every PiCO includes 3 Cables (C to C, C to micro-B, and C to Lightning).

Q. I am using a phone that is not supported by OTG. Can I still use PiCO?

A. You can still power PiCO with a power bank or through an adapter with a 1A to Type-C connection.

 

What we’ve done before and where we’re going.

Over the last two and a half years, it has been our first priority to develop products that create healthy living environments and arm people with the information to keep their family safe.

Back in October 2016, we launched our first product ‘Akee’ a smart air quality monitor. We were stunned by its success as it was immediately snapped up by thousands of customers who share our vision.

We’ve listened to feedback from the very beginning and are extremely excited to deliver PiCO. We’re aiming to ship PiCO worldwide in April this year.

 

Risk & Challenges

We’re confident that we will deliver a high quality device and are on track to do so according to our timeline. However, even the most well-planned campaigns can meet some unexpected speed bumps.

As PiCO is powered by smartphones, those that don’t support OTG (On-The-Go) may have some trouble connecting. Since Apple’s change to lightning cables for iPhones and iPads, OTG is not an authorized Apple MFI process. Therefore power supply from Apple products may be unstable.

Accurate measurements of ambient temperature and humidity require extensive debugging and testing, which may take some extra time to get right.

The Android and iOS companion apps will be vigorously tested and upgraded to deliver an intuitive user experience. We’ll listen to feedback from users, and make adjustments accordingly.

 

Shipping

International backers: PiCO will ship worldwide. Please note that you will be responsible for duties, fees and taxes applicable to your region.

Estimated delivery:  While we do not expect major issues, the estimated shipment date may shift a month or two. We will update backers as soon as ship dates are confirmed or if they change.

Warranty: We stand firmly behind our products. Each PiCO includes a 7-day (after you receive it) money back guarantee, and a 1-year limited warranty.

Support: Need help? If you have any questions, during or after the campaign has closed, you can reach us at cs@brilcom.com

We will continue working hard to ensure that we deliver our backers a low-risk, high-quality product on time.

story:
To be blunt—your bath towel isn't doing your hair any favors. 

So, we created a better one. Meet the most thoughtfully engineered towel, made for your healthiest hair yet.

Say goodbye to breakage, frizz, and dullness.

 

Sometimes it can feel like you need a thousand products and an entirely new routine to get the hair of your dreams. We prefer to take it back to the basics. How are you treating your wet hair?

Before buying any other products, start with assessing your towel.   

A quick throwback to chemistry 101:

Your hair is made of proteins (called keratin) bonded together. These protein-to-protein bonds are super strong! But when your hair is wet, water penetrates into these bonds, weakening them. Weaker bonds = greater opportunity for damage. Plus, the extra weight of the water stretches your hair out. 

Removing water quickly and efficiently (especially before brushing or blow drying!) keeps your hair from breaking. 

The most important time to take care of your hair is immediately after stepping out of the shower.

​

 

Using a quick dry towel dramatically shortens your dry time...and the less time your hair is wet, the less damage to your hair. When you blow dry your hair, a shorter dry time also means less heat damage. Score.

The VOLO Hero improves your hair-care routine while working along with every product you have at home. 

Keep doing what you’re doing, just do it better.

​

 

 

Regular bath towels are rough on your hair, which causes friction (read: damage and breakage). Plus, heavy bath towels tend to topple off and yank your hair out, which is as annoying as it is dangerous for your hair. 

That's where the VOLO Hero comes in-- It’s plush, absorbent and extremely gentle on your locks. Creating a towel that was extremely gentle on hair was our first priority. 

After all, the math speaks for itself. Less water damage + less frizz + less exposure to heat = wins all-around. 

 

Incredibly Soft

Did we mention it’s PLUSH? Sayonara, frizz. Hello, comfort. It's like a baby blanket for your head. Seriously. It's that soft.

​

Superior Absorbency

Our thick, dense material quickly absorbs more water than other hair towels leading to a faster dry time. In our trials, our towel was able to absorb 10 TIMES its own weight in water. 

Easy to use

Other hair towels use buttons to fasten into place and are not adjustable for head size or hair type. Fixed button + fixed head pocket = one size fits all towel (and surprise, one size doesn’t fit all when it comes to hair!). Not to mention that buttons leave you fumbling to find the most efficient angle.

Our snug strap allows the towel to stretch and form a custom fit. Plus, it's a cinch to secure so you don't have to fuss. It's easy like Sunday morning.

​

Generous Sizing

At 39.4 x 23.5 inches, our towels are longer and wider than the average hand towel or hair towel. In other words, no matter your head size or hair length, The VOLO Hero has got you covered.

We designed our towel with intention from start to finish. Unlike the average bath towel, the Hero is made from extremely lightweight material, which means it won’t tip over, fall off, or weigh you down. Plus, as the VOLO Hero is larger than other hair towels on the market, it's made to fit a wider diversity of heads and hair types without unfurling. 

No more constantly rebalancing, and no more neck pain. Once you twist and tuck the towel, the snug strap stretches to accommodate the base of any head, comfortably wrapping to secure the towel.

Put on makeup, get dressed, practice yoga, cook breakfast, send emails, chase your kids...continue conquering the world. 

​

 

 ​

We are a beauty-tech startup based in San Diego, California focused on creating the most innovative and useful products for hair styling and hair health. Throughout our experience in the beauty industry, we’ve seen thousands of products hit the shelves. When it came to hair towels, we saw opportunity for improvement and decided it was time to step it up. 

The VOLO Hero is the first in our series of innovative products that improve hair health while also allowing the user to continue their lives uninterrupted. We believe products should offer creative advancement and work for the consumer (stay tuned for the world’s first Cordless Hair Dryer, coming later this summer!).

With 25 years in beauty distribution, Ryan (left) has seen it all. After watching his wife struggle with hair towel after hair towel, extremely disappointed, Ryan realized the quick dry towel was ready for innovation. Jonathan (right), his friend and engineer, joined Ryan to help bring this product to life by testing dozens of prototypes before getting it just right. And once the VOLO Hero fit these big noggins, we knew we were on to something!

 

 

Below are shipping costs organized by region. If you do not see your home country on this list, and would like to know shipping costs before the end of our campaign, feel free to send us a message and we will get back to you with an estimate ASAP!

If you are located in the US: 
One towel - $4.88 USD
Two towels - $9.88 USD
Three towels - $12.88 USD
Five towels - $16.88 USD 

If you are located in Canada: 
One towel - $12.74 USD
Two towels - $17.06 USD 
Three towels - $19.38 USD 
Five towels - $22.19 USD 

If you are located in Australia, New Zealand, Denmark, Ireland, Italy, Norway or Switzerland: 
One towel - $15.66 USD 
Two towels - $24.75 USD 
Three towels - $30.45 USD 
Five towels - $35.41 USD 

If you are located in China, Hong Kong, India, Malaysia, Mexico, Singapore, Ukraine, United Arab Emirates: 
One towel - $13.53 USD 
Two towels - $23.57 USD 
Three towels - $30.47 USD 
Five towels - $37.90 USD 

If you are located in Czech Republic, France, Germany, Luxembourg, Netherlands, Sweden, United Kingdom: 
One towel - $11.39 USD 
Two towels - $17.58 USD 
Three towels - $22.52 USD 
Five towels - $28.56 USD

In our trials, our towel was able to absorb 10 TIMES its own weight in water. Easy to useOther hair towels use buttons to fasten into place and are not adjustable for head size or hair type. Fixed button + fixed head pocket = one size fits all towel (and surprise, one size doesn’t fit all when it comes to hair!). Not to mention that buttons leave you fumbling to find the most efficient angle.Our snug strap allows the towel to stretch and form a custom fit. Plus, it's a cinch to secure so you don't have to fuss. It's easy like Sunday morning.​Generous SizingAt 39.4 x 23.5 inches, our towels are longer and wider than the average hand towel or hair towel. In other words, no matter your head size or hair length, The VOLO Hero has got you covered.We designed our towel with intention from start to finish. Unlike the average bath towel, the Hero is made from extremely lightweight material, which means it won’t tip over, fall off, or weigh you down. Plus, as the VOLO Hero is larger than other hair towels on the market, it's made to fit a wider diversity of heads and hair types without unfurling. No more constantly rebalancing, and no more neck pain. Once you twist and tuck the towel, the snug strap stretches to accommodate the base of any head, comfortably wrapping to secure the towel.Put on makeup, get dressed, practice yoga, cook breakfast, send emails, chase your kids...continue conquering the world. ​ 
 ​
We are a beauty-tech startup based in San Diego, California focused on creating the most innovative and useful products for hair styling and hair health. Throughout our experience in the beauty industry, we’ve seen thousands of products hit the shelves. When it came to hair towels, we saw opportunity for improvement and decided it was time to step it up. 
The VOLO Hero is the first in our series of innovative products that improve hair health while also allowing the user to continue their lives uninterrupted. We believe products should offer creative advancement and work for the consumer (stay tuned for the world’s first Cordless Hair Dryer, coming later this summer!).

With 25 years in beauty distribution, Ryan (left) has seen it all. After watching his wife struggle with hair towel after hair towel, extremely disappointed, Ryan realized the quick dry towel was ready for innovation. Jonathan (right), his friend and engineer, joined Ryan to help bring this product to life by testing dozens of prototypes before getting it just right. And once the VOLO Hero fit these big noggins, we knew we were on to something!

 

 

Below are shipping costs organized by region. If you do not see your home country on this list, and would like to know shipping costs before the end of our campaign, feel free to send us a message and we will get back to you with an estimate ASAP!
If you are located in the US: One towel - $4.88 USDTwo towels - $9.88 USDThree towels - $12.88 USDFive towels - $16.88 USD 
If you are located in Canada: One towel - $12.74 USDTwo towels - $17.06 USD Three towels - $19.38 USD Five towels - $22.19 USD 
If you are located in Australia, New Zealand, Denmark, Ireland, Italy, Norway or Switzerland: One towel - $15.66 USD Two towels - $24.75 USD Three towels - $30.45 USD Five towels - $35.41 USD 
If you are located in China, Hong Kong, India, Malaysia, Mexico, Singapore, Ukraine, United Arab Emirates: One towel - $13.53 USD Two towels - $23.57 USD Three towels - $30.47 USD Five towels - $37.90 USD 
If you are located in Czech Republic, France, Germany, Luxembourg, Netherlands, Sweden, United Kingdom: One towel - $11.39 USD Two towels - $17.58 USD Three towels - $22.52 USD Five towels - $28.56 USD

story:
Please help us raise funds to support our Spiked Spin flagship studio coming to one of the most culturally iconic neighborhoods, Bed-Stuy, Brooklyn!

Since 2016 we have been adding our flavor to the bland boutique fitness industry, providing a wellness experience for those who Insult the Standard. Our mission is to improve the health narrative for underserved groups while diversifying the industry, but we need your help to do it! Join the Spiked movement and help us bring our flagship studio to life by donating now!

Why We Need Your Support

We're so close to providing the Spiked experience that our community deserves! 

Opening a flagship location in New York is no small feat! To this point, all efforts of the brand have been bootstrap funded by our founder Briana Owens, however, to provide the experience our community deserves, WE NEED YOU!  

While the lease has been secured, to make our flagship studio a reality, we need to raise an additional $5,000 to support the build out. The funds will be used for:

- Cycling Bikes

- Required Sound Proofing

- Spiked Spin Sign

- Sound Equipment

- Studio Design & Decor

Our Impact

Our founder Briana Owens is committed to debunking the negative stigmas surrounding generational health and wellness in minority communities. Her love for fitness coupled with a deeply rooted desire to see more people of color engaging in healthy living practices has been the foundation of the unwavering efforts that Spiked Spin has achieved to this point!

- Cultivated a community of over 3,000 riders in New York City

- Featured in the Nike Unsung Heroes campaign

- Featured in the Beats by Dre Power Beats 3 campaign

- Hosted sponsored community rides with Nike for student athletes, non-profit organizations, and New York City influencers in New York City

- Hosted community rides with non-profit organizations: Big Brother Big Sister, Friends of the Children, Kicks 4 the City and Hair on Purpose in New York City

- Hosted community rides with non-profit organization, DC Parks & Recreation in Washington, D.C.

- Partnered with Broccoli City Festival to host the first ever cycling experience during the BC Fest 5K in Washington, D.C.

- Partnered with Thale Blanc to host a fundraiser series for the LadyLike Foundation in Los Angeles, CA

- Hosted Corporate Rides for: Essence, BET, Complex, Snapchat, Jordan Brand, Jet

- Hosted Promotional Rides for: Disney Last Jedi film release, Proud Mary film release, Victory Lap album release

Follow us on social @SpikedSpin to stay up to date on our growth!

T H A N K  Y O U ! ! !
